Reviews.Title: “Rome Trip”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week in this hotel in late March 2012. Going to a city that you do not know means that choice of accomodation is always something of a lottery. This Hotel is an excellent choice, at all levels, for anyone who wants a short, or long stay in Rome. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast will suit all tastes with a superb choice of food. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: JfdII
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the week leading up to Easter. Very nice staff who paid attention to our needs. Clean and bright rooms. Could leave the "windows" open at night. Metro is right around the corner as are a couple of nice restaruants we ate at. As a place to hang our hat after touring the city all day worked for us! Breadfast was excellent! Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shr0pshirelad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in March 2012, after having to check out of our initial accomodation due to the poor state we found the hotel in..... we had a very courteous and pleasant check-in We had a wonderful Room on the 5th floor, spacious bathroom with huge deep bath ! a large omfortable bed, big TV and stereo system..... our room was decorated to a very high standard and serviced daily... the breakfast menu was excellent, the staff very friendly, and the hotel had a very well stocked bar, at excellent prices, with superb staff. Nibbles were laid on every evening for guests. Plenty of decent local venues to wine and dine in, and close to 2 x metro stops make it acessible to the whole city We both really enjoyed our staye here and have already recommended it to other friends visiting rome in the future definitely worth paying that little bot more for !!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and the room.”
Reviews.Author: Jackal2221
Reviews.Content: Our family had 3 nights here and we loved the great location. Nearest Metro is just around the block and 1 stop from Termini which links the 2 lines. We were welcomed by friendly staff who told us about the complimentary snacks in the bar from 4pm until 11pm which were a hit with our tired and hungry kids after a long drive. Bar prices were excellent and the atmosphere was nice and relaxing. The room was large with a big 4 poster bed plus 2 full size single beds for the kids. Free wifi also handy. Only downside was no minibar fridge in the room, making it inconvenient if you felt like a cold drink during the night. Buffet breakfast was good with friendly waiters looking after our every need. One in particular remembered our kids preferences for drinks which was a nice touch. Overall a great experience and definitely recommend for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Excellent service!!”
Reviews.Author: 688SusanL688
Reviews.Content: Modern clean rooms, excellent service by desk clerks. During my stay I bruised my ankle at the Forum Romanum and the friendly desk clerk provided a wheel chair so we were able to have another great day in the city of Rome. I will return to this hotel, also because of their fresh and excellent breakfast buffet!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for 3 Star rating”
Reviews.Author: Corporatemonkey57
Reviews.Content: Nice room, nice people, good breakfast buffet and well located for Termini. Will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel deserves more than 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: veron020
Reviews.Content: Do not be put off by the 3 star ratings. Probably due to it not providing an evening meal and having no swimming pool. This hotel is exceptional for a 3 star. Beautifully decorated, well staffed, excellent rooms, 1st class breakfast, buffet style. Close to the main train and bus terminus also.

Reviews.Title: “Didnt stay in the hotel, however...”
Reviews.Author: uktigs
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had gotten ourselves extremely lost and didnt even know the name of our hotel (give me the 'dunce' hat, i know), with a flat battery on the mobile were unable to access our emails. Finally we walked in to the Best Western and the very lovely staff aloud us to use their guests computer to get back on track, saved us walking around clueless for a further 2 hours :) what i did see of the hotel was amazing

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: sue b
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canada was a great choice, clean, clean,staff was helpful and very nice.Rooms were good size. breakfast was wonderful.lots of choices . they did eggs special, as sunnyside up.......

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: pieater
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in a great location, only 5 mins walk (or less) from the Termini you have easy access to both bus and rail networks to travel around Rome. Like many others who have reviewed, we stayed for a short break in a deluxe room with breakfast, and found both fantastic. A full size bath (a real luxury for those used to visiting European cities) and shower, with comfortable and clean beds in a good sized room was a real treat. The breakfast was self service and tried to cater for most tastes from English breakfast(ish) to pastries, fruit and cereal. Staff were helpful and polite. The only caveat is how early people start work in Rome, particularly scaffolders (7:15am), so it's definitely worth closing the window and using air-con if required at night. That said this is certainly somewhere I would wholeheartedly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “This is top class”
Reviews.Author: IanCulbertson
Reviews.Content: A delightful experience. My wife and I stayed for 4 nights in late February early March in a deluxe room with breakfast. The interior design of all areas of the hotel is first class. All the staff are friendly and helpful. The breakfast is self service and is continental and English breakfast and a great range of food for all. The public areas bar and lounge could not be better and the bar prices are cheap for central Rome. Free snacks . The hotel is spotlessly clean and has a small range of papers and a good selection of books available. The room safes are in the wall behind pictures! Toiletries and slippers provided. Not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Quinns24
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed in Hotel Canada, last time 7 years ago. It is still a fantastic hotel. Close to the Underground and Termini when you arrive, clean and great value for money. But best of all is the ambience of the place. The staff are so friendly and helpful and it is such a lovely, relaxing hotel where you are made to feel welcome. Highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location !!”
Reviews.Author: William M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 5 days May 2011, hotel is excellent, location is superb , our room was a suite and very spacious with comfortable bed. Hotel staff very professional and we experienced only the best of Roman hospitality during our stay. I have stayed there on 2 other occasions and always recommend hotel to anyone staying in Roma. We will use Hotel Canada on our next visit to Roma. Grazie Pucci family!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money. Spacious room and close to metro”
Reviews.Author: Meg L
Reviews.Content: Staying in the hotel in early Oct 2011 for 6 nights after the cruise. The room is very spacious, clean and the bed is very comfortable. We booked this hotel because of the positive feedback on this website and we didn’t disappointed at all. It’s about 5 minutes walk to metro Castro Pretorio station or 15 minutes walk to Termini railway station. There are two supermarkets locate near the hotel and few restaurants around the area. The meals in the restaurants around the hotel is much better value than those you can find near the main tourist attraction like Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. There is no tea or coffee making facilities in the room but they can bring the facilities to you if you request for it but it depends on availability. We request for it upon arrival. Luckily, they sent the tea and coffee facilities to us on the 2nd day of our stay. The room is surprisingly spacious and has a samll balcony. I really love the bed in our room, it’s so comfortable. I also love the stereo system in the room. As we brought some music CDs with us, we could play our favourite songs in the room. The good thing is they have microphone connect to the bathroom, we listened to the songs while enjoying the bath, too. Breakfast is Ok but nothing surprising. Free internet service is also available. Overall I really like this hotel which is value for money and would stay here again if I come back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sean H
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Hotel Canada a number of times over the past twelve years. We were back last week for the first time in almost three years, The Canada is as good as we remember. It is family run (Pucci family) and many of the staff are still there since we first went the in 2000. While there I was celebrating a significant birthday (one with a zero at the end) and the reception staff must have noticed when entering my passport details. Apart from being wished Happy Birthday first thing on the morning a Bottle of Prosecco, chocolates and a gift were left in our room. I suppose this is what sums up the Canada management and staff: attention to detail in very comfortable surroundings. The rooms and public areas are very well decorated spotlessly clean. The rooms are very spacious and well furnished with mostly antique free standing furniture. A number of the "superior rooms" are laid out Suite style with a separate sitting area from the bedroom. The buffet breakfast is great with pleny of choice to set you up for the day. Snacks can be had in the bar during the day. In the evening a choice of cold snacks are available free in the bar. Prices in the bar are excellent and it is very relaxing if all you want is a quiet drink or a coffee. The hotel is close to Termini station. This is very convenient for the express train and buses from the airport as well as it being the intersection of Rome's two Metro lines. To walk to the Canada from Termini find your way the Termini exit on Via Marsala. Look for a Catholic Church across the street and Via Vicenza runs along the side of the church. A number of bus routes also start/terminate in front of Termini and will enable you to get to many parts of Rome quite easily. Nearer the hotel on Piazza Independenza is the terminus for two useful busses, the 75 which will bring you to Trastevere via the Colosseum and the 85 which also goes to the Forum and Colosseum. The quickest way from the hotel to the Colosseum is to take the metro from Castro Pretoria station which is beside the hotel. Some guidebooks will warn you about staying near Termini. Don't be put off by this in relation to Canada's location. In all the times we have stayed we have never had the slightest problem. The area around the Canada has a number of Government Ministries, consulates , a University, hospital and a large police station and so there a large number of Italian workers on the streets and using the bars and restaurants. In fact we feel much safer in this area of Rome than in many parts of other European or North American cities that we have visited. The Canada is a real gem. While it is three star the accommodation and service are far better than some five star establishments I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place! Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: PilarVM
Reviews.Content: Clean, big, charming room, bathroom is spacious, safe in the room, extremely courteous service, great breakfast choice - this hotel made our visit to Rome very comfortable and memorable. We chose this based on the great reviews here in TripAdvisor and we are happy to add our own opinion - it's a great find! We stayed there in June 2010. Very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Would visit again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: Jroy32
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for a couple of nights back in August, and we all absolutely loved this place! The location was great! In a quieter area of Rome and only a short walk away from the subway. The staff in the lobby were very friendly and helped us plan our itinerary. The rooms were very nice and spacious, and the breakfasts were great. It was always nice to come back from jam packed, site seeing day and have a nice cold beer at the bar! On a side not, I loved the old fashioned elevator in the hotel! I would definitely recommend this hotel and will come back when I visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: frantica
Reviews.Content: Everyone likes different things in a hotel. This one suits me perfectly. The rooms are spacious and well-appointed. The staff is friendly but perfectly willing to leave you alone should you, as do I, prefer it. The breakfast is good and should be sufficient to get you through to dinner with only a snack for lunch. The hotel bar serves drinks at very reasonable prices, along with free appetizers in the evening. The location, for me, is perfect. It is close enough to walk from Termini (about 5 blocks) and there is another metro stop just around the corner (Castro Pretorio). This allows you to come and go as you please throughout the day using the all-day public transit ticket. The environs are quiet at night and on weekends with little or no evidence of the sketchy conditions that can occur closer to Termini. Free wi-fi is a nice plus too. The only suggestion I could make is that the coffee with breakfast could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Really good - We'll be back !”
Reviews.Author: Rog_Enfield
Reviews.Content: We had a lot of Air Miles and decided to blow them on a trip to Rome in January. Choosing a hotel is important, and after researching Trip Advisor decided on Hotel Canada. Firstly, I want to say that there are absolutely no regrets about this choice. Other reviews are almost spot-on. Location. Hotel Canada is about 10 minutes walk from Termini rail and bus station. You could take the Metro for one stop, but it's really not worth it. If you are disabled or have mobility problems, you should be aware that the walk from Termini involves some cobbled streets and very uneven pavements. You should not think that this hotel is very close to the major tourist sites, it's not. However they are not far. The Historic areas (Colosseum, Forum, Trevi, Pantheon etc) are about 25 or so minutes walk. Getting there is ok, it's downhill, but coming back is of course uphill. I lost a few pounds in weight over three days walking ! The Castro Pretorio metro station almost outside the hotel, and the Rome metro is easy to use. Any one journey costs €1 and an all day ticket is €4, great value. Get on the train at Castro Pretorio, get off a few minutes later at Colosseo which is right at The Colosseum. The front desk staff of the hotel are really very good, polite, helpful, informative, and very happy to answer questions no matter how silly. In the lobby of the hotel was a pad of large city maps. Just tear one off, fold it and off you go ! Really useful. Rooms are classical Italian style. Large conventional beds (very comfy !) tiled floors. Some furniture, TV, CD Player. Good bathroom, WC, Bidet, Bath/Shower, good selection of toiletries, and disposable slippers ! There were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, but this is normal in Italy and most of continental Europe. Our room was 526 on the 5th Floor. The lift is interesting and takes a bit of getting used to. It's an old fashioned type with gates that you have to pull open, but the gate to go in is not the same as the gate to get out ! Great fun. Although our room overlooked a very busy street, there was almost no noise due to very good sound insulation. We didn’t use the bar, but breakfast is very good. The best thing is that it is available until 10.30am, very civilized ! Good selection of cheeses, cold meats, pastries, fruit and some hot items usually eggs and ham or bacon of sorts. There is no restaurant in the hotel, but there are plenty of places very nearby. Ristorante 3 Arches just around the corner is good. I cannot comment on cost or value for money, the hotel was included in the flights and hotel Air Miles package. Overall we were really very happy, and recommend this hotel. My wife is already saying that she wants to go back to Rome to see more. If or when we do, Hotel Canada will be top of the list.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: Ron B
Reviews.Content: Family of four with two kids ages 8 &10. Stayed in the quadruple room and it offered very spacious bathroom and living area. Clean, nice quite, good location with easy access to both metro and central train station. Hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet has so many food options and variety. For quick dinner you must try the small pizza place parlor the street toward the train station. The owner makes fresh pizzas loaded with fresh toppings and you can buy by the slice to sit or to go. This hotel is very highly recommended, we will definitely use again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travelling-Canu... S
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place to come to straight off the plane. The room was beautiful and clean, bed was comfortable, breakfast was excellent. The immediate area was not very charming, and we didn't find any good nearby restaurants for the foodies amongst our party of three couples ranging from 30's to 70's (the restaurant just down the road recommended by the person at the front desk was not great). However we were there only 2 nights before moving to another part of Rome. The hotel was close to the train station. If you like long walks, you can see a lot by foot from here.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and convenient”
Reviews.Author: capeys
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel without many frills. Staff were friendly. Most outstanding feature was the breakfast. I would go back. Although I booked it partly because it was close to a Metro, it turned out to be more convenient to just walk to Termini and back. Lots of eating places and shops in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms and delicious breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda G
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what my partner and I needed after a 26 hour flight. Comfortable, close to the train station and a good spot to see the sights of Rome. The breakfast was truly delicious with a buffet of fresh fruits, pastry and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Trust me!”
Reviews.Author: mr19846
Reviews.Content: Loved it! We stayed at Rome a couple of nights, spending new year´s eve. For the italian standard, room was spaciuous. Bathroom good. The bed was soooo confortable. Breakfast was perfect, fresh products. What I loved from this hotel is that is near to train station (but not located in a ugly neighborhood, which is usual in Italy for those near "Stazioni"). CI and CO were fast, gentleman of front desk very attentive. Remember that local accommodation tax must be pay when Checking Out. Only thing to complain is that you may hear sounds from other rooms... obviously, walls are not sound proof.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: sleepyjuli
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Hotel Canada in late October 2011. It's spotlessly clean, quiet and comfortable. We had a lovely stay. We had a family room which consisted of a large bedroom with a queen bed and a hallway where they arranged two twin beds. The hallway was a little snug because of the beds, but the bedroom was spacious. The bathroom however is small and the shower has very low water pressure. It didn't bother my parents but for me it was a pain to wash my hair. There is free breakfast in the morning and they also have a happy hour with free snacks in the afternoon. Wifi is free throughout the hotel and it worked well. There's also a computer in the lobby for the guests. The elevator is very old and it doesn't hold many people, but we were on the second floor so we mostly used the stairs. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We came and left Rome by train so it was great to be able to walk to Termini and not need a taxi. The hotel is also very close to two subway stations. If you enjoy walking however you can go to many attractions by foot. Next time I'm in Rome I will definitely stay at Hotel Canada again.

Reviews.Title: “great first impression of rome.”
Reviews.Author: gacloutier
Reviews.Content: this was the last hotel we stayed at during our 2 week visit and should have been our first. The service was excellent, the room lovely and the location was central to transportation as well in a area of the city where most of the surrounding amenities spoke english. The breakfast was excellent, bar none the best we had during our entire trip. That doesn't sound like a big deal but we found the food in italy not what we were expecting at all so this was a great surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, nice location, good value”
Reviews.Author: gezgin_dromedary
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Best Western Canada Hotel between 9 November and 13 November 2011. The Hotel is located within 6-7 minutes walking distance from the Termini station. The rooms are very clean, large and comfortable. In case you prefer more quiet rooms, ask for rooms which overlook Via Vicenza rather than the noisy avenue which runs perpendicular to Via Vicenza. The only setback was the alleged 'misunderstanding' of the receptionist who first told us that we can have late check-out at 2pm, but then changed his mind and insisted that we should immediately vacate the room at 12 o'clock. So my suggestion for hotel guests would be to request a written late check-out confirmation in case they need any! Overall, a very good experience, and I would like to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I am glad to choose TripAdvisor Recommendation for Family”
Reviews.Author: Rashdan R
Reviews.Content: Look for value for money in Italian cities during family is tough and there is where i turn to TripAdvisor for reviews.This time was spot on and really stand up to its rank.Just 10mins walk to Rome Termini and 5 mins walk to nearest Metro station.We ask for family room ,we got 1 double and one single room.The hotel is classical yet up to date . Breakfast room might be bit small but adequate with the crowd at that time. The lounge is a cozy place after a long day sight seeing Rome.This is one of the best hotel as part of our Italian Spring Break

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mefoley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nightst and enjoyed every part of this hotel! EverythIng about the hotel was charming my husband loved the elevator the breakfast the little terrace in our room! The hotel staff was always friendly and never had anything but a welcome greeting to us! We're in Florence now and we miss our hotel in Roma! Don't be discouraged at the fact it's not close to a major site because the metro is so close and we used it to get to everything! As well as the termini is so close if your traveling to other cities like we were! We can't say enough good things! Also tons of restaurants that we LOVED near by!!!

Reviews.Title: “As others state, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZEBRAQUEEN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Canada, late October 2011 for 6 nights...my decison was from trip advisor reviews and the location and price point. It was a great choice...just as stated by other reviewers,,,,clean, clean, spotless..staff was great, helpful and very nice.rooms were good size...b athrooms nice, amenities good...very good....the bar was great! and the great edwin! breakfast was wonderful..lots of choices + they did eggs special, as sunnyside up, etc..good location to walk to termini, to pick up buses or depart....nice area, good restaurants..can not go wrong...happy we stayed here..should we return to Rome would stay again...Thank you everyone at the Hotel Canada!..Virginia & Joe...oh, we made it out of Rome that day in the car, thank you for your directions!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Friendly Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Georgie M
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canada is a great hotel which gives extremely good service and makes your stay easy. The rooms are large and with good facilities though they can be too hot at night and if you open the windows (if you are in an outer facing room) it is too noisy. Room Service is free of charge and the Bathroom Accessories are excellent. The hotel has a bar which has extremely cheap drinks (€6 for a bottle of wine and €2 for a beer) and they also have a selection of nibbles free of charge. The breakfast is buffet style and again excellent, great choice of continental and cooked, though a few of the cooked items are different than how they are cooked in the UK! All in all a great experience, the only downside was a lack of air-conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: Capitol Hill
Reviews.Content: The Canada satisfies in every way. The Canada offers an extremely helpful staff, lovely rooms, easy access to buses, subway and trains, not to mention good restaurants within a short stroll. This was our fourth stay, staying in both standard and superior rooms (this time upgraded for our four-night stay to a lovely superior corner room)---but even the standard rooms are well-designed and extremely comfortable. Excellent soundproofing makes for a good sleep. The staff goes out of its way to make your stay special, arranging for our access tothe Borghese Gallery and a car to the airport. We wouldn't stay any place else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rhumbagirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here before a cruise and enjoyed it very much. The room was beautiful, comfortable and close to the Termini which we needed to get to Civitavecchia. Breakfast buffet was the best I've seen, I can't think of anything that wasn't there, from beautiful pastries to eggs and bacon, fruit, juices and yogurts. There is a bar where they serve very affordable drinks along with complimentary snacks. The elevator is an attraction in itself. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great find and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: gillian s
Reviews.Content: Altough not as central as some we could not fault the atmosphere, comfort and cleanliness of this hotel. All the staff were courteous and helpful and after a days sightseeing it was just the place to get back to and relax. Its close to metro stations but for three of us taxis were easier and very reasonable. Just 2 minutes walk away we discovered a wonderful little restaurant called Mama Angelos and after our first visit went back every night. David and his staff were superb and my lasagne was the best Ive eaten

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant find”
Reviews.Author: Siobhan W
Reviews.Content: We had a mid week break at this hotel. The staff we most friendly, courteous and helpful, particularly the front desk and Massimo in the bar. They could not have been better. The rooms where clean well appointed and quiet. The location is very near the train station. It was a little distance to the main attractions but these were easily accessible by taxi which the hotel arranged. The breakfast was of a high standard offering a wide range of foods in a very pleasant environment. After a day hitting the main sites we were glad to escape to the quiet location. Just around the corner was a great Trattoria - Mama Angela's serving great food and offering fantastic service. Look no further for a place to eat!

Reviews.Title: “Great all around hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jakulin
Reviews.Content: Business and proximity brings us to Rome frequently and after much trial and error Best Western Canada gets our vote! I have stayed at this hotel twice and my husband 3 times all within the last 30days (and we are booked in for the next two separate weeks as well) Each time a different room and each experience has been a double thumbs up success! We frequently roll work in to pleasure and stay over the weekend when there is work two weeks back to back. The staff is wonderful. The hotel rooms nicely appointed, each with their own character, and all have been very clean. The price is reasonable (at least this time of year), breakfast is well rounded and included, wifi is complimentary (not at great speed but good for free), and there is a nicely appointed lobby with a small bar with snacks that opens in the evenings. The location is great for walking to and from the Termini (5min) and couldn’t be more ideal for our business needs but it is an extra 10minutes away from some of the main tourist roads and big attractions. This really isn’t a problem; who comes to roam and doesn’t expect to (or wants to) walk this incredible city?! If your feet fail and you can’t stand the thought of walking any further this hotel still works fine because as I said, you are a mere 5min walk from the Termini where you will find the Metro, buses and a taxi line! Now that all the due praise has been given let me layout for you a few of their short-comings (no where is perfect) that we encountered. *There is no water kettle in the room. This may not effect you but being frequent travelers we have become accustom to hot tea on demand as well as enjoying a bit of oatmeal (that we bring ourselves) before, or after, a long day. *The queen bed is simply two twin beds positioned together on a very basic, no frills frame. This is quite common in the whole of Europe but is still uncomfortable for any couple that enjoys sleeping next to each other. *We have twice been given a room with a very narrow bathtub that thankfully had a showerhead on the wall. The problem with the configuration is that the head was in the middle of the tub length so that you had very little space to actually shower and water typically would spill out one side or the other because of where the water hit on the wall… (see pictures) *The internet is slow (especially during peak time) and, depending on your room, you have to be careful where you sit to access it, not all seats in your room are close enough to the signal to use it. But, I say again, it is free and not wired! **The biggest problem we encountered (and continue to encounter) is the complete disregard for the “Do Not Disturb” light and door hang. Although we never had a problem with intrusion while we were in the room every time we would leave for dinner or otherwise they would enter our room and tidy up (once per day) regardless of what kind of notice they were given at the door. You must leave your room key at the front desk when you go out so they are always aware of when you finally vacate the room so they can do their daily cleaning. It is a nice gesture that they REALLY want you to have a clean room but as I said before, we are frequent travelers and sometimes we don’t want to put all of our valuables away and “tidy-up” so the room is viewable to our hosts. Sometimes we just want to pop out for a quick bite and expect that the issued “Do Not Disturb” sign will be respected – sadly, not here. ☹ I could probably ask upon leaving for them not to enter but right now it is the principle of it and it definitely drives me up the wall! So there you have it, my opinion. As a final note when I have visited we were given room 328 which looked over Viale Castro Pretorio. It was nice not to be looking into another building but the room was quite loud when the windows were open. We have also stayed in 112; this is a corner room that looks out over Vicenza and Via Sommacampagna ( I think), this was a little loud in the mornings and in the evening around dinner time but was livable. My husband has stayed in a room that overlooked the shared courtyard and has attested to the dead silence that the location offered but at the same time you risk looking into other rooms and homes as well as loosing almost all natural light because of the further 6 floors above you in every direction. Hope this helped. Enjoy Rome! Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Pertelotte
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of October 2011. It was very convenient for arrivals from Ciampino Airport using the Terravision bus to Termini. It is within walking distance of the main tourist attractions but you need a good map, comfortable shoes and stamina, alternatively use the Metro station round the corner. Our standard room was very pleasant if a little gloomy and spotlessly clean. The bed was particularly comfortable. It was good to relax in the lounge after a long day's sightseeing, bar prices were surprisingly reasonable, however, avoid the toasted sandwiches, they're not very appetizing! The hotel doesn't have a restaurant but there are reasonable places to eat nearby. Breakfasts are good though, plenty of choice but we had to wait in line to be seated a couple of mornings, they were so busy. We found the staff helpful and attentive. Altogether we were very satisfied with our stay here, we'd be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms with good breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: Richard-Roadman
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Terministation is about 10 minutes max and there is a metrostation right around the corner. I wouldn't say that the hotel is at walking distance from the main tourists attractions like colloseum but with the metro they are easily reachable. Staff was ok, but the people we met at the frontdesk were not all that cordial as some other travelers wrote. The rooms were good, spacious and clean, as was the bathroom. There are plenty amenaties provided, besides the usual shampoo or shower/bathgel. Although there is a busy road alongside the hotel it didn't disturb me in my sleep because traffic is really slow at night. Only thing missing in the room is a fridge. Breakfast is very good, buffetstyle with lots of choice in bread/pastries, cheese and meats, yoghurt/cereal. And yes they still have the classic elevator, but it's really an beautiful asset to the whole building. And as my room was on the second floor I didn't have to use it anyway. One strange thing though; we were notified upfront by our reservation that we had to pay a citytax. That isn't very unusual for us but when checking out we had to pay it in cash, while I'm used that it is already taken care of with the roomprice or it's charged onto the roomaccount and you can pay for it (with credit card) when you check out by signing the bill. Now it couldn't be charged to the roomaccount and we weren't given a separate receipt that we actually paid the tax. With this action they gave us some mixed feelings (knowing the state the country is in).

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel for rome”
Reviews.Author: Thekings11
Reviews.Content: stayed here for two nights, service was very good, room very clean and nice.perfect for honeymoon aswell... hotel staff very friendly and helpfull. Breakfast was very goood..... the hotel is right next to super market & Metro station..........perfectoooo

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: travelhappy111
Reviews.Content: In a good location near to Termini and within walking distance of main attractions. Hotel is small, boutique type property.The staff were very welcoming, friendly and helpful throughout our stay. We had a deluxe room which was very spacious. Breakfast buffet pretty varied and good quality. Staff happy to make coffee to order such as cappuccino etc. The bar offers the best value in Rome - a small bottle of decent red wine for 3.50 Euros is unbeatable and free nibbles are available. Only negatives were that the mattress and the pillows were very firm but this will probably suit some people, and as the hotel is siituated near to a major road, there was some noise from traffic if the window was left open at night. Lots of decent restaurants nearby. We ate at Mamma Angelina a couple of times, which was just around the corner from the hotel and had a good menu/food. Overall this is a good three star city hotel. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent mid-price Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: tallpinesCO
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at this hotel because it is only about 3 blocks from the Termini train station, where we had to return a rental car. After driving to the hotel (doable with GPS, but not really recommended!) we ran inside to get help with the car return. The kind man at the front desk called and got specific directions. It turned out we had passed the drop-off point twice in heavy traffic and had not spotted it. Once checked in, we loved the hotel. It was once a family home. The cozy lobby has mementos of the family, bookshelves with an honor library, and a very nice bar area where free snacks are served in the early evening. Our standard room was fairly spacious. It was elegantly decorated with nice fabrics. All the ceilings are painted to resemble old frescoes. On a subsequent visit we were upgraded to a superior room, which we decided would be very good value for the extra space.) Bathrooms have huge old-fashioned tubs perfect for soaking at the end of a long day. Buffet breakfast is served in a sunny room which does fill up at peak times. However, we never had to wait more than a few minutes. The buffet is far beyond typical Continental fare, with lots of fruit, cheeses, meat, egg dishes, and tempting pastries. Free internet worked perfectly in the room. There is also a free computer to use in the lobby. The neighborhood feels perfectly safe at all hours. There are some nearby restaurants, including one with takeout pizza and calzone. We were able to either walk or take the Metro to all the sights we wanted to see. It would be possible to walk to the Termini station with light luggage and catch the direct train to the airport, but we did not try it. All in all, Hotel Canada is very convenient and quiet home base in the middle of the bustling city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pixie_9
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel near the 'Termini' in Rome. The room was very clean and confortable with a good sized bed and air conditioning. The breakfast was brilliant and there was a wide choice available. All of the staff we encountered were friendly, helpful and welcoming too. We managed to walk to all of the sights in Rome from the hotel (although we did have very tired feet by the end of our long weekend!) but the sightseeing buses go from near the Termini (as well as buses to the airports) so it a great location. We would definitely stay again if we come back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “1000 stars...perfect hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Margaux1225
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th stay at Hotel Canada and it always delights us..the staff, breakfast , rooms and happy hour makes this worth the trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: Fionarina
Reviews.Content: We had one night at the end of our Italian trip before flying out of Rome. Chose not to stay at the hotel from the beginning of our trip and decided upon hotel Canada. This decision was a good one. Location perhaps a bit far to walk all day. However lots of public transport options. Close to termini. We did not see any prostitutes. Rooms are spacious by European standards. Bathroom clean and bright. Careful not to flood the bathroom when showering as it is an open concept shower area with barely a divider. Bar drinks are very very inexpensive. Bed is fabulous. But we like firm beds. Hotel staff are curteous. Would we return? Yes if we needed a night or two in transit or something.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: GypsyKingBrussels
Reviews.Content: Rome has plenty of hotel accomodation on offer, so it is always worthwhile looking for bargains. When I am in Rome for business, I usually stay in Hotel Canada as it offers good value for money. Breakfast is good according to Italian standards, rooms are comfortable and especially the deluxe rooms are fine, spacious and with everything in working order (not obvious in Italy). The hotel is not located in the historic centre of the city, but that is an advantage when it comes to avoiding the choatic traffic and especially the noise at night. If you discount the occasional though harmless prostitute, the location is fine as it's close to the Stazione Termini station, from where there is a shuttle train to Fiumicino Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Another comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: hemlockforest
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at the Hotel Canada and we continue to be quite satisfied. Maybe it doesn't have a fitness centre or a corporate meeting facilty but the hotel rating is as close to 5 star as I've seen in Rome. And the rooms were large by European standards.The staff, though other writers have commented were not very cordial, were again receptive to our requests. Vincenzo at the front desk was pleasant as he was the last time. We requested a top floor room, but Gianfranco assured me that the room we had would be quite good. He was right. The most memorable person on staff was Massimo, our breafast attendant. Always pleasant, efficient, and served us with a smile catered to our needs. Unfortunately, he was not available when we check out to show him our appreciation. The owner or management should acknowledge his efforts. The Hotel is close to the Termini but not so close as to get a taste of some seedy characters or noisy traffic. The Metro stop is just a block away. Some good local trattorias in walking distance from the Hotel that cater to tourists were surprisingly good. We would stay here again if we visit Rome for a cruise connection or to use as a base for other sights.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romantic honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Sunworshipper89
Reviews.Content: I stayed In Hotel Canada for four nights at the beginning of November. We were on our honeymoon, which the hotel was aware of, and upon arrival we found bubbly and chocolates in our room along with a lovely card from the staff. Our room was large and featured a dressing area with wardrobe and mirror, spacious bathroom, comfortable bed, seats etc. The bed was very comfortable and was fitted with expensive sheets - rare in a hotel! Our bathroom had a bath and waterfall shower which was perfect at the end of a long day's sight-seeing. It also had nice toiletries. It was located near the Termini and two metro stations. Although it was a little way out of the city centre this was fine. I did feel a little uncomfortable walking in the streets near our hotel at night just because there were a lot of parked cars but we had no problems. Our room looked out onto Via Villafrana which was nice during the day but some nights there was a little noise from the bar along the street, but nothing that disturbed our sleep. We were maybe too tired after all the walking! The hotel bar was reasonably priced, what I would expect from a Roman hotel. 4.50 euros for a spirit and mixer. Every evening they had happy hour with snacks such as crisps, olives, canapes etc. Breakfast was lovely with fresh croissants and DELICIOUS coffee. I would definitely return to this hotel and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Bellisimo”
Reviews.Author: ocdiane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Canada this past week Nov 2011 this hotel should be rated a 5 star, everyone is so nice and helpful ...It is also very close to bus and train station, The rooms are excellent and spotless and a great breakfast buffet.... Diane from Pennsylvania USA

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and Stay”
Reviews.Author: PaulS74
Reviews.Content: Love the location. The staff esp Edwin. Rooms are clean and safe. Walking distance to everything or you can take the Metro with the nearest station 2mins away and Termini 5mins away. Off the beaten track means a quiet stay too. Strongly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A REALLY NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: bigcanoe2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a Med cruise. Our transfer from the cruise included about 13 other couples. Many were dropped off before us. In every instance the driver called out their hotel and assisted them in getting out. When it was our turn he said "this is a really nice hotel". Boy, was he right. Very pretty, very clean, very good breakfast, very good "happy hour" drinks and snacks, and very convenient location. It was a great location for seeing Rome and for ending our 30 day journey. The staff even arranged a transfer to the airport for us...and only 40 euro. No complaints....only praise !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: gaa0805
Reviews.Content: Ichose this hotel as it was a few minutes’ walk from the train station and the center of Rome is a short walk away. The hotel is small, but had all the services found in higher priced boutique hotels. The staff was friendly and helpful, and could answer all our questions. Breakfast is included, and it was abundant. This was my second time at this hotel, and I would book it again. It can be summed up as an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Met all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Leroy252
Reviews.Content: Well I enjoy picking faults when doing these reviews as much as the next person, but I can;t with this place. The hotel and rooms were well furnished and clean. The room was small (but this is a capital city?) the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is right next to an underground station and close to the main city terminal. Breakfast had a small but reasonable choice of decent food. Even the bar had reasonably priced drinks. I left happy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayReviews1980
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. The only slight (and I mean slight) negative was that there was occasionally some noise from the central stairwell if someone was wearing noisy shoes or flip flops but otherwise an absolutely great experience. Lovely room, lovely breakfast, good location near to main station and underground and wonderful helpful staff. A special mention should go to the man on the reception desk in the evenings who helped us with resturants and directions on an almost nightly basis, and the waiter who remembered that we liked milk with our tea (not normal for Italy) and ensured it was there every morning along with a friendly welcome. Would absolutely reccommned and would use again if we returned to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: sparky57
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights from Oct 7 and could not have wished for better from a 3-star hotel. The room was fine, the staff very helpful (in a city where many people who deal with tourists are charmless and unhelpful), the bar cheap and the breakfast very good by any standard (excellent compared with many Italian hotels). Our stay was funded by using Airmiles, so I didn't know how reasonable the room rates seem to be until I checked on TripAdvisor afterwards. The location is good – just far enough from Termini to escape the slight seediness of the station but very close to the metro station Castro Pretorio. The only minor problem is the antique, temperamental lift.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CassieKat306
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be perfectly suited for the main train station in Rome. It is also within walking distance to The Roman Forum, etc. At the sametime, there is a "metro" station, literally right around the corner, allowing you access to anywhere in Rome. The room was quite large, bed very comfortable, and bathroom large. The room was clean and modern and I have no complaints with it. If I had any negative comments about the hotel itself, it would be its staff. I found them to be a bit "snooty." Tolerable, however, very standoffish.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Find”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: To start with, the location is great - a few minutes walk from Termini, and even fewer minutes walk to the nearest Metro, this is really convenient. The hotel itself is great - the staff were really friendly, and were lovely with our 8 year old son. The room was spacey, and the bathroom was good too. The wii in the hotel bar was a great hit with our son too. Breakfast was excellent - plenty of choice. If you want to eat cheaply and locally, there are plenty of really good pizzeria's and trattoria's a stones throw from the hotel. We'd definitely recommend getting a Roma Pass - which will get you into 2 sites for free, and discounted for the third onwards - and free transport in the city. Even if you don't manage (!) to get your money's worth, the value of being able to walk past the queues and straight into the site of your choice easily makes up for the cost. We will return here next time we come to Rome !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: NicheRay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here whilst on a 3 day break in Rome. Wonderful hotel and welcoming staff. Edwin in the coffee area never failed to bring a smile to our faces! We cannot fault the hotel at all, it was outstanding

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chimango
Reviews.Content: The location is superb! The room is immaculate (little small, but it is a very old building!) The elevator is precious! The staff amazing, specially Giovanni and Richard(the bell guy from Peru) all very helpful. Breakfast included, and what a "BREAKFAST"... Thank you all for you hospitality!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Brenda K
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canada is an easy safe walk from the Termini which suited us very well. The room was spacious and with the window shut was very quiet and restful. The shower recess was large which is unusual for bathrooms in Italy. The buffet breakfast had a good selection of food and we enjoyed going early - around 7 to 7.30am - as the dining area can get very busy later on. Having free internet access was a bonus. Our only disappointment was the absence of a refrigerator in our room. Throughout all our stay in Italy this was the only hotel not to have one.

Reviews.Title: “Great option”
Reviews.Author: FabianaLandi
Reviews.Content: Great location, great breakfast, great room. Close to the train station, huge room. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Find! - The Best Western Canada Hotel, Rome, Italy”
Reviews.Author: nonnaPalmCoast_Fl_
Reviews.Content: We arrived today after a cruise that ended in Rome. We wanted a hotel near the train station for our arrival and also for our departure to the airport tomorrow. We booked The Best Western Hotel Canada in Rome, Italy and were thrilled when we were taken to our room. The walls are covered with gold moire, the drapes are ceiling to floor, the ceiling is frescoed and the furniture is beautiful inlaid wood, resembling antiques. The room is enormous and absolutely beautiful. The lobby is welcoming, the staff charming and so helpful and the internet is fast and free. I'm sure breakfast tomorrow will be most satisfying. Although this hotel isn't in the heart of the tourist sites, it was perfect for us. We wandered around quiet streets and saw many excavations of archeological sites. It is in the gov't buildings, embassy building area. We are sorry that we will be here only one night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with great staff.”
Reviews.Author: hillbilly60
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel, with their helpful friendly staff an great location. Edwin was in charge of the bar area and was always friendly and helpful. The rooms were large and clean, the beds very comfortable and maid service was good. I do think they need more space in the rooms for "your stuff" as in the bathroom had a very small shelf above the sink to put your care needs and there was no drawers to unpack to. I had to lay my clothes flat in the stand up wardrobe. Small negatives for what is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff & Service”
Reviews.Author: minnego6
Reviews.Content: On our second trip to Rome, we decided to stay in a different hotel in the area of Castro Pretorio. We had full breakfast and the lovely room, and the whole experience compared to all the other hotels on our vacation was by far the best we encountered. The staff was so accommodating, from laundry to room service. Their recommondations of local restaurant was some of the best meals we enjoyed during our stay. The evening in their lounge was the highlight of everyday. Their waiter went out of his way to make us feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: just-me-myself-i
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend and it exceeded our expectations. Tastefully decorated throughout with lots of personal touches. Staff were very helpful and pleasant especially the dining room staff. Our room was spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was very good with a good selection of cold meats, cheeses, tomatoes, omelettes etc etc, served in a bright well appointed room. The old fashioned lift took me back a few years... We walked to all of the major sites from the hotel and discovered loads of undocumented ones as well - on foot is definitely the best way to see Rome. I can thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bruce45069
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at Hotel Canada, Sept 12-15, 2011. The rooms were great, the breakfast magnificent, free internet, easy metro access and several good restaurant within walking distance. A tip for travelers...we found that taking a taxi in Rome was the best way to get around. We were two couples and Taxi fares never exceeded 10euro from key attractions. Not as cheap as metro but way more convenient

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Havepointswilltravel
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 days here before heading to other cities in Italy and then one more night before heading back to the states. Would definitely saty here when I go back to Rome and would recommend it to others. We stayed based on a recommendation from a friend. Took taxi from the airport (expect it to be about 45 Euros, don't get scammed at the airport!). But when we made day trips it was an EASY walk to the train station. Also convenient to the metro. Room was very clean and large. The staff was friendly and helpful. The bar was great. The bar area/lobby had lots of chairs, comfortable couches and tables. A nice place to relax after a long day of sightseeing and the bar snacks were delicious and varied from day to day. Breakast in a pretty, sunny room with a nice spread. WiFi was free (and worked) - just remember to get the access code from the front desk when you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: Stricketts
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely hotel with heaps of character. We spent four nights here and just loved it. It was comfortable, clean, spacious, friendly, quiet, breakfast was great and ran for 3 hours, wifi was free and fast, the guys on the desk were really nice, friendly and helpful. We had a room with a tiny balcony with doors and bathroom window that opened onto it so you could get fresh air and not have air conditioning on all the time. It was a close walk to the termini. We walked to the Trevi fountain, Spanish steps, Coloseum, Pantheon from here. Caught the metro to the Vatican but walked back from there. After being out in the busyness of Rome it was a lovely place to come back to rest. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Italy”
Reviews.Author: GingGing1
Reviews.Content: The best western Canada in Rome was by far the best hotel we stayed in during our 5 weeks stay in Italy. Only a few minutes away from the Train station good restaurants and the staff all were friendly helpful and fun. Breakfast was very good and the rooms wear just beautiful I cannot speak more higly of this hotel it was just great. Would Definitely stay at this hotel again and would not hesitate to recommended this to anyone waiting to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Canada House, Stylish, Elegant, Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Adam Q
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Rome for 3 days, in a room with 2 friends. We had booked into another hotel just 2 minutes walk from here, (on Via San Martino) but to our horror, it was so poor we decided to find somewhere better. After trying a handful of places around the block, we stumbled into Canada House, whereby we were stunned by the classical themed architecture, paintings and furniture in a modern and stylish hotel. The receptionist (who spoke decent English) was most helpful and offered to show us the room prior to booking. We accepted and couldn't let the opportunity slip. Room - Lovely old style theme, 4 poster bed etc. Was a little noisy when window is open, and although there wasn't much of a view from it, it didn't matter as you'll spend no time in the room when you're in Rome, and when the window is closed the room is silent, so sleeping is easy. Beds very comfortable, and I have a bad back so this is a good recommendation. Decent sized safe to fit a handful of things in, multiple tv stations, and very spacious bathroom. Air conditioning quite good also. Hotel itself - Corridors were nicely styled, lift had that classic theme about it with the transparent mesh shaft, and the 2 doors that opened inwards like something from a Bogart movie. Bar - Comfortable and very reasonably priced. Free internet usage for guests although the lone computer was unavailable at times. Breakfast - Buffet style, scrambled eggs, sausages, yoghurt, breads, pastries, fruits, cereals, coffee, tea, juice etc all available. I personally didn't like the bacon, sausages and some of the bread but this was par for the course of my stay in Italy, so the hotel can't be blamed for poor food. Staff - All had decent English, enough to get you by anyway. Quite friendly and helpful. A porter insisted on carrying our bags to the room for us. Bad points? - Bathroom had no window and could get steamy and very hot for a long time after a shower. No key was available to lock bathroom from inside. I prefer a shower with a proper door so was disappointed to see a curtain in this bathroom. If you're not mad into continental breakfasts then you won't be thrilled by the breakfast, however, it is ok. Value - €189 per night between 3 people. For the room, location, friendliness of staff, close proximity to 2 excellent restaurants on the same street, and the fact that Termini is 5 mins walk away, I felt that this represented excellent value. I would freely recommend Best Western Canada House to everyone. It is such a convenient and comfortable hotel and I think it highly doubtful that anyone could be disappointed after staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, excellent location, and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: K N
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find in a good location in Rome. Located minutes away from Termini, it was very convenient to walk or metro to all attractions. Room was very comfortable and quiet. The staff were friendly and provided excellent service and information. Breakfast was a plentiful spread of great food. Would come back and stay here again. Price per night was a little steep but it was worth it for the quiet and comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: franpaul
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at BW Canada in Rome.Staff were excellent,attentive and polite Room as pictured, lovely clean & bathroom quiet large for European standards. Great location, 5 minute walk from Terminii (main railway station). Heaps of reasonably priced restaurants within a 5-10 walk. Buffet breakffast was more than adequate to start the day with. great capiccino. Was a great hotel and a reasonable price. I agree, no fridge in room but they have a bar in the hotel which charges the same rate as street shops for beer,softdrink & wine. Free nibbles to go with that drink at the end of the day. Great atmosphere. A pleasant change from feeling like you are always paying high prices for the pleasure of using the hotels facilities. Highly recommended. Will definetly go back when in Rome. Also free internet a definite bonus.

Reviews.Title: “No excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: viajjante
Reviews.Content: Negative aspects Some Front Desk Men note helpful No frigobar in room The lift is a great trouble Air conditioned doens t work well to hot days My double bad really was to single bed to put together Positive aspects Breakfast is excellent Wait and waitress are so nice people Good location

Reviews.Title: “Magnifico.. the only description I could give”
Reviews.Author: OldTar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one week prior to joining our three week cruise of the Mediterranean. Walking distance to everything. A great buffet breakfast with more choices than you will need. The service provided by the Italian Lady who runs the kitchen was amazing and she was an absolute delight. A waiter ensured that you were comfortably seated and provided a cup of tea or coffee and generally checked to see that you were satisfied. Many good restaurants are within 200 metres of the front door where you can find most cuisines to suit you. The bar was good and the Lemoncello deserts excellent. The receptionists (male) were excellent with one member standing out as exceptional. The suite that we occupied on the 3rd floor had a good sized bathroom, complete with bidet. An office desk and a lounge made the lounge room comfortable and functional with an excellent free broadband service. The bedroom was very comfortable with a huge balcony off it. Plenty of wardrobe space and a safe together with a hugh antique chest of drawers, swallowed up our luggage. Thank you all at the Hotel Canada... You made our stay in Rome so enjoyable... we will return when next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: andyfoster164
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by the agent and she was so pushy about it that I thought there must be a catch. Well I can honestly say she was right – this is a great little hotel. The service is first class and the rooms are furnished to a high standard. If you are visiting Rome stay at the Hotel Canada. It is close to Termini station and 200 meters from a tube stop. PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: vintageaudrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this fabulous hotel on the outskirts of central Rome at the end of May 2011. Within walking distance of metro in to city centre but also possible to walk to centre of Rome and take in the sights on the way. Lovely hotel with friendly staff and great rooms. We were expecting a nice but basic room and instead we found a large room with roomy en suite, hallway, large wardrobes and grand decor. Breakfasts are great quality with plenty of choice and there is also a relaxing bar for a night cap. Reasonable price for Rome and definitely worth looking up for your next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic”
Reviews.Author: silverlake2002
Reviews.Content: This Best Western is a jem,the rooms are far more than I had ever expected.If you want your dollars worth this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Canada is our choice in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Lynnie17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Canada for the second time in March 2011. Our last trip was about ten years ago (which was noted and remembered at the front desk when we checked in!) We were so impressed last time, we couldn't imagine staying anywhere else in Rome. First, the hotel itself is elegantly appointed, extremely well managed, and the rooms are unbelievably spacious - even larger that many American hotel rooms, and much more richly appointed. The bathrooms are large also, and we would always request the rooms with full bathtubs, which are luxurious! Then, there is the special location of the Hotel Canada. While it is not directly located right among a particular tourist attraction in Rome, such as the Spanish Steps or Trevi fountain, the beauty of the Hotel Canada is that it is just steps away from the Castro Pretoria metro subway stop, which can whisk you away to all the sights of Rome..... and which are all in different locations throughout the city. Traveling to the Colliseum is a breeze on the metro going in one direction from the Hotel Canada. Then traveling to the Spanish Steps area and the Pantheon and Piazza Navone on the metro going in the other direction is just as quick and easy. Then, you can also travel all the way to the Vatican by just taking the same metro stop, Castro Pretoria, which is just beside the Hotel Canada. In addition, the Hotel is an easy five block walk to Rome's main Termini station, where you can easily ride south to Naples and Pompeii, or enjoy all the conveniences of the shopping mall at Termini, as well as it's excellent cafeterias and fast food options, if you like. We even rode the subway line to the outskirts of Rome to the stop closest to the Appian Way and the Baths of Caracula, which are all encompassed in a green, rural-like national park area ( we easily caught a cab ride from the metro to the Baths and Park area, walked alongside the entrances to the Catacombs and saw the old Roman gates and walls). The beautiful park setting with trees and green lawn vistas of the Baths and the Appian Way should not be missed, even by first time visitors, because it presents such a lovely side of Rome. The Hotel Canada is just a perfect location for visitors that want easy access to all the sites while staying in a beautiful, well-managed hotel, as opposed to being located close to one particular site. (And we are the kind of tourists that like to be right in the heart of the cities we visit - so this tells you how special the Hotel Canada is.... and how Rome has so many hearts to see!) During this trip in March 2011, we brought my parents, who have some mobility issues due to knee problems. We were able to get everywhere easily using a combination of the subway, cabs, and limited walking (actually, a good deal of walking at the Vatican!). We all were made to feel so comfortable by the friendly owners and staff at the Hotel Canada. They answered my Dad's many questions with great enthusiasm and patience. This kind of friendliness and graciousness was invaluable to me, as I wanted my parents to enjoy their trip. The breakfast buffet is wonderful and I imagine one of the best in Rome, with it's offerings of American style scrambled and hard boiled eggs, bacon and sausages, as well as the more continental items such as cold meats, cheeses, fresh baked breads and pastries, yogurt and even bottled Limonettas, a nice treat. Having such a nice, quiet breakfast in a lovely appointed room with high ceilings in the heart of bustling Rome is a great start to a day of visiting sights. Rome has so much to offer that it can be overwhelming, but having the Canada Hotel as your base, you have a comfortable, friendly place to retreat to in the evenings. Even the host at the hotel bar is about as a friendly a gentleman as you will meet - and he even sets up a complimentary appetizer table during the happy hour evening time. (Also, the bar prices were so much better at the Canada, we found ourselves returning here every night for a pleasant winding down of the day) We stayed five nights this time, and even discovered a wonderful family-run restaurant a block from the hotel that offers excellent, inexpensive meals and even gelato well into the late evening - a great convenience after a full day!. All in all, we have the best praise possible for the Hotel Canada and it's splendid staff - it offers a way to see the best that Rome offers with none of the standard big city hassles and hustle bustle! Outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Romatourist
Reviews.Content: Lovely charming hotel, very close to Termini station and metro. Very comfortable beds in very nice rooms. Helpful friendly staff. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Terri R
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about Hotel Canada. The hotel is very clean and the staff is amazing - especially Vincenzo. They were very kind an helpful in every way. The hotel is also in a nice location with the train and bus station only a few blocks away. It is so convenient. The breakfast they provide is very good with many food choices. They have a nice sitting area and bar area. It became a wonderful place to relax and meet other hotel guests in the evening. I would highly recommend this hotel - !!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Staff! Saved our trip”
Reviews.Author: Erin042781
Reviews.Content: My mom planned a trip to Italy for herself, my sisters, and me. She worked with a travel agent and Delta Vacataions who made our hotel reservations. After traveling for a day, we arrived in Rome only to realize how awful the hotel they booked was. Fortunately, Mom had remembered my uncle saying how great their stay at Hotel Canada had been in May 2010. We called over to them and immediately they began working on accomodating us. We went directly to Hotel Canada and Vincenzo already had two rooming options ready. The hotel was nice and clean and in walking distance to Termini. All of our car services and airport transfers had also been arranged through the previous hotel months in advance. Within hours of our arrival, Vincenzo had rearranged everything for us and gave us great directions. Any question we had he seemed to know the answer. All of the staff spoke several languages and came from all over the world. We enjoyed meeting other guests and socializing in the quaint bar area for cocktails in the evening. The entire staff was so kind, so helpful, and very friendly. I am so glad we found Hotel Canada and my mom's dream vacation for us girls was saved. I would reccomed this hotel time and time again. It was clean, nice, and close to dining and transportation. Great stay all around!

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Bookie2020
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel from reviews here and its proximity to train station. Hotel was clean, staff was friendly and helpful, close to subway, we loved our beautiful elegant room and the price was very reasonable for Rome. Jumped on the subway and in a couple of stops we were at the Colosseum. It is a quiet neighborhood and not a lot of restaurants but there was a nice one around the corner. Very nice breakfast room with lots of choices. We will stay here on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Mark L
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. The staff were notably pleasant and helpful. The room was comfortable - tiled floors which seem cooling, a bit old fashioned in a way I like. WiFi is free and fast, but you have to ask for a password. The old fashioned lift does become paralyzed if guests omit to close both sets of doors. It's a bit quirky and not typical of North American chains, but I liked it more as a result. Best Western do seem to allow their hotels some individualism, much less corporate than the other chains. There are negative comments about the area in some of the reviews, but actually it is convenient. You can walk to Termini station in 10 minutes and that is the main transport hub for the city of Rome. While food tends to be expensive in Rome, transport is exceptionally cheap - you won't spend more than €4 a day as that is the price of the all-day ticket for buses and metro. The area round Termini is much as you might expect in a station area, but those who think the area unsafe must be remarkably easily scared. The walk to the hotel goes through multiple pavement restaurants all open and occupied until late - it is perfectly safe. The breakfast was good but there is no restaurant - for evening meal I went up the street to Leoni's where food and service were fine.

Reviews.Title: “A treasure of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EasyBob
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! 3 stars? This hotel surely deserves at least 4, if not 5! From the moment we arrived and checked in until checkout the service was absolutely top class! All the staff at the hotel are so helpful, always cheerful and smiling. The hotel is immaculate, shiny clean, and our room was just amazing! Must have been one of the biggest hotel rooms we have stayed in. In terms of location it is just perfect! No more than 5 minutes walk from Termini Station, where you can get your hop-on hop-off buses, other buses, the Metro and taxis should you need one. Termini also has lots and lots of shops and restaurants, and there is a big supermarket located there, very handy indeed! There are also several restaurants just down the street from the hotel, one or two we tried out, superb! I cannot rate this hotel high enough, pure class!

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: VolpeTravels
Reviews.Content: Very clean. Very large rooms. Great breakfast included. Nice location near the subway and train stations.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel fantastic breakfast”
Reviews.Author: PrinceandPrincessMom
Reviews.Content: We were travelling with our two children and stayed six nights at Hotel Canada in the middle of August. The room was very spacious, we had a King size bed and two singles for our children. Everything is spotless clean. The breakfast has a a variety of choices, we never had problems looking for a table. The location was good, the main termini station is a 5 -7 minutes walk, or a subway station 1 minute around the corner. There is a good laundromat across the street half a block away, E11 for a large load including drying. The gentlemen at the reception desk did not have a lot of smiles at first sight, however, they are real professional and know everything and can give you any information you need. We were particularly impressed on the last night when we came back to the hotel after our sight seeing, they asked us if we would like them to book a taxi to the airport the next morning, something we had forgotten about. I told them the time of our flight, and they looked after all the details, including advising what time we should leave the hotel. We were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: jasonpanchal
Reviews.Content: I made my reservations based on reviews on tripadvisor and location. While making my res, i let them know we were coming to italy for our honeymoon. Gave us a nice room, and soon after, we had a bottle of champagne delivered on the house. The 2 front desk gentlemen were amazing with all our questions, directions, recommondations, and set up a tour at the Vatican for us. This was by far the best stay in Italy we had during our trip. THANK YOU! We will be back at your hotel on our next trip to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mars2611
Reviews.Content: Location is a short walk from Termini Station. Staff very friendly and helpful, large comfortable room with good soundproofing from outside noise. Fantastic breakfast. Thankyou for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: Squidgy-W
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel so as not to be lugging heavy bags to far from the Termini. Its only 5 mins walk. As regards location in relation to attractions in the City, if you're able to walk then its fine. 20 - 30 mins will have you at the Trevi, Colosseum, Il Vittoriano (Wedding Cake), etc. A taxi taken from outside the Termini will get you to the Vatican in 20 mins or so. The city tour buses are also got from outside the Termin so its convienent for that aswell. Reception staff were always helpful and pleasant, however not as friendly as they could be, but as mainland Europe tends to be like this perhaps my expectations were misplaced. Rooms were sizable enough, bed was a large double. Bathroom was fine. Only 1 english tv channel (BBC world news), would have been nice to have sky news or cnn. Breakfast is buffet style and is great, the dining room seemed to be looked after by a middle aged lady who greeted everyone every morning and was efficient in bringing coffee etc. I ate well in the morning and then needn't get lunch until late afternoon. I paid E115 per night for b&b. Rome is a spectacular city and I was happy to be based in Best Western Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and came back”
Reviews.Author: rossq
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four with two teenagers and stayed at this hotel for two nights at the beginning of our three week Italy vacation. The hotel is a ten minute walk to the train station but far enough away from it that it didn’t have that hectic, noisy feel about it. It has a subway (metro) stop two minutes away. It was very convenient and we used the metro to get around to the sights. We were extremely impressed with the spacious family room layout and Italian period furniture. We had a very comfortable queen size bed and the two boys had their own single beds. The room was quiet and our sleeps were very restful. Most important of all was that the room and bathroom were spotless and clean. The hotel also has free Wi-Fi service which was a huge plus for our two sons. The breakfast room was cheerful and well lit. We had the best breakfasts there in all our hotel stays in Italy with a great assortment and abundance of food. All the hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful to the few requests we made. The only complaint we had was that there was no mini fridge to keep our drinks cold. We enjoyed our stay so much that we also booked this hotel for our last night of our vacation, three weeks later. In summary it’s a great hotel, reasonably priced and we really enjoyed our stays there.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay in this Hotel again”
Reviews.Author: Rosanna1972
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in August,for 5 days after a week on a cruise which was fabulous by the way.So we wanted something not to spoil our continued holiday and this hotel was more than we expected.The room was very big and we were a family of 4 with 4 big suitcases we had all the amneties.The breakfast in the morning was abundant and very good.The location was near termini station,and after all if you want to get the better of your holiday you have to walk so not to miss anything.We found a good restaurant in via Firenze that was not expensive and did the pizza fresh not like some restaurants that had the pastry frozen. We will stay in a Best western hotel again anywhere as I heard that it's the same in any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: doriab
Reviews.Content: I choose the Hotel Canada after much research, especially on Trip advisor and also my travel agent recommended it. I had 3 and 4 people staying in the room and although the room and bathroom wasn't really big, it was very comfortable. The King bed was also very comfortable and I had no complaints from my children about the two extra single beds. The Hotel room was very clean when we arrived and was cleaned up nicely every day. The Breakfast was very delicious, plenty of things to choose from. The snacks in the early evening were also very good and were included in the price of the room. The staff at the desk were all helpful, some more than others, we frequently ask them for help and they were always helpful in whatever we asked for. When we asked for a Taxi, it was there within 5 minutes. There are a few good restaurants near by which is nice for a quick bite.
