The only real complaint we had was the hotel is a little far from most of the sites we went to and we had to use a taxi a little more often. Also we wished there was a mini bar or refrigerator in the room so we could have cold drinks at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TorontoMusicman
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel during the first week of August. When my husband told me it was very close to the train station I was a bit skeptical. Boy, was I wrong. This hotel exceeded all our expectations and then some. The room we were given was spotless and incredibly comfortable. It was quite a large room with a small sitting room attached. The bed was very comfortable and the sheets were of very good quality. The bathroom even had a retractable clothes line available. There was even a small balcony leading off into a small courtyard below. The room was tastefully decorated with antique furnishings and beautiful artwork. The room itself was very quiet and I slept incredibly well. The breakfast was fantastic! A huge variety of different foods were available and there was some variety day to day. One day it was salmon, another day it was different variety of cheeses, etc. The main woman who worked tirelessly bringing coffees to all the tables always had a smile on her face. Every evening a variety of nibbles was put out in the bar area. Even if you did not partake in a drink you were welcomed to try the various nuts, olives, pastries, etc. We did ask advice on a good restaurant in the area and we were given the name of Trattoria Leoni D'Abruzzo which was just down the street from the hotel. This restaurant proved to be very disappointing. My husband and myself had the lasagna and it was horrible. My husband kept telling me that the lasagna I make is a hundred times better. We both think it was heated up in a microwave. It was definitely a memorable meal because it was so bad!! My only complaint with the hotel would be with the computer service available. It would have been nicer if there was more than one computer available and if there was a faster internet connection available. Overall, our stay was really great and we would not hesitate to stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed Overall - Overrated!!”
Reviews.Author: Shiloh1030
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 9 days from July 29 to Aug 6. My husband and I decided on this hotel after searching for two whole weeks on numerous websites. It is close to Termini Station like advertised however not close to any tourist sites. Lots of food options which are all good. The staff are not at all friendly towards Americans, they tolerate you. We didn't get any sort of advice or recommendations. We weren't even told our room had a safe, I had to inquire after I couldn't find it in the room. You don't have ready access to an iron if you need one, you must request daily. The sheets are not changed daily unless you ask, i was told it depends on the maid working that day. BEDS ARE HARD LIKE ROCKS! Don't stay here if you want a soft or medium bed. The food felt like "GroundHog Day", i.e. same thing everyday, nothing great, undercooked bacon mixed with vienna sausages.Boiled eggs are not thoroughly boiled, so watch out. The fruit is not the best selection. The pastries were way better if you want to eat this daily. The cappucino and coffee are truly awesone. Again, the staff look like they are overworked and just plain tired of the tourists coming from all over. We did alot of walking. Used the laundry service of a local just around the corner, it costs us approx 8 Euro for one load, picked up the next day. Next time will stay closer i.e. Central Rome since this is where we went everyday, used the Roma Pass which is the way to go in order to see the Coliseum and Roman Forum and get train access for three days, costs 25 Euro per person. The biggest tip of all: The airport does not provide shuttle service at all. Don't use taxi either since it is a major ripoff. Go to www.airportshuttle.it Make reservations online, it costs 25 Euro for one person one way, each additional person is 6 Euro. They will wait up to 90 minutes for you at the airport waiting for you to come in. This is an honest company and the staff are reliable. We used it to get from hotel to airport and there were many others on shuttle from other hotels. Will definitely use next time. Lesson learned. The reviews are coming from people who have certain expectations or have accepted a certain standard. You are getting what you pay for and in Rome, your money does not go a long way. We payed approx $182 a night for this place and our way back to the U.S. we stayed at a Hyatt for one night in California and only payed $130/nt. There was no comparison. Don't expect anything anywhere near what you may get for the price in a U.S. Hotel. It would have been nice to have a mini fridge so at least we could have a cold drink waiting for us. Our room didn't have one. There are several little markets around which sell drinks for for 1/4th of what you will pay at a site or restaurant. We never experienced any problems with pickpockets etc..

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tommygeniole
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied to have stayed here with my wife. A beautiful hotel with very friendly staff who were willing to make sure that our needs were looked after in every way. Cannot say enough about the breakfast. Full breaky with pastry, juices, eggs, sausage, bacon, cheeses and fruits. Many people state that the location is somewhat out of the way. There is a tube/Metro station right around the corner (Vatican (15 min) and two blocks from Termini train station where we boarded a hop on/off bus everyday we were in town. I would much rather have an excellent hotel with a small commute to the sites than a bad hotel in the middel of everything. You will not be disappointed here. We had a small issue with our air conditioning unit in our room one night, next day It was looked after immediately and a a gift was left for us for any inconvenience. GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Location!”
Reviews.Author: AnthVick
Reviews.Content: Great location, extremely close to the Termini. Lots of cafes close. Our rooms were unbelievable big! And furnished soooo nicely. Nice bar downstairs for an evening drink and they put out a small selection of hors d'oeurves. Breakfast was good and plentiful. Very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: thebrad99
Reviews.Content: Not the ideal location for walking into the center of Rome, but it’s very close to the metro and the hotel service was great. My children under the age of ten made the walk to the center several times, the only area I didn't like walking past was the Termini Station. The rooms are large enough for a family of four and four suitcases. There are a few local restaurants that are great when you don’t feel like heading back to the center of Rome and the front desk has plenty of suggestions. The bar was great as well, the prices are better than any place I have come across.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around!!”
Reviews.Author: traveldays
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic find!! Great location, clean, spacious rooms. Truly the best breakfast in Rome; the staff are a real gem (especially at breakfast!). You will not regret staying here. The location is nice and convenient. Make sure the take a day to go the beach; it's beautiful. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Rome! Tried to find a negative about the place, but it's impossibe! We stayed for a week and wished we had at least another week there!

Reviews.Title: “fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: wife2reporter
Reviews.Content: FIne hotel, polite staff, 5 minutes to metro station. Nice lobby and large room for family.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: travelbird31
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last summer and it was the last hotel on my trip. It was of good value and the rooms were like a palace. I stayed in a room that was the size of a broom closet in Venice for 180 Euros! The staff was friendly but sometimes you had to chase them down to find them. The bar was nice with the available snacks. In the tub, they had a laundry wire/string to hang your clothes from which made it nice for the traveller. The only thing is don't eat near the hotel! Definitely get recommendations from non-hotel staff or Romans. The restaurants within the few block radius mostly service tourists and they couldn't be bothered to provide the best Italian food and take advantage of tourist by not providing change to a bill. The train station is very close to the hotel (once you get your bearings) and walking distance to lots of Roman landmarks. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Duchesnay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Canada Hotel on our last night of our 2 week trip. Very convenient location 5 minute walk to the train station for our next morning flight home back to Canada. No need for taxi's or subway. Beautiful lobby, great rooms, very comfortable, roomy and very modern bathroom. Some antiques in the room made it extra special. We walked to the Spanish Steps in less than 30 minutes and good central location to tour Rome  - a very stunningly beautiful city. Breakfast next morning was good in a lovely room and we were sad to go. Will definitely come back to this hotel on next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ....”
Reviews.Author: Razor1957
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week (again) and would recommend the place. Pros: The staff simply were great; breakfast is a delight. The rooms are bright and airy Cons: No tea/ coffee in rooms, although this is available from room service. Only one wifi connection per room, additional log-ons are available at a cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent European style hotel."”
Reviews.Author: OdieStPaul_MN
Reviews.Content: We favor Best Western properties in Europe. They seem to be recently renovated and reasonably priced. The Canada in Rome is among the best of this type. The room we had was roomy, and while not luxurious, had everything we needed--including free Internet access, refrigerator, coffee maker, etc. The breakfast is phenomenal--with eggs (scrambled, hard and soft boiled), ham, cheeses, breads and an incredible assortment of pastries that varies from day to day. The hotel is located near the central train station, which means it is a bit away from most sites, but close to metro as well as trains to the airport and beyond. Service was excellent:: helpful and professional. The hotel has a small bar, with most reasonable prices and snakes provided--a place were hotel patrons congregate. Trattoria Leone D'Abruzzo's, less than 100 meters away from the Canada, is excellent,

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: clairej0
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in an excellent location, 2 minutes walk from the termini (station) in central Rome. We took our eldest son as a 'well done' for all his hard work in his exams. We had a triple room which was plenty big enough for all 3 of us. A four poster bed for us and a single bed for our son. Staff were helpful, kind & helped make our stay perfect. Breakfast was fabulous, so much to chose from. Rome is the most compact city we have visited. We walked 10 miles in 1 Day - hotel to colosseum, forum, pantheon, Vatican & back to hotel. We tossed a coin in the trevi fountain, we will be back & staying at the hotel Canada, please. We walked everywhere. Rome is the most compact city we have ever visited. We think we covered 10 miles in 1 day - hotel to colosseum, forum, pantheon, Vatican, and back to hotel. We were tired, but exhilarated by the fantastic sights. We love Rome. We visited the trevi fountain, tossed in a coin, we will be back........& staying at the hotel Canada again,

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a well-served area by public transport”
Reviews.Author: ninna81
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, spacious, definitely something more than a 3 star hotel. Great staff, extremely helpful and attentive. I will surely book it again whenever in Rome. Also, breakfast was good and different every day ...............................................................................................................................................................

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem in Rome !”
Reviews.Author: GraceAlone
Reviews.Content: An Amazing Little Charming Hotel in Rome! My Family of four stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in June 2011. Family includes two teens. I researched heavily to find a very nice hotel in Rome, where we could all four stay in one room. [Hotel Rooms in Rome are SO expensive] and [most do not sleep four people in one room] The result of my research was The Best Western Hotel Canada. We were not disappointed. Our stay was a delight, from the check-in to check-out. Our room was equipped with a queen bed and two twin beds. Free Wi-fi in the rooms; front desk provides a password. Large bathroom with very nice toiletry items. Hotel staff were excellent; very attentive. We ate dinner (2 nights) at hotels that were a one minute walk from the hotel. The antique elevator within the hotel was a lot of fun. The [free] breakfast was VERY nice. An entire staff was busy preparing the food and there was plenty of choices. We needed a very nice hotel for 2 nights pre-cruise in Rome, and the Hotel Canada was perfect! I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cellii
Reviews.Content: Large, clean and elegantly decorated rooms. The bed was very comfortable and the air-conditioning great. We were amazed at the choices on the breakfast buffet. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: biker57
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with old world charm. Room was spacious and the washroom was roomy. It included a bidet. Shampoo,shower gels, toothbrushes and toothpaste,and shower caps were supplied by the hotel. Both rooms were spotless. Towels and sheets replaced daily. The daily breakfast had a great variety and was very good. The pastries and cakes delicious. They also serve a very light snack in the late evening in the lounge area. The different servers I came across were all very pleasant. The ladies cleaning the rooms were the best as well. I dealt with a gentleman named Victor who was a great help for all the questions I had. There were two other gentlemen who worked the day shifts that were great too. The hotel is about five blocks away from the main train/bus station, Termini. It made it easy and inexpensive to be able to take the subway to the majority of all important sites. I felt very comfortable in this hotel. So did my son. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Great staff. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: bnac
Reviews.Content: This place was great. A few blocks from the termini made getting anywhere quick and easy. The breakfast every morning was great and served great espresso. Happy hour in the bar each night was nice. There was a nice selection of foods and cheeses for a light snack before dinner. Very clean. Room was big enough to fit 3 people comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “We took a chance and it was worth it”
Reviews.Author: safrican4ever
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to make choices on hotels beforehand, because you do not really know what it will be like. We picked this hotel based on the reviews it received on TA and the price, well knowing it was away from the hub of Rome. I can tell you that were not dissapointed at all. Besides being reasonably priced, the staff also went out of their way to assist us with what we needed. As an example, when we arrived at about 11h00, our room was ready and we could unpack and freshen up. On top of that, the front desk staff and the barman were very attentive and always made us feel at home. As mentioned before, the bar prices are almost ridicilously low in comparison to other places in the city and there were proper snacks in the early evening. The room we stayed in was comfortably big and the bathroom was adequate. Kept very clean every day. My only issue here would be the very small bath in which we had to stand when showering, I had to do a kind of balancing act not to fall down. Breakfast was great, although the freah fruits were a bit on the scarce side. Like normal, we tried eating a bit of everything the first morning, but we fortunately cut down the next two days. We never left hungry. We used the Metro, there is a stop literally within 100 meters from the hotel, to get us to most places, so the location did not really impact on us. While the area was not the best, it was not as bad as were made to expect and we did not feel threatened the second evening when we returned to our hotel after dark. Based on price and what you get for your money, I will seriously consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cathycnh
Reviews.Content: My husband daughter and I arrived at the Best Western on June 27th and stayed till the 29th. It was hot in Rome and the Best Western Hotel Canada was a welcoming stop for us. Our room was very nicely appointed. Very nice bathroom. The staff was very welcoming and the breakfast was delicious in a beautiful room. The elevator is a little difficult for me to maneuver, but my 18 year old daughter had no trouble. The staff was as helpful as the could be when I left the global phone we were renting on a cab ride. Not much they could do because we just hailed a cab. Obviously someone picked it up and decided to keep it. When I called the phone, someone answered and as soon as I spoke the hung up and turned it off. The only negative thing we experienced at our hotel was some teenage girls coming in late. They were quite loud. Why parents allow their teenagers to carouse late at night is beyond me. We did not alert the hotel and would have if they had done the same thing the second night. I am sure they would have taken care of the problem quickly. We took recommendations from two friends that stayed at the BW Hotel Canada at separate times. The both highly recommended the hotel to us. Glad we took their advice. I hate to say that this hotel was the best value of our trip, because they may raise the price now!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing would go back in a heart beat!”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveler1313
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome! I know that individuals have mentioned the distance from the major attractions but I don't agree the subway system is extremely simple with only two lines and the staff are more then willing to help you with directions. As well the elevator is not bad at all it is an older style but effective and what can be expected when on vacation in Europe. They have a fantastic breakfast buffet with delicious espresso! As well the rooms are much larger than an average room to be found in Europe. The staff is amazing, especially Vincenzo and Claudio, they have an excellent attitude and are always willing to help. The area also has a great restaurant across the street and an awesome pizzeria. Being close to Termini station is also super convenient which allowed us to save big on day trips and getting to and from the airport. I recommend all go and stay here, it is an awesome place to rest during your Roman adventure!

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast and most comfortable bed in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ArtHistoryTeacher
Reviews.Content: My room was gigantic! Charming antique furnishings. Most comfortable bed ever! Fabulous bathroom with a large tub. Entire hotel was immaculate. The breakfast buffet was the best I have ever had in Europe (except for the Best Western in Istanbul). Free Internet was supposed to work in my room, but it didn't, so I used my laptop in the lobby. My particular room (on a lower floor at the street corner) was a little noisy, but a room in another location (perhaps an interior room) would probably be fine. One man at the reception desk was condescending, but everyone else was pleasant and gracious—especially the incredible lady who attends the breakfast room—she was lovely! This hotel is located near the train station, so it is convenient in that respect, but the neighborhood itself is a little seedy and had no good restaurants. However, Rome is small enough to walk just about anywhere, so for me the location was not a big problem. Just be aware and cautious at night and in crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Great water pressure”
Reviews.Author: Bawgreen
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this Hotel. There are several positives -- including the cost, the buffet breakfast, the courtesty of the staff, and the excellent water pressure (for what that is worth). But there are also negatives -- the most significant being that the Hotel is too far removed from the highlights/monuments of the city (nothing is really within walking distance -- the Blue Metro line is one block away, the Red line is a 6 block walk, cabs are available but they can get expensive), the airconditioner did not work well through the day, the Internet was slow (did not support Skype) and did not work in our room (althought it was suppossed to), althought generally clean our comforter had foot prints on it one day (they most have noticed as we had a new comforter the next day), and the Reception never seemed to have change when I needed it. Overall, despite the positives, I would choose another Hotel next time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Want to feel like Royalty?”
Reviews.Author: 1Michelle
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 4 nights. We selected this hotel for its location, near the train station. It was about 4 blocks walking and located near several nice restaurants. Our room was incredible. We honestly felt like it was elegant, beautiful and comfortable and equal to a much more expensive hotel. There is a sitting room for afternoon drinks and free appetizers or just relaxing, with a computer available, at no charge. The breakfast is incredible, with hot and cold items, meats and cheeses, cakes, cereals, all kinds of breads. You have your choice of hot drinks served to you. The waiter was very attentive and nice. The china and tableclothes are first class. It was a short walk to a hop on-hop off bus, city buses, and trains, very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely recommended!”
Reviews.Author: kelly1231
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short walk from termini station (but do watch out which exit you take, or you'll be walking around in circles forever...as we did on the night of arrival!) The rooms are nice, with a well equipped bathroom. the atmosphere in this hotel is very good and you feel at home as soon as you've checked in. Personnel is friendly and very helpful and breakfast is so good and plentifull that a late lunch is the result.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Zaff4travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights, and really enjoyed this hotel. It's only seconds away from the Castro Pretoria Metro station, and a short walk from the Termini. Although it's not in the absolute centre of Rome, it is very quick and easy to get around from here. The hotel is small, with a friendly, professional staff who speak English if needed. The rooms are well appointed and spotlessly clean, with very efficient air conditioning, and wonderfully comfortable beds. Breakfast is served in an airy, pleasant room, and includes delicious coffee and a good selection of food. There is an attractive bar area for later in the day, with tasty nibbles in the evening and very reasonable prices for coffee, wine or spirits.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Geoscientist
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers great value and good service in a convenient location walking distance from the main train station in Rome. The rooms are large with comfortable beds. The staff are very efficient and helpful. There are numerous nearby restaurants with reasonable prices and good food. When I visit Rome again I will be returning to this hotel. Breakfast is included and is served in a bright, spacious room with numerous choices. Just don't arrive too late in the morning or you will have to wait to get a table!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: Sharpie180
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Canada for 3 nights with my husband and mother in law. We had two rooms, both of which were quite sizeable. We really enjoyed our stay. The staff were friendly, and check in was a breeze. Nothing was too much trouble for anyone, and reception were happy to print off pre-booked tickets for us etc if we emailed them down to the main office (free wi-fi was on offer, which was great). I also heard them booking Opera tickets for another couple and giving helpful advice about directions to an out of town site. I was initially concerned as the hotel was on a corner of a main road, but we were undisturbed by traffic noise in the night with the windows closed and aircon on. The bed was extraordinarily comfortable, and the shower was powerful and hot. The room was spotlessly clean, and the bathrom was very good quality. Breakfast was served until 10 am and was pretty busy at times. There was a good continental spread,. and a hot buffet of eggs, bacon etc (not cooked to order). Everyone mentions the bar, and how reasonable it is...it's so true! We were expecting hiked prices for Rome, but I don't think I have enjoyed a glass (or half bottle!) of decent wine in a city establishment cheaper than this anywhere in the world! Coupled with the canapes on offer, this was such a nice treat to come back to after a hot day out. OK, this hotel is not in the absolute centre of Rome, but it's so easy to get anywhere from here. You can either walk to the main station -Termini (10 mins, turning right out of the hotel), or there is a closer Metro station (Castro Pretorio) about 200 metres round the corner (turn left and left again). At the end of the road (by the Termini) you can also pick up one of the many types of "Hop On Hop Off" buses, and there is also a bus stop for a bus going back to the airports. The Metro starts at 5.30 am, and you can get anywhere for 1 euro (single journey) so long as your route doesn't take more than 75 minutes. It's so easy to use as there are only 2 lines. Top Tips: Pre Book every entrance ticket that you can...it's slightly more expensive, but the Colisseum and Vatican queues are worth avoiding at all costs, particularly on a hot day. We walked straight to the front, and saved ourselves a good hour at least. If you are an early riser, then hop on the Metro and go and see the sun rise over St Peter's Basilica..quite stunning..I had it almost to myself for a while...It opens early too, so you could beat the crowds to get in. A walk to the Spanish steps via the Pantheon at that time of the morning is a joy. Watch the artists setting up in Piazza Navona, have an early Capuccino in one of the back street cafes, and see Rome slowly wake up.. As for the Hotel Canada, we would definitely stay here again....Such good value for money...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful breakfasts; would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: uskatz
Reviews.Content: This was the first of eight hotels (including four star hotels) we stayed in during a three week trip to Italy, and it was our favorite. Excellent and wonderfully decorated rooms, accommodating staff, and the best breakfasts we had on the trip. Also, it was the only hotel that gave us a choice of a firm or soft pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel For Stay In Rome”
Reviews.Author: Philjack
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Canada is perfectly located within 5 minutes walk of Termini Station. From arrival to check out staff were very friendly and efficient. The rooms are individualy decorated with very high ceilings and are spotlessly clean. We had a large bathroom with lots of nice finishing touches. The breakfast was escellent there was something for everyone. The bar was suprisingly cheap and a lovely place to retreat to after a hard days sightseeing. Would definately return to Hotel Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shotsblue
Reviews.Content: Reception - Really friendly and helpful staff at al times of day and night. Nothing was too much trouble. Room - Really nice clean room with furniture in keeping with age and decour of hotel. Although our room didn't have any drawers in it we left all of our smalls in our case. We were in room 104 and had our very own little garden outside which we sat in after a hard day sightseeing. Shower & bathroom was good with plenty of hot water. Air conditioning didn't work at first but came on in night and they sent an engineer out the nxt morning. Breakfast - Good selection of food includeding hot/cold and cereals and fruit Bar/Lounge - This really is a little oasis where you can relax and unwind. The drinks really are so cheap and lots of free nibbles If anyone has any questions I am quite happy to try and answer them

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: gkuta
Reviews.Content: After reviewing and contemplating the myriad choices of hotels for our trip to Rome, we eventually settled on the Hotel Canada. Our selection was based on the numerous positive reviews on this, as well as other travel forums, the excellent room rates we obtained, and a review of the hotel’s web site. Hotel Canada proved to be an outstanding choice, and I would add that the property deserves at least a four star rating rather than its designated three stars. Although some travelers may hesitate booking this hotel because of its location, I would counter that although it is not in the middle of the most popular tourist areas, it nevertheless is located on a quiet street very close to the Castro-Pretorio metro stop, as well as the main rail/subway station. Bus service is also readily available in front of the Termini. Moreover, there are a number of excellent, non-touristy restaurants in the peripheral area. We found the hotel to be meticulously clean and well maintained with a friendly, professional and efficient staff. We enjoyed a large double room with a queen bed that was very comfortable. The room was nicely decorated and large by European standards, allowing for a great deal of maneuverability. The bathroom, although not overly large, was nevertheless efficient with an excellent selection of amenities that are not normally included at most three star hotels (i.e., toothbrushes, slippers, q-tips, etc.). An electronic safe is set inside a wall; there is a flat screen TV, and ample closet/drawer space. Housekeeping was always completed in a timely manner. Finally, having an air conditioned room was a great benefit given the warm temperatures in Rome during our stay. We have traveled throughout Europe and without exception, the included buffet breakfast is one of the best we experienced. The quality, selection, variety and presentation are simply outstanding. Wait staff were very friendly, professional and efficient. This is an excellent and impressive hotel that is very easy to recommend to anyone visiting Rome. As mentioned earlier, in my opinion it is deserving of a higher rating than its designated three stars. We are looking forward to our next trip to Rome and again staying at the Hotel Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Big_BroLeuven
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family on a business trip to Rome. The rickety elevator is an experience to ride but doesn't feel unsafe at all. Comfortable room for 4 with a modern bathroom with all the necessary ammenities. Only the in-room WiFi Internet is a bit hard to configure without help from the reception desk. Speaking of which, the reception staff are very experienced personnel who make you feel at home and address you with your name from the second encounter. The breakfast area is a bit small and can feel cramped at peak hours. The Breakfast buffet is a typical Italian one with adequate choice and daily changing offerings. Ask accordingly if you want Italian style coffee, if not you'll get a pot of American coffee. The bar area has several corners with appropriate activities (eg. TV, PC internet, reading area with library and even a Wii which the kids loved playing on when we were grounded due to the rain outside). The drink prices are also very moderate. Several good restaurants, Metro stop and taxi stop just around the corner(s). Termini railway station within walking distance from where you can start your journey into the eternal city All in all a nice city hotel at a good location

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: LimerickNative
Reviews.Content: Stayed here due to the overwhelming positve responses on trip advisor. Great helpful staff who take pride in their spotless and conveniently located property. Very close to the Castro Pretorio metro station and a 7 minute walk to the termini. Took advantage of the long stay discount of four or more days and the price for this breakfast included hotel is quite reasonable by Rome standards. Edwin is a barman's barman and his multi -language sentences and hospitality should not be missed. After hours of walking enjoy the least expensive drinks in Rome and Edwin prepared snack treats. Roughly 2/3 American and 1/3 UK crowd is the norm but we had Austalians, Italians and Canadians to chat with. Would stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel !”
Reviews.Author: VancouverIslandAnne
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night at this hotel before our flight home to Canada. We had a beautiful corner room. It was large, and beautifully decorated. The staff were just great, and if we ever get back to Rome we would not hesitate staying at this hotel. We were actually disappointed we didn't get to Rome earlier and stay at this hotel longer than just one night. It was spotless with a really comfortable bed, and a large bathroom. It was one of the nicest hotel rooms we have ever stayed in. The continental breakfast was excellent ! You can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and overall good hotel”
Reviews.Author: marianne13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in May. We went to Venice, Florence, Sorrento and Rome during our trip to Italy and picking a hotel in Rome was the hardest part. I wasn't sure about staying near the Termini since a lot of travelers referred to the area as "charmless." After looking at the prices for nice hotels that are more central and comparing them to what we could pay for the BW Hotel Canada, I ultimately decided to stay here. As far as location, we were very happy. The hotel is located very close to the Castro Pretorio stop on the blue line. I never found the area around the hotel to be shady or seedy at all. At night, there were plenty of couples and families walking around. Our dining experiences near the hotel were better than what we experienced in the center of Rome as well. Overall I am happy that we chose this location as opposed to a more central location because it was nice to walk around at night and not deal with the heavy traffic, the scooters and the guys on the street trying to sell you junk. As far as the hotel, our room was very clean and our bed was a comfortable queen sized bed. However, our shower was very small. It was hard to stand up in the tub because it was so narrow that you had to somewhat align your feet against the side of the tub (if that makes sense). Also, the walls must be very thin because we were frequently awakened at 7 AM by people in the hallway talking and slamming doors (and we are NOT light sleepers). Overall, I think the hotel was a very good value and would recommend it to someone else. I would stay here again but I would spend more money and stay in a bigger room with a bigger bathroom and tub.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - Believe the Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Colie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights before joining our tour group at another hotel. This hotel is beautfiul, quaint frescos, and extremely clean. From the front staff who are extremely helpful, to the bar staff, Edwin, and breakfast room staff and even housekeeping they understand customer service and want to make your stay a memorable one! The bed was very comfortable, they offered beautiful bath products, slippers, etc. We had a large deluxe room which was lovely with in-room wifi. Large bathroom which was extremely clean clean clean! The breakfast was quite lovely, more than enough choices to fill you up before your sightseeing day! The location was great as well, only 10 minutes from Termini (we took advantage of that and took a day tour to Florence) and very convenient, two stops to Colloseum. Even though Pretoria stop closed early, you could always get off at Termini and feel safe to walk back to the hotel. Some nice restaurants to enjoy in the immediate area of the Hotel, Mama Angela for one. The best - we had mentioned that it was our 32nd wedding anniversary and upon return to our room we found champagne and chocolates in our room! What a wonderful thoughtful touch! Do visit, you will enjoy yourselves. Anyone we met in the hotel loved their experience. Bellisimo!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shaaley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple nights during a 3 week trip in Italy. Funny enough, when looking for hotels we at first didn't click into Best Western Canada, as we wanted to experience Italy, not Best Western Canada. But we soon realized that the price was pretty good comparitively speaking and so we checked tripadvisor and saw people loved it. So we booked. And boy am I glad we did! In short, this is a fabulous hotel in every way. The room was great! Very spacious. Very nicely decorated (nice antique-y looking furniture in great condition). The room was well put together/coordinated. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. It had memory foam matress, I think. And the pillows were the best I have experienced. Such a good sleep we had! The bathroom was very nice and spacious, with a long big bathtub - and a ledge to sit down while in the shower - perfect for ladies to shave their legs! The soaps and shampoos, etc were awesome. All had a different flavour/scent. TV was mostly italian channels of course, but it had CNN and BBC. There also was a stereo/CD player near the bed. My boyfriend had trouble finding the safe. I told him to check under the pictures, half joking. Sure enough, that's where it was! The room was very clean, very well maintained. It had a quaint old-style elevator that takes you up to your room (the building is 150 years old), which was a nice touch. The lobby area is very nice, with several seating areas. The bar was small but the drink prices were great and it was quiet, so we had a lovely time enjoying some wine in the sitting area. Also, the free cookies, crisps and snacks were nice. The breakfast buffet was decent, except for the eggs. (We stayed at 5 hotels with breakfast buffets and not ONE hotel could get the scrambled eggs right.) Location wise, it's about 6 blocks from the train station. Rome only has two metro lines and Line A shuts down at 9pm!! So one night, we did have a trying time getting back to our hotel. The metro/bus system was our only real negative experience with Rome. But it was very nice to return to our lovely hotel after a crazy busy day in Rome. And to relax our weary bodies in a nice warm bath. We would return to this hotel in a heartbeat. I highly recommend for those of you staying in Rome. (Plus, as Canadians, it was nice to see the red "Best Western Canada" as we walked up to it. A little reminder of home :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jknightdog
Reviews.Content: Once again we chose a Hotel that had been highly rated by Tripadvisor and we were not dissapointed! The rooms were of a high standard and plenty of choice at breakfast. As we were told by Tripadvisor Members the Bar must surely have some of the cheapest drinks in Rome and late afternoon the Staff put out a selection of crisps,nuts and small cakes and crackers for you to help yourselves! One Gentleman called Edwin that worked at the bar was a fantastic Host and paid attention to detail you could tell he showed a lot of pride in his work. All the Staff at the Hotel were very pleasent and it is honestly one of the best Hotels we have ever stayed at and that was reflected by other guests that we spoke to during our stay. Well done Hotel Canada!! Also free internet so that kept my daughter happy on Facebook!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MKM62
Reviews.Content: I liked everything about the Hotel Canada and would stay there again. I found the staff very helpful and friendly. My room which was on the second floor and directly over the lobby was very clean and very quiet. The hotel is an easy walk from the main train station and the metro. The breakfast was outstanding and the dining room staff exceptional. Dollar for dollar an excellent value. I recommend this hotel for budget minded North Americans.

Reviews.Title: “cannot believe it is only 3 star - should be 4”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller186258
Reviews.Content: we were recommened to this hotel, excellent recommendation - we were on fifth floor, noisy with traffic - when we closed windows no noise - it is a city break after all. Some people were very noisy going to their rooms and quite late into the night. Could be a little more considerate to other people staying in hotel. Breakfast excellent, drinks in the bar very very reasonable with free nibbles to help your drinks go down - these nibbles prepared by the bar tender, who is extremely helpful and nothing too much trouble. The room service was extremely good, any problems dealt with immediately. Rooms very clean. Hotel very close to termini, metros. and train station. Try the train journey to tivily, you will not be disappointed, we had a wonderful day there - the garden is spectacular.We used the shuttle service from the airport 6 euros, Really good as the shuttle buses are just outside the airport. The tickets were sold to us on board easyjet together with the tickets for the sightseeing hop on hop off bus in rome. The only problem we did have was in the trattoria which is situated in the same road as the canada and next to the American bar, didn't seem to be very keen on the british!

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: highflyer49
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canada offered efficient friendly service, rooms decorated in a traditional and tasteful style, and a very convenient location just a short walk from the Termini. Super clean and super quiet (we were on the 5th floor with a room facing the rear of the building) The staff serving the excellent breakfasts offered wonderful service and were very friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel when in Rome and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved every minute at this exquisite hotel”
Reviews.Author: CliveNorwich
Reviews.Content: It is really hard to find any criticisms about this lovely and extremely well run hotel. There are two slight negatives which should be covered first before getting on to the many many positives about this hotel. Firstly was the lack of electric sockets; there were only two available which were at skirting board level meaning to get to them you had to climb over a bedside table or an armchair. Secondly is the location which is a bit out of the way - however in some ways this is actually a positive as it meant when you returned to the hotel you were leaving the crowds of central Rome behind! Although the hotel is not in the heart of Rome, it is just around the corner from the Castro Pretoria metro stop or a ten minute walk to the Termini both giving easy access to the rest of Rome by either metro or bus! The hotel seems to have thought of almost every detail and nothing was too much trouble, starting with a lovely and welcoming reception area, comfortable bar and lounge area with loads of books to borrow. All of the staff were friendly and really helpful but special mention should be given to Vincenzo on reception and bartender Edwin; who was a real joy! Our room was lovely and really tastefully decorated with (what looked like) antique furniture, cd player and radio, built in safe and one of the most comfortable beds I've ever had in a hotel. Our room included a separate seating area with a desk making us feel like we had a suite! The bed linens were clean and the housekeeping staff kept everything spotless. We also had a large bathroom with all the usual shampoos etc and a pair of terry slippers! Although there was no tea or coffee facilities in the room, after requesting some with reception they delivered a "kit" to our room with a kettle within minutes. This was when we first discovered the lack of sockets. Considering the hotel has given so much thought to the details of the room, even installing built in nightlights which you can switch on from your bedside so that you don't disturb a sleeping partner if you need to get up in the night this seems a small detail they missed! Our room overlooked the central courtyard making it very quiet, although we missed the views we did get a balcony and were able to sleep with our windows open. We were celebrating a birthday in Rome and found a bottle of Moet and strawberries waiting on our arrival. We didn't drink the champagne till our last evening and left a note for housekeeping in bad Italian that morning asking if we could have the ice bucket filled and on our return that evening had a lovely bottle of nicely chilled champagne. I'm not sure you'd get that service in most 3 star hotels! A highlight of each day was the lovely (free) buffet breakfast. Angela and Massimo looked after things really well and went above and beyond each day to make certain we had everything we needed or wanted. Massimo would bring our usual cafe con latte without us even requesting it. The buffet was beautifully decorated and all foods were appetizing and included cereals, fruit, yogurts, meats, fish, cheeses, varieties of rolls and pastries, juice, and bread and jams etc. The hotel has WiFi, which you need to get a code for from Reception, but there is also a free computer to use in reception. One thing we thought was lacking was a printer but we were able to email our Boarding Passes to reception who delivered them to our room. Coming back to the hotel after a hard day sightseeing was a joy, making use of the free nibbles in the bar with a drink. The bar is the cheapest I've ever known in a hotel; a cafe con latte, espresso and a very generous limoncello was €5,00 - and to be served by Edwin was a real joy! Talking of dinner, although there is no restaurant in the hotel, the staff on reception were more than happy to make recommendations or reservations. There is a choice of restaurants in the area, we did eat at one of the recommendations on the first night but for the rest of our trip ventured back into central Rome each evening for dinner before having a leisurely walk back to the hotel (about 30 minutes) for a cafe and limoncello before bed! We loved every minute at this exquisite hotel, we were really sad to leave and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic older hotel with modern amenities in excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Judy0549
Reviews.Content: Quiet, gracious and quaint hotel with all the perks. Spacious bar with snacks in the evening, fabulous breakfast buffet, wonderful beds, close to many restaurants and very accomodating staff. Blocks to train station and tour bus pickups.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, cozy Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Marina_Ivashina
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two days - we liked almost everything, except a very narrow bathtub (no possible to sit down comfortely, taking into account that we have 38 size in clothes:). Rooms were remarkable!! Veru high ceilings, all decorated subtly, spacious rooms. Delicious B/F, although we did miss tea-making facilities in the room... Staff worth a separate mentioning... Especially JeanFranco!!! He is the best!! Unlike his colleague (dont recall his name, he was servicing us on the evening of check-out - 21 May)... once we asked him to get to know the working hours of FCO airport tax-refund facility, - he couldnt find out - he tried caling the airport (we found out ourselves later on - when got on Internet and FCO webisite). Next time we asked him the exact address of the FCO to put in our GPS navigator - he said "What a strange question?! Airport is aiport!! How would I call in and ask such trifle thing?!" No comment. Apart from this lazy-thinking person we can only praise this Hotel and its staff!! (Porter-boy was especially lovely person!!). Hotel is quite high in demand, so better to book in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: watsac
Reviews.Content: I travel 75-100 nights per year...Hilton Diamond member for 15 years. In May 2011, we had the opportunity to make a 14 day run through Europe - Rome, Santa Margherita di Pula (on the island of Sardinia), London and Paris. Only drawback was having to quickly make all the hotel reservations with < 2 weeks notice. This hotel was the first stop and it was a delight to find a spacious, clean and comfortable room which appeared to be recently remodeled. The staff and lobby personnel all spoke good English and were friendly and professional. The location was close to the metro (3 stops to the Colosseum) as well as walking distance to many nice restaurants. We had an inside room which allowed us to sleep with the windows open and at 168 euros per night for a room of this size with a queen bed, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Why would you stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: Baxterthetravelguy
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was wonderful but they say a picture is worth a thousand words so I took several. This has to be the best breakfast in the city (see pictures) and our room had the only walk out balcony (facing inside) with plants. We spent many a night sitting on that balcony and dreaming about the breakfast. All the staff were very pleasant indeed. Just a little hint. If you want the only nice balcony room maybe see if room 104 is available, it is non-smoking and has a lovely sofa. We may have snuck into some other rooms after they were cleaned and waiting for the next guest so we could get a picture to prove how nice the roooms really are. I got back yesterday and miss the hotels breakfasts. The chocolate croissants were very popular with my spouse. We found the breakfast so good that we could manage just a gelato for lunch. Easy walk with luggage from Termini Station.

Reviews.Title: “What more can I say”
Reviews.Author: uphnguyen
Reviews.Content: Not much more to add to all the positive reviews about this hotel. A real gem. Very professional from the reservation department (Nicole) to the front desk, the concierge service, the bar man, and the staff at breakfast. Our trip to Rome was a total success, thanks to this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “BEST WESTERN Hotel Canada”
Reviews.Author: Aido_man
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel Very good hotel packed with all facilities. Location is also very good which is in close proximity with several places that you would like to see on your stay. While we stayed in the hotel we enjoyed every moment and relished a lot on the delicious cuisines. Felt at home with wonderful hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, elegant and comfortable hotel for a relaxing break”
Reviews.Author: sallyg123
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in the Hotel Canada and really enjoyed our stay. Everyone is very helpful and friendly. The hotel has no restaurant and we were less than impressed by the local places to dine but it does have a bar, serving the best value coffee in Rome and very reasonably priced cocktails. Room service is very quick for drinks. Breakfast was the only slightly disappointing part of our stay but breakfast is a relatively unimportant meal for Italians. Overall, we were very content with this choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but ...”
Reviews.Author: Ataga
Reviews.Content: The hotel is realy superb. The good things are: - location: really close to main train/bus station or subway - free computer access - superb breakfast both warm ( sth like English one) and cold ( great buffet) - in the evening in the "bar" area there are aslo free refreshments - staff is awasome: nice, patient, helpful - in the bathroom you have everything ( just in case you forgot something) including super mini toothpaste, cream, sleepers etc. - tea and coffe facitilites are free of charge and you just have to ask for them so they will be brought to your room - the room are nice and spacious. However there is one thing I did not like. We stayed there twice. First time we had room on one of the upper floors - it was great. Second time we got room 104 which is on the first floor just by the lift and stairs. That room itself is really nice, big with huge balcony but becasue of the location it is really noisy. Till late night we could hear ppl slaming the lift doors, walking and talking on the stairs and sometimes even talking in the lobby/entrance area. I'm glad we stayed there only once - well if you sleep really hard that room might be ok. I would defnitaley stay again in this hotel only I would make sure my room is in the quite area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Balikat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights, excellent service. The hotel is not far from the Termini which makes it convenient to get to the tourist parts of Rome. The staff are terrific, Giovanni on the front desk, the lovely lady in the breakfast room, the Philipino waiters/ busboys. Everyone friendly and helpful. The breakfast was excellent, very different from our previous Italian Hotels. We had the larger room which was very comfortable and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location, style and service...”
Reviews.Author: AmericaninEurope10
Reviews.Content: Found the Hotel Canada on Tripadvisor. It lived up to its billing. The front desk staff was quite helpful with good English. My corner room (deluxe) was great: a furnished foyer, large closet, large bedchamber nicely decorated with a very large, good quality bed, nice furnishings including some antiques; and a large bathroom, nicely appointed. The electronics worked well and I got a nice cross breeze from the three windows. The hotel in general has a lot of charm and is nicely refurbished. The central staircase wraps around a perfectly restored "antique" elevator that is absolutely silent in operation. Other comments: the bar was a great value with a large nicely furnished seating area; breakfast good with great coffee; and the staff was very helpful in recommending local places to eat -- within easy walking; lastly the hotel is in walking distance to Termini (10 minutes) and 2 minutes from the Castro metro stop. Overall: Great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable and with good service”
Reviews.Author: RogerdB
Reviews.Content: Hotel prices in Rome are high and hotel Canada delivers a good value for money compared to most other hotels. We stayed there 4 nights in a luxury room on the 5th floor. Pros: -location is within walking distance of Termini Station (5 min.) and close to a metro stop: Castro Pretorio (line b). -Room was very nicely decorated, painted ceiling, good size bathroom -Room was quite large and clean -breakfast buffet is good -good service (making reservations, local restaurant suggestions, transportation) -good radio in the room (also in bathroom) Cons: -elevator is not very comfortable -price

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: citoyen-du-universe
Reviews.Content: I believe our reviews about the hotel is depending on the room we stay. We had booked for two nights, one night off for leaving to Sorrento and then another night for three persons. Hotel has two side, one side with three rooms the other side with many rooms. At the first stay, our room was at the first side. One king bed and one small bed near the door. The room was average and seemed a little empty. Noise from the corridor came easily to the room and it was hard to sleep. The internet quality was good and when we asked for tea maker they sent a complete set to our room. Location of Hotel is good since it's near Metro station just one stop from Termini at the same time it's far from the crowd. Breakfast quality and variety was good however breakfast room was a little bit small and at the peak time you should wait for a free table. The main problem of this hotel is the lift. It has two different doors which should be both closed other wise the lift does not move. Many hotel clients does not know this a leave the inner doors open. So this force you come down or up by the staircase which is not so easy when you tired. My son left his mobile at the lobby but when we contacted the hotel from Sorrento it never found. However we can not blame anybody in the hotel for that. Second time, we were in the other side of the hotel which was much more quiet and the room was bigger we had good sleep during the night but our room was neighbouring a room called with a "Service" sign on that which was used by hotel staff. They made too much noise at early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel close to the Termini station”
Reviews.Author: Wales500
Reviews.Content: Our room was nice, clean & spacious. The breakfast was good. The bar in the hotel was cheaper than those outside. A really good hotel and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel; for the price, for the location, for the general standard it was more than adequate”
Reviews.Author: Jimvin
Reviews.Content: Sometimes, on trip advisor, you read too many people moaning about the 3 star hotels because they were expecting so much more, as they have a good rating with trip advisor. This hotel is not a 5 star, it competes with many 4 stars, and its location is not formidable but it is everything you ask for a hotel in the centre, or for the pedants close to centre, of Rome. This hotel is 400 metres from the main station and all the necessary bus and train connections you can imagine, and there is a metro some 150 metres around the corner, With regard to the hotel. The hotel is well decorated, perhaps slightly over the top in places, and trying to be what it is not, but I would not say that this hotel is looking shabby. The room, which had a sizeable double bed, was reasonable. I have had bigger, but I have also had smaller hotel rooms. The bathroom was looking slightly tired. The tiles had been re-grouted rather than replaced but everything was in good order and clean. That is one thing I cannot fault - the cleaning and room service has been exemplary for a hotel of this star rating. However, if there is one area that the hotel needs to work on it is possibly its staffing ratios - I have had a bar man who was also concierge and baggage boy and therefore I have noticed he was not always in position - say if you wanted a drink at the bar. For visiting Rome, this was a good choice and I would recommend it. Will I stay somewhere else next time? Probably. That is not out of dislike for the hotel but for now that I know the layout of Rome I would go for a hotel around some of the key piazzas. This will suit most. The price is good, especially good for what you get, and for those who want class then book into one of the Boscolo hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel with first class staff”
Reviews.Author: girasolEastLothian
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in this hotel and were very impressed. The room was nicely decorated (frescoes on the ceiling). The bar area was lovely as well and not as expensive as we thought it would be. The bed was so comfortable, can't remember when I last slept so soundly! The staff in reception, the bar and the dining room were all very polite and friendly. Good choice of things for breakfast as well. In every way it was more superior than the Four Star hotel we went on to in Florence. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: BobBoydLittleton_CO
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 18th stay at the Hotel Canada over the last 16 years. The first time I visited Rome I stayed at another nearby hotel which was acceptable but not outstanding. The next time, Best Western recommended the Hotel Canada and we have not stayed anywhere else since then; in fact, when the hotel is fully booked we change the dates of our visit so that we can stay there. This time we stayed in room 522 with a nice view overlooking Castro Pretorio. The room is spacious, as all the rooms seem to be, with innovative décor around the bed using antique altar railings and a cornice above the bed. Bath room is great, but none have been bad in any of our visits. The hotel is spotless and the décor is in a state of continual upgrading. On one of our trips we were able to watch the very talented lady who painted many of the ceilings. The buffet breakfast is exceptional, offering sufficient choices to please all but the most demanding guests; the only negative is the unimpressive orange juice. There has been some recent turnover in the breakfast room staff which has made for a noticeable improvement. Massimo was especially attentive despite the brisk pace of coming and going in the fully booked hotel. The reception staff is as exceptional as everything else about the hotel. It is really welcoming to be remembered when you check in. The neighborhood around the hotel is generally quiet (with the exception of Castro Pretorio which is very busy during the day) and totally safe. It’s not a touristy area which undoubtedly accounts for the extremely reasonable rates. As others have noted, it is a brief walk to Termini Station and a line B metro station is just around the corner. If this hotel were located near the Spanish Steps or the Pantheon it would probably cost twice what it does. I cannot speak highly enough about the Hotel Canada. If you’re planning a trip to Rome and stay here, I can assure you that you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “good value high quality and well situated”
Reviews.Author: gaffelaar
Reviews.Content: On past visits to Rome I always styed clear of the Termini area as i saw it as a cheap hotel and tourist ghetto, but this is a good value exception. I stayed three nights and would recommend the hotel. High quality furnishings, good sized room and modern clean bathroom, excellent breakfast and in a quiet side street 2 mins to the metro and one stop from Termini. A couple of basic but good quality restaurants nearby as well as a small supermaket. My only complaint applies to all Italian hotels, why no tea and coffee machine in the room! Oh, and they give plastic cups not glasses, but the bar downstairs will supply glasses. The hotel (as well as the two nearby reaturants) were full of Italians and busy even mid week in March, so not tourist traps.

Reviews.Title: “Just like all the reviews said...spacious room and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: hotelsalot
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Canada with one teenager and two twenty somethings, and we were comfortable in our room with a double bed and two singles. The windows open, but were very soundproof when closed. The location was good, with several restaurants nearby, and just a ten minute walk to Termini Station, which allows access to all trains and buses. We felt very safe in this area of Rome. The breakfast was excellent, as all reviews indicated. Snacks in the lobby were pretty minimal, but still a nice touch. Free wireless was available, as well as a computer available in the lobby. The front desk was extremely helpful in helping us make reservations for local attractions--I would recommend using them rather than trying to figure out how to make reservations on the internet, because once you are over there, most of the reservation sites are in Italian and difficult to maneuver. We asked the front desk to reserve a taxi for our 5:00 am departure to the airport, and they had a full size car with driver waiting for us when we came down. Several fresh towels were provided daily, and the hotel was very clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, comfortable room and bath. Good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Henry_Baxter
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Best Western Canada. The hotel is very clean, our room was very nicely furnished and spacious, our bathroom was nice-sized and had the best shower situation of the three hotels we stayed in in Italy. The lift is very quaint (small but so cute!) The breakfast was very good, though the cereal selection was lacking. This was important for us as some of the other selections didn't quite suit us (I think Americans just eat different things for breakfast than Europeans eat). They always had a hot egg dish so that helped. The service personnel in the breakfast room were very, very nice. The front desk staff was also helpful. They provide a tray for having coffee/tea in the room. That was a nice touch.The location near Termini was also good.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we came back!”
Reviews.Author: terryandhelen
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Canada to be just as we remembered it from our visit 3 years prior! The rooms were very comfortable and extremely clean. Service was wonderful with a room provided early so we could leave luggage and head off to the football game. Returning to happy hour, with nibbles provided, completed our day. One of our group likened the lounge to 'someone's living room'. Breakfast was well catered for with both hot and cold selections. The hotel is located close to the Termini - 5 minutes walk, has a subway around the corner and there is a good choice of restaurants nearby. We found the best price on the Best Western web site.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: wurtz77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on the last leg of our trip of Italy and Amsterdam. The hotel was very nice and the staff were very helpful. The location is right around the corner from a train stop and it was fairly easy to get around to all the main attractions. Next time I visit I think I would prefer to be in a location more centrally located as this was not in walking distance of main attractions. But overall it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ike_fedas
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, well located, very clean, stylish and not expensive. That sums it up what else do you need? We moved from a 4 star hotel we didn't like to this 3 star tat deserves te 4 stars. By te way great tratoria close to the hotel, Tratoria Pretoriana.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and service”
Reviews.Author: Traveller4047
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Canada for 3 nights whilst touring Rome. When we arrived the reception was friendly and they took our bags to the room. The lift is very tiny but fun (well I thought so). We stayed in double Queen room and both the room and bathroom were very clean. There were plenty of towels and little toiletries in the bathroom. I have stayed in five star hotels that did not have such a nice room. The hotel does not have a restaurant but there are plenty in the area so that is not an issue. We made use of the bar and the drinks were a really good price and the canapes were very good. The bar staff were extremely friendly. The breakfast buffet in the mornings was very good with a continental selection and also eggs,bacon and sausages. The pastries were very fresh and delicious. Once again the breakfast staff were extremely friendly. We connected to the internet during our stay and had absolutely no problem doing so. Although the hotel is located a little bit outside of the main attractions it is a 2 minute walk to the metro station and as there are only 2 lines in Rome it is very easy to do. I would recommend staying in this hotel. I would also recommend seeing Rome in the low season as you can avoid the queues.

Reviews.Title: “nasty snooty front desk”
Reviews.Author: mysterym
Reviews.Content: I can't believe anyone things the service at this hotel is good. They gave us an internet code, which didn't work. They claimed it was our fault. Then, they said it was only good on the first device (my husband's phone) we used. I wanted to skype on our computer, so, have many trips to the loby, they finally gave us another code. We wanted a bottle of water and were told we had to get it in the bar. The bar was unattended. The desk clerk told me the bar guy was busy somewhere else and would return shortly. They did have some free snacks, but, the staff did not tell us about that when we checked in. The bar tender waited on 2 people who were there first before getting water. I wanted a shower cap. I was told to pick it up at the front desk. The front desk person claimed they didn't have any. Another clerk overheard my request and got one for me. I also had to get extra towels from the front desk. I guess if you are lucky and your internet code works and you don't want anything else, you'll like this. The breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice & clean”
Reviews.Author: Espoo_FinlandMeri
Reviews.Content: The Canada hotel is very nice. The service is friendly and price very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “A veritable haven”
Reviews.Author: GregfWatts
Reviews.Content: After an early flight we very much appreciated the friendly welcome, the early room availability and the unexpected upgrade that was afforded to us upon our arrival at the Hotel Canada. The reception area was tatstefully decorated for Christmas and the large room exceeded our expectations, particularly the tiled floors and frescoes on the ceiling. It is also worth noting that the hotel has a very comfortable and relaxing bar area with exceptionally cheap prices (6 Euro for a BOTTLE of wine). The hotel is located a little way from the main attractions but note that there is a metro just a short walk from the hotel (much nearer than walking to the Termini) and it takes you to a stop just outside the Colosseum. From there you can walk north and visit just about every other main attraction without too much effort. It's worth getting the 4 Euro day transport ticket and then just jump on and off the numerous buses. Our most notable memory of Rome however will, unfortunately, be our struggle to return home due to snow-bound UK airports forcing us to stay an extra two nights. Although this is potentially a bonus, commitments in the UK meant that we spent a lot of time re-booking and looking for alternative routes and modes of transport. What was a delight however, was how accommodating and flexible the reception staff were, while we went through the highs and lows of re-booked and continuously cancelled flights. In this regard I would particularly like to commend Gianfranco for his exceptional level of service although I should say that all staff were most profesional. A gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well deserved praise”
Reviews.Author: TigersfanHampshire
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for seven nights, based on the excellent TripAdvisor reviews. I was in no way disappointed. All the praise which is heaped upon this hotel is thoroughly deserved.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: JDFOttawaCanada
Reviews.Content: We spent just one night here after returning by train from the Amalfi coast. We did not like the location as much as where we had stayed earlier on our trip, near the Colosseum, but the hotel itself is outstanding. Our room was elegant with many nice touches. We definitely had the best breakfast by far of our 2 week trip to Italy. Luggage storage and taxi to the airport were all handled well. And all this at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hidden Gem in a Fantastic City”
Reviews.Author: Phil1G
Reviews.Content: The positive reviews for the Best Western Hotel Canada that helped us decide to take a chance on the hotel were absolutely correct. THIS IS A GREAT HOTEL! Did Thanksgiving Holiday with family (2 teens and wife). A few short blocks and easy walk from the Roma Termini (train station). Room was fabulous and perfect. We travel a lot and stay in Marriott, Hilton and Intercontinental worldwide, this small boutique hotel easily exceeded these flagship hotels. Breakfast buffet was excellent and the wait staff efficient and friendly. Front desk personnel were always polite and helpful, whenever we needed assistance. Location was less than a block from the Roma Metro which gave us easy access to all the sights. The staff gave us a few useful tips and we were off on a great adventure. Lots of great restaurants close by and every meal we had was well prepared and presented, the wait staff friendly and ALL the restaurants were clean and welcoming. Do we plan on staying here again? A resounding "YES".

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: steada
Reviews.Content: What is really great about this hotel is that the same warm and personable staff is there year after year. We stayed here in October 2010 and loved it. I stayed at The Canada a year ago and I felt like my friends were still there to greet me when I returned. A good location close to a metro station, but very nice people and spacious quarters made for a wonderful experience. Again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best bed in Rome(?)”
Reviews.Author: JKDC
Reviews.Content: I moved to this hotel after being unable to sleep in another hotel that I had booked from overseas. In the process of making my decision I looked at two other hotels. The Best Western Canada was the only hotel I came across with an "American style" bed instead of a 20-year-old dilapidated bed. Moreover, the bed in the Best Western Canada hotel was *extremely* comfortable --- large and firm. If you are sensitive about such things (as I am) then I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. The hotel also scores high in other areas. The room was not large, but by Rome standards it felt roomy. The room was also beautifully decorated, with high ceilings decorated with Italian art! The bathroom was nice-sized, and there was a full tub. The breakfast was very excellent, and included fresh-baked pies and cakes in addition to outstanding bread and cheese (and more --- there was quite a bit of selection). Service was friendly, and the hotel lobby has a bar with reasonably priced drinks! The price of the room, while higher than the other hotels I was looking at, was reasonable for Rome. The main downside of the hotel is the location --- the hotel is not walking distance from any sights. However, it is very conveniently located 6 blocks away from the central train station plus a Metro stop (Termini) where both lines run. (It is even closer to the Castro Pretorio stop, but I found it more convenient to walk to Termini.) The neighborhood around the hotel was fine; I noticed no problems at night, and in fact the hotel is near a lot of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel close to Termini station”
Reviews.Author: wetlandsUpperMidwest
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night before leaving for the airport in the AM. Very helpful staff. Breakfast was arranged beatifully and choices were outstanding. It is a 10 minute walk thru a comfortable neighborhood to reach train station. The room was small but very tastfully appointed. Bathroom exceptionally large and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “BW Hotel Canada was an excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: meandbutchie
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in a "prestige double" room and the decor and cleanliness was first rate. The desk staff were very helpfull in providing information and arranging reputable taxi services including a pre-arranged transfer service to Civitavecchia. Location is quite close to the central train station but we felt comfortable in walking around. The complimentary breakfast is superb and served in a warm and friendly atmosphere. We would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great value”
Reviews.Author: Leipiki
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week at this small intimate immaculate hotel. It's right next to a metro and it's about a 10 minute walk to the Termini. Taxis were there within minutes of being called. There's a small super market nearby with it's larger version just 2 more blocks away. Our room was impeccably clean and beautiful, and the mattress/sheets were great. The buffet breakfast was huge with lots of variety and good quality foods. We were in a room that was next to a street and it would get noisy at night from the restaurant/hotels on the other side of the street, but it did not bother us. So if you want absolute quite, then you should request an interior room. I was more worried about people in the hallway or the delightful old-fashioned elevator disturbing us, but I never heard a thing from the interior of the hotel. The staff were helpful and very nice. This hotel doesn't have all the amenities of a large hotel (i.e., swimming pool, etc.), but we were out playing tourist every day so we would not have used them anyway. The hotel does have a bar (free hors d'oeuvres in the evening), and free access to a computer, which we used quite often. We'd definately stay there again and we highly recommend this hotel. Even though we were paying 50% more in US dollars (because the dollar was so low compared to the euro during our trip) we found that even in US dollars this place is an incredible value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Most Friendly Staff Ever”
Reviews.Author: AlbionRT
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean with well equipped rooms. The breakfasts were absolutely excellent - varied and high quality food. Staff were the most friendly I have ever met - for example the bar staff took delight in providing a wide range of self made, free "nibbles" with the (excellent value) drinks; room staff went out of their way to make you welcome and reception were fluent in a number of languages. Nothing was too much trouble for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, good location, great service”
Reviews.Author: ttrip10
Reviews.Content: This a great hotel for the money and location, close to the Termini station and a metro stop; between metro,buses and walking its easy to get anywhere in Rome. As mentioned by others, is a little noisy, but then most of Rome is that way, quirks such as no iron/mini bar can be sorted an iron can be bought up from reception and the bar will bring beverages up to your room for no extra service charge. Breakfast was substantial with plenty of options and strong coffee to get you started for the day. Had no problems getting the wifi working. Room (we had deluxe) was a very decent size for a Rome hotel and 24 hour reception is always handy. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Dani1950
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel in September for 4 nights after coming off a 12-day Mediterranean cruise on the Queen Victoria. We were looking for something inexpensive and clean so our expectations were more than met at the Best Western Canada. Our large room was furnished with antiques and marble, had a lovely terraced garden, a safe for valuables, and was very tastefully decorated.
