The hotel itself was family-run, friendly and offered not only a huge, full breakfast but also had a library from which guests could borrow books with the option of taking them home if they were not finished by the time they left! I had run out of reading material when I arrived and was very pleased to have something to read in the evenings. Located near the main termini and a small grocery store, this hotel had everything we needed to make our stay in Rome a wonderful adventure.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: nanoo49
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Rome and read a lot of reviews before choosing this hotel. It was an excellent choice. From the moment we arrived, the staff were polite, friendly and helpful. Just a 5 minute walk from the Termini station and a few minutes from the closest metro station made it a very good location. Good, cheap places to eat in the location. Rooms were a little small but very clean and had everything we needed and beds were very comfortable. BUT walls were a bit thin and we did find it amusing listing to the rather vocal lady next door obviously thoroughly enjoying some intimate moments!! The breakfast was superb but had to be patient if you come down late and need to wait for a table but the staff did their best to accommodate everyone as quickly as possible. This was the cheapest place we found for alcohol and other drinks. Plus additional free snacks. We would definitely pay a return visit to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: maurice44
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to find any criticism whatsoever of this charming and extremely well run small hotel in Rome. Every detail seems to have been covered beginning with a lovely and welcoming reception area, comfortable bar and seating area, all appearing to have been recently redecorated. Our hotel room left nothing to be desired. Even the ceilings were painted with delicate floral motifs. Linens were crisp and housekeeping kept everything spotless. Amenities included a pair of terry slippers as well as other expected shampoos, creams, etc. The beds were extremely comfortable. A highlight of each day of our stay was the lovely buffet breakfast. The cheerful, energetic hostess went above and beyond each day to make certain we had everything we needed or wanted. Tea and a variety of coffees were always served piping hot. The buffet was beautifully decorated and all foods were appetizing and included varieties of rolls and pastries. Added to all this is the location of the hotel which is just a short walk from the Metro. We enjoyed every minute at this charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect introduction to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: loxias27
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved my stay at this hotel. I was travelling alone for a long weekend and this place was ideal. Just a short walk from Termini Station if you arrive here from the airport and then only 30 seconds from the nearest Metro. Plenty of local shops nearby if you need supplies. I found the staff here warm and friendly throughout the hotel which made a huge difference. My room was large, tastefully decorated with large doors opening over the courtyard - was nice to have some fresh air compared to a lot of hotels that don't let you open windows. The bed was comfy, the TV worked well, had a bath/shower with nice amenities. When I go back to Rome I will not even bother looking for somewhere else - it's perfect and a good price. Tip: Rome is small - don't bother with the tour buses, just walk everywhere. I would have missed so many gems if I had got the bus; and walking allows you to just pop in for one of those lovely gelatos or pizzas..yum!

Reviews.Title: “Great quality and location!”
Reviews.Author: D_F_CAN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days at Hotel Canada for our first trip to Rome. The location is great - down the street from the main Metro station (Termini) and within walking distance of most major sites. All of Ancient Rome is walkable if you don't mind 20-30 minute walks, which we don't. The breakfast at this hotel was outstanding! Eggs, meat, cheese, cereal, fresh fruit and delicious pastries. The hotel offers friendly service, is extremely clean and has a lovely decor. Couldn't have asked for more. We used the hop-on-hop-off tour bus which we picked up at the bottom of our street, close to Termini Station. You can buy your tickets at the bus and they are good for 48 hours. If you are going to use the Metro, the Roma pass is a good idea and can be purchased at one of the Tabbachi shops in Termini Station. You can also purchase individual Metro passes in the Tabbachi shop for 1Euro and 4Euro for a day pass. Great Gelato in Termini as well. Lots to do and see in Rome. Make sure you see Trevi Fountain at night. We did the "Night Walk" from Rick Steves travel book on Rome and it included the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. We recommend this. Also, wear comfortable shoes as all the streets are cobblestone. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: hardwareace1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two days at the tail end of a 14 day European cruise based on other TripAdvisor reviews. The hotel is exactly what the reviews say - a great little hotel conveniently located that has a very friendly staff. We arrived early (9:45am) as we had to depart our cruise ship at 8am. The front desk manager couldn't have been nicer - he apologized that our room wouldn't be ready for 20-30 minutes and had an assistant bring us coffee and tea on a silver platter while we waited. On the day of departure, our "ride" arrived at 7:25am rather than the prearranged 8:45am. The front desk manager made alternate arrangements for our trip to the airport. We loved the room - very old world but modern European with LCD TV, bidet, etc. As mentioned by others, the breakfast is great but don't expect an American style hotel buffet. I don't eat eggs and I had plenty to eat with rolls, croissants, juice and a few other items. However, there aren't any alternatives like French Toast, Pancakes, Waffles or potatoes so I was a bit disappointed after the buffet reviews. I'm a very health concious eater and I didn't try the undercooked bacon or the various types of large sausages or sliced luncheon-type meats. Like I said - I'm picky and I'm sure most folks would love that stuff but if you don't....just a little warning. The hotel has a small bar area with some couches and a few bar stools. Prices for cocktails and beer at the bar were the most reasonable I saw in Rome. If you don't want to venture far after a long day sightseeing - there are a number of casual outdoor spaces within a few blocks to have a nice lunch or dinner. All in all - a very nice hotel and we'd stay here again for sure if we venure back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great value overcomes so-so location”
Reviews.Author: sambruin98
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the last leg of my honeymoon in Europe. I spent A LOT of time researching hotels (price, rating, location, etc) and ultimately, decided this hotel offered the best combination of criteria. It's not a trendy hotel by any means, with a quaint little lobby and a tiny receptionist desk. We arrived on the train from Florence a little early at 11am, but the hotel did their best to accomodate our early arrival and by noon, we were in our room. When making the reservation, I mentioned that we were on our honeymoon and the staff was nice enough to have a bottle of champagne on ice for us shortly after check-in. The bellhop, maid and front desk personnel were all so warm and friendly--a recurring theme throughout our time in Italy. The room itself was about average for a European hotel, with plenty of room to stow our two large suitcases. The 'queen' bed may have been two twin mattresses put inside a queen size frame, but I can't remember with 100% certainty. The bathroom was roomy and clean, with a nice sized shower/tub. All in all, very good and worth the price. Location wise, this place is about a 8-10 minute walk almost directly east of the train station. It's not in a touristy locale at all, but my wife and I felt safe making the walk and it's literally one minute to the nearest subway station--only 2 or 3 stops from the Colosseo exit for the Colosseum. From there, you can pretty much get to wherever you want to go. Don't let the fact that this hotel isn't centrally located deter you at all--Rome is very much about walking the city. Overall, I'd highly recommend this place as a very affordable, quality hotel with pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, elegant, great professional service & wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: coastal6107
Reviews.Content: My first hotel experience in Rome was a nice one at the Hotel Canada. Staff were knowledgeable and helpful at the desk, as well as in the breakfast room where one of our servers had made an apple breakfast cake that was outstanding, and there was a nice variety of other food. The front desk's staff knew English more than in the dining/breakfast room, but we got by. It was a few long & rough-road blocks to drag suitcases from the station, but not a big deal once the suitcases were put in. There are good restaurants nearby & the hotel is just enough away from a main area to feel like a quieter neighborhood. The room was charming & the bathroom was nice. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel with great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Gavcol
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our cruise, for 3 nights, recommended by a travel agent who had stayed there. Clean, lovely, and spacious rooms with a large clean bathroom and a comfortable bed. We were on the street side but still quiet. Our traveling companions' room was on a courtyard and had a balcony. The small wrought iron elevator worked well unless someone left the door open on another floor. The lobby was like a comfy living room with a small library that included books on Rome, and snacks were left out in the evening. The one computer in the lobby provided free and fast internet. The included breakfast was wonderful with hot and cold items, eggs, pastries, juice, fruit, yoghurt, etc. and was served in a bright homey room by very pleasant staff. The front desk staff was very helpful with arranging for our early flight. They ordered the cab and advised us of the rate, and had a great breakfast tray with fruit, juice, a kettle, tea, coffee, croissants, and biscuits in our room when we got back to our room the night before we left. The location was fine for us, only 5 min from the Termini station and tour bus lines and not really a long walk from several of the areas we visited. The neighborhood seemed very safe to us. We found a great comfortable restaurant to eat nearby. I didn't compare prices to other area hotels but it seemed reasonable to us. My only complaint would be that the hard marble and terra cotta flooring meant that the sound traveled within the hotel, so you could hear even quiet conversations in the hallway, but the other patrons were quiet and respectful so this wasn't an issue for our stay. Also, I couldn't print my boarding passes from the lobby computer without emailing them to the front desk and then they couldn't open them to print. The desk clerk was very helpful though with this process.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LovetotravelRichmond
Reviews.Content: We have travelled a lot in Europe and this was our 4th or 5th trip to Rome. I am so happy I found this hotel and I thank all the other tripadvisor.com members who took their time to write about Hotel Canada or I would not have found it. The hotel was even better than expected and what a great value for Rome. I do agree with others who have written that it is out of the way and not within walking distance of any of the sites - believe me you won't care. This place is so lovely and at such a good price that it is worth it to take cabs. The rooms were huge, very clean, beautifully decorated, very comfortable beds and with very large bathrooms. We booked two rooms because we took our daughter with us so we saw two different configurations. We booked the higher priced rooms (not suites) and that money was well spent. The customer service was very good both before we got there and while we were there. The only time we had any problem was on our last day and we had to leave early in the morning and the night staff was still there. He wasn't very knowledgeable or helpful. Also be sure if you want to check on an early flight or print boarding passes do it the night before. This guy couldn't get me a passcode for the internet and even if he could have there was only one computer and a guy was "hogging" it looking at his facebook stuff. Anyway, if you stay here you will be very pleased. Forgot to mention that the breakfasts that are included are absolutely wonderful and this adds a lot to the value.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Sabine81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Canada for 4 nights, and it was great. The location is good, only a few minutes walk from Termini Station and there's a metro station right around the corner. It is quiet and the rooms are very nice and clean. The breakfast was nice and they serve it until 10:30 am. Be aware of the safe though, it might not open when you want it to.

Reviews.Title: “Best Continental Breakfast in Town”
Reviews.Author: DiplomatValise
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels that include a continental breakfast in the room rate. Most of the time the breakfast is not worth getting out of bed for. My stay at the Hotel Canada changed that notion. When I checked-in to the hotel, I was sick with a nasty cold. I woke the next morning with a scratchy throat and decided to go down to the breakfast room for tea before heading to the nearest Farmacia. I was seated by a gentle woman who could have been the Italian grandmother I never had. At the buffet tables, I was greeted by all sorts of traditional handmade Italian delicacies: pastries, frittatas, cheeses, fruit. It was wonderful despite of my sore throat. I made a point to wake up early for breakfast each day that I was in Rome. I now think of breakfast as one meal never to miss in Italy!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful staff and hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ceenite
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after our cruise. This is a wonderful hotel and deserves its ranking! Warm and welcoming front desk, large spotlessly CLEAN bathrooms with nice fluffy towels, lovely large bedrooms, wonderful breakfast room and menu. The building is exceptionally maintained, with a charming wrought iron elevator. The bartender couldn't have been more attentive when we stopped in for our first cocktail of the evening in the bar, complete with complimentary snacks. Free umbrellas to use when it rained, and they reconfirmed all of our tours and our airport transfer with a smile. We were leaving before the breakfast room opened so they delivered a huge breakfast tray to the room while we were getting ready to leave. There are several wonderful small restaurants in the neighborhood, which felt safe to walk around in at night. Easy walk to the Termini station and the hop on hop off bus stops (several to choose from). We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ORRC-2010
Reviews.Content: My family (myself, husband and 14 year old) stayed at the Hotel Canada for 5 nights. There is not a single fault with the hotel. We selected this hotel on recommendations from Trip Advisor and felt I needed to add my comments. The location is fantastic : 5-10 minutes max from the Termini train station and around the corner from the Metro. (I read one review that said the hotel was too far from the station. If this is too far - then don't holiday in Europe.) The room was spacious and the bed very comfortable. Great bathroom and toiletries. Everything was extremely clean. The breakfast buffet was sensational - plenty of choice from full cooked breakfast, to fresh seasonal fruit and yoghurt, or coffee and pastries - or the whole lot as my son managed. There is a supermarket nearby for bottled water. This was the best hotel we stayed in during our entire holiday in Europe and I will recommend it whenever I can.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mooseworm
Reviews.Content: We spent the last 2 nights of our honeymoon at the Best Western Hotel Canada. It far exceeded our expectations - it does not resemble a Best Western in the US at all. This hotel has charm and character, full of antiques, art and murals. The bar area is beautiful. They have an old fashioned elevator which may not be the fastest or largest, but we loved due to its character. We stayed in room 524, which was large, though we saw some of the double rooms and they were quite a bit smaller. I did not feel like I was in hotel - but rather in someone's home. The bed was comfortable and we slept great. The AC was the best we had in Italy, and the windows blocked the majority of street noise. The staff was extremely helpful with directions and even set up a car service for us. It is right around the corner from the Metro, and the hotel is a few stops from all major attractions. This place is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with bags of character”
Reviews.Author: Claire_murray
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights on a Best Western early booking deal. The hotel is lovely with lots of character. The rooms have antique furniture and tile floors. They are also strange shapes as the building has been converted so ours had walls at strange angles. The hotel had no air con but that's not a problem as the floors are cool and the windows are shaded (although that does mean it was quite dark inside). The staff were helpful. Breakfast was good with plenty of variety. The hotels is close to Termini station and consequently its easy to get to everywhere in Rome as you have access to public transport. There is also a metro station around hte corner (approx 250m away) which takes you direct to the Colosseum. Although the hotel is close to Termini, it is far enough from the station to be outside the area that's not that nice on a night. There are some nice local restaurants and the area is quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality/price ratio, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jchaimk
Reviews.Content: Got by Internet a very good price for a superior room. Very beautifully decorated, spacious room, very clean and a safe big enough to contain a netbook. Great buffet breakfast . The proximity of the Termini train station and a bus terminal makes easy to visit every part of Rome. Although the proximity of the train station, the surroundings are OK, with many restaurants around. The Staff is very sympatic and helpful. Higly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Quality stay in a convient location with in walking distance to attractions”
Reviews.Author: bartleypc
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and well maintained hotel. We had very clean rooms and very large bathroom (which we did not expect in Rome). Staff very pleasant, polite and helpful. Very easy to communicate with staff as all spoke English well. Location was very centrally located to all tourist attractions and within walking distance to most. Being located close to train station we could easily take the metro or buses when we decided to explore outskirts of city. Easy to take train from FCO airport and back upon departure. Staff well prepared to make reservations for us when we asked (or emailed requests before arrival) to make our visit to Rome an outstanding experience! Can't say enough nice things about Hotel Canada. Would recommend this hotel to friends and family and would stay here again! And breakfast each morning was amazing. We couldn't wait to see what delicious things would be available each moring.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Jmthorn51
Reviews.Content: We were conveniently located to all of the sights we wanted to see. In addition, our rooms were clean and comfortable and the price was right! We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably price hotel in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bibby00
Reviews.Content: This is an independently family operated hotel trading under the Best Western banner. We were unable to fault this hotel providing you were not travelling by car. Our room was splendidly decorated and fitted out with access to a small garden (balconies on upper floors). The breakfast that was included in the price was very good and all the staff were most obliging. The location is very close to Termini, the main railway station, in the centre of Rome where many bus routes start and the open topped city tour routes commence. Additionally the two metro lines meet at this point. There are a number of very reasonably priced restuarants nearby as the hotel does not serve dinner and there is a small supermarket around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveO220
Reviews.Content: We stayed the last two nights of our 12 day trip and it was the best hotel we stayed at. The beds are very comfortable and our room had a tub which was important to my wife. The breakfast was great and the staff very helpful. It is walkable from the train station which was important to us and was priced comparable with other places we stayed in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, stylish Hotel with great value.”
Reviews.Author: ingleban
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family (8 & 10) for 3 nights. Expected a typical Italian let down but were very pleasantly suprised. The Hotel staff are excellent, the decor is old style but very elegant and clean.Our Family room had double and 2 singles across 2 rooms with a safe and overall, a cosy clean "nice" room that we didn't want to leave. The Hotel was a nice spot to head back to for a rest after a morning out and before heading out again for the evening. Free wifi/internet and a nice bar area were also a plus. The location is 5 min walk from Termini and the Metro and say a comfortable 30 min walk to just about anywhere in Rome. Breakfast is a hustle and bustle affair with all sorts of savoury delights that really were above us but everyone else seemed impressed. We enjoyed our time here and would certainly return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mrbeco
Reviews.Content: Just a short walk from the train station. Very Comfortable with a nice breakfast and afternoon refreshments and snacks! Great little sidewalk cafe next door. And the staff was very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “VERY nice hotel. YES stay there.”
Reviews.Author: wahooswimming
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 5th floor, the bed was REMARKABLY the MOST comfortable bed. It felt like a Temperpedic, yes REALLY. I have degenerative disc problems, and after a night on that bed felt GREAT. The breakfast was very good, and plentiful, Fruits, yogurt, eggs, quiche, brioches, coffee, juices, prunes, danish. Lovely set up....clean, Charming. The furniture in the rooms was antique,but NOT run down, looked almost new. Draperies and bedding looked not only new but high quality, so refreshing! The employees were friendly. Good location near train station, but on the good side of the train station. More importantly the hotel was VERY VERY VERY CLEAN. Charming really, looked like what you would expect to see in Italy, just lovely. The hotel clerks were also so nice and friendly, as was the housekeeping staff. The hotel is much more charming in person than in pictures!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marce6
Reviews.Content: As many before have already said this is a great hotel. Breakfast is excellent and served until 10.30am. Bar prices are very fair 3.50 euros for a half bottle of wine. I dissagree with those who say it is a bit far from the centre. The tube is round the corner and the Termini is a 5 minute walk and my daughter and I felt very safe in the area. In fact we did not have one unpleasant experience the whole time we were in Rome. Hopefully will go back one day and would defo stay here again. My best tips would be see the Trevi Fountain at night, take the lift to the top of the Monument to Vittorio Emanuele II amazing views, and wear the most comfortable shoes you can find.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for the station”
Reviews.Author: IndabaYork
Reviews.Content: Within 5 minutes easy walk from the station - exit by the side entrance adjacent to platform 1 (it is a longer walk to the airport express train on platform 27 / 28 !!). A delightful small hotel with very efficient front desk. Lounge / bar area serving what must be the best buy in Rome - tea / coffee at Euro 1.50 including selection of biscuits. Bedroom, accessed by an antiquated lift, was of a good size and had all the extras expected of a good hotel. Extensive buffet breakfast served in a rather functional room. Appears to be a very popular hotel with tourists and locals.

Reviews.Title: “It's good but far”
Reviews.Author: Caro2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good, is well connected but this far. If you want to pause for lunch is far and uncomfortable to get to and from the main places to visit. Next time I will look for a hotel near the Pantheon or Piazza Navona.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are soundproof to OUTSIDE noise”
Reviews.Author: MikeDavis56
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convenient to the Termini station. My wife and I felt very safe in the area despite warnings. We have been told and saw evidence that officials are working to upgrade the area. If you walk to the hotel from the Termini, come up from Via Marsala. The hotel is all the way at the end of Via Vicenza. The nearest metro stop is Castro Pretorio. If you arrive by train, it would be quicker and easier to take the metro from Termini one stop to the Castro station, but you will have to carry your luggage up the stairs. Taxi drivers may not be willing to transport you and watch for the unlicensed taxi stand on Via Marsala. The official taxi stand is out front. The hotel is very quiet to outside noise, but not inside and it helps that the hotel is on a one way back street at the corner. The hotel has all tiled floors and an outdated elevator and you can hear folks climb the stairs and the elevator door slamming. It wasn't so bad after everyone settled in for the evening. You must manually close the doors to the elevator and if someone doesn't, you must climb the stairs to retrieve it. The hotel uses old fashioned keys that you must leave at the desk. Our room was big by European standards, the bath was huge, and everything was clean. They need to update the elevator and update to key cards. The staff was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “a romantic room well above 3 star with excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jodyandy1
Reviews.Content: we had to write in following our wonderful 3 days in rome as a start to our holiday for 2 weeks in italy. Our focus was a romantic feel in the room, cleanliness and privacy, a breakfast where you could relax without pressure, and wireless internet (only to allow us to book for events ahead, as we were letting our thoughts drive the itinerary). Having stayed in many hotels across work and holidays, this is excellent and above 3 stars. The room for the deluxe is very spacious with views across the city. The soundproof windows made a significant difference to the initial nights rest. The elevator in the centre is a special touch, yet amazingly quiet. There is some stigma on earlier reports of distance, which we found to be false. the hotel is 150m from the metro entrance that links you direct to all the sites within 5-15 minute period. The breakfast was impressive, and we looked forward each morning to our time in a well set out area - we rarely needed lunch and it started the da yperfectly before visiting the sites. the tobacco shop around the corner sold us the roma pass, which is perfect for unlimited travel for 3 days on metro and train, as well as free entry for 2 sites (we used colloseum and the capitol museum which avoided enormous cues). coming from the airport, we went across the road and up the elevator to the train station and took the shuttle bus direct to the hotel for 20 euro for 2 people, slightly more than the train but far less challenges in carting luggage across the termini and 500m to the hotel. would stay there again unconditionally.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel & Absolutely amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: sneaks23
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a hotel. The service of this hotel tops even some Ritz Carlton hotels that I have stayed in. I can list several examples (and I initially had a disagreement about the bill so I was prone to not be happy here) - where the employees went way above and beyond on service. As one example, after the disagreement on the bill (which frankly was probably my fault), they sent up orange juice, bottle of wine, and a teddy bear. Wow! As another example, I mistakenly left my brand new iPhone 4 at the bar. 45 minutes later, thinking the iPhone 4 was a goner and with some depression sinking in (who isn't attached to their phone??), the bartender, Edwin, not only found it but he graciously gave it to the front desk. These are just two examples; every single person I interacted with was cheerful and was helpful. In a day and age when it is hard to get good service, this hotel exceeded all expectations in this regard. In the terms of the hotel itself, it has all its bases covered: * Large comfortable rooms? Check * Working A/C? Check * Free WIFI? Check * Free (great) breakfast buffet? Check * Free afternoon snacks? Check * Low bar prices? Check * Great location that's central to Rome's sites? Check * Awesome service? Already mentioned - huge check Overall, one of the best hotels I've stayed in. Very highly recommended. PS: Italy is also an amazing country to visit - great people, great sites, great food. I look forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location & good value”
Reviews.Author: CanadaTravelgal2009
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and comfortable, very well priced, and within walking distance of Termini train station. We only wished we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bigdoll
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel in a very central location in central Rome. It is only 5 minutes walk from the central bus terminal and opposite a metro stop. It is also within close walking distance of many of the fantastic attractions Rome has to offer. The hotel itself is spotlessly clean. The rooms are spacious and beautifully furnished. Bed was so comfy! There was a flatscreen TV and CD player in our room and the bathroom was huge and equipped with complimentary hairdryer, toiletries, slippers etc. Breakfast was lovely as were the snacks on offer in the afternoon at the bar area (cheese & biscuits, nuts etc). Just around the corner are several bars where you can sample the excellent local Morretti beer! At the end of the street you can catch one of the sightseeing tour buses which leave every 20 minutes. 18 Euros for 2 days unlimited travel around the city. Great value for money! Rome itself is a beautiful city and the people are warm and friendly. Would definitely recommend staying at Hotel Canada if you choose Rome as your destination. It was faultless !

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good location a bit far from bus and train station”
Reviews.Author: rosannar
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a bit far from train and bus station, not a walking distance as they say in their webpage, if you dont mind walking a bit, then be prepared to walk like 15 minutes to get to the buses. beware of the taxi drivers, we took a taxi from the hotel to the termini train station and he charged us 15 euros, he did not used a meter, so if that is the case, agree on a rate before taking the cab, since that was a rip off because it was by car like 5 minutes. my Daughter got sick from water fountains, better to buy water at convenient stores also since water is so expensive there. they dont have refrigerators in barely no hotel in Europe so keep that in mind

Reviews.Title: “Good location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: RobTrujilo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is such a peacful place in Rome with an excellent staff. Everyone were very friendly and well english speaking. I stayed in a deluxe room and it's spacious, clean and really comfortable as home, the bath room is large too. Facilities are very good. Food of breakfast which is buffet style is delicous and has been included. Wifi found free. Highly recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem! Fabulous stay.”
Reviews.Author: TulsaTrotter
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers elegance at an affordable price. The entire place is outfitted with either antiques or very good copies - very tastefully decorated. Great staff in the breakfast room, at the front desk, and in the bar. Flawless Wifi. Two minutes from the Metro. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: AcrossthePondinAla
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to the train station & metro, lovely rooms, extremely professional and helpful staff, lavish breakfast, delicious cappuccino, free wi-fi, reasonable price. I'd go back to Rome just to stay at Hotel Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation. Good location. Welcoming staff.”
Reviews.Author: MrsF38
Reviews.Content: Excellent room size - the 3rd bed was in a separate ante-room and the bathroom was spacious. The location was good - walking distance from the rail station and from an underground station - however it was a good walk away from the historic sites. As well as restaurants and cafes being nearby, there were several small supermarkets within a few minutes walk. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doulamom
Reviews.Content: Four women in one room. Everything very clean, bathroom great. Four twin beds, A/C worked well, breakfast terrific. Staff was friendly, english speaking, and the bar snacks were yummy. About 4 blocks from Termini station, not on a hustling street. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we stayed in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: Sellabella
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the Hotel Canada. The rooms, as well as downstairs area was decorated beautifully, with some Italian flair. The whole hotel was immaculately clean, and we got a really good rate of EUR 112 for 3 of us. The staff were helpful and the breakfast was incredible, with tons of options, for hot and cold food. The hotel is also close to the main station, making it very convenient. I would highly recommend! This should be rated a 4 star hotel, rather than the 3 given to it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, reasonably convenient, very clean, good service”
Reviews.Author: Narasee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the start of our Italian trip. The hotel was very nice and clean, rooms spacious and distinct in their style and decoration, location is not too close to tourist locations but is close to Termini and there is a subway station right next door. The staff were fairly helpful. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel in a Wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: Team_Pearce
Reviews.Content: When booking this hotel we checked trip advisor and the many good reviews certainly helped us make the choice. The Canada was even better than we expected, the staff were great, the hotel clean, the rooms large and location superb. The couple of bad reviews I have seen must be mad, if you're going away and looking for problems then invariably you will find something and the things people have moaned about are just petty. When it comes to the whingeing about having to walk long distances from the hotel they must be plain lazy, the sites such as the Colosseum, Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain are about 10 - 15 minutes stroll away. We also walked to the Vatican which probably took an hour as we strolled and enjoyed the scenery on the way, with such history around every corner why would you want to rush to the more famous locations. I guess some people just want to go and tick the boxes of having 'done Rome'! Back to the hotel, we stayed there for three nights in late March and from the moment we arrived we loved it. They don't have a restaurant but there are plenty of little places nearby and at the bar they put out snacks, which they keep replenishing during the evening. The breakfast was superb, from eggs and bacon to large cakes, there was something for everyone. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. I have seen comments about them being otherwise, which makes me wonder how the people that found them that way treated them to begin with. My wife and I would certainly stay at the hotel again and we threw our coins into the fountain in order to ensure our return to the city one day.

Reviews.Title: “BW Hotel Canada - does not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: 4Piffs
Reviews.Content: We just arrived back from 4 days at the BW Hotel Canada in Rome. We booked this hotel based on the Trip Advisor reviews, location and amenities. The hotel is located within about a 5 - 10 minute walk of Termini Railway station. It is a lovely hotel with great service and friendly staff. The room was large enough to accommodate our family of 4 (2 adults, 2 teens, 15 and 17 years). Large for European standards with an updated bathroom with shower/tub. There is free high speed internet, just ask for your login at the front desk. Breakfast is wonderful with a large selection of fresh fruit, pasteries, toast, ceral, scrambled eggs, bacon, coffee and juice. They have a small and slow old fashioned elevator that does the trick and adds to the old world charm of the hotel. There is a laundromat just as you exit the hotel, turn right, then go left at the first street. They offer self use washers/dryers for 11 Euros per load, but for the same price you can drop off your laundry and they will do it for you :) Lots of restaurants, osteria, pizzeria's in the area. We felt very safe walking around the area. As a bonus, I cashed in my Air Miles reward points for BW Gift Cards and saved $600 CDN on the price. Just be sure to present your BW gift cards shortly after you check in. They will then deduct it from the total bill and show you the balance to be paid on check out. Vincenzo was very helpful and wonderful and printed out train schedules and passed along tips. Thank you for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for brief trip but location for nightlife not great”
Reviews.Author: tmteach
Reviews.Content: Arrived here on July 2 after a 15 hour trip. Bathtub was heavenly! Accomodations were very good. Elevator for two not so hot. Stairwell is uneven between second and first floor, could be dangerous for walkers. Breakfast was okay. Eggs were not to American standard. Room was comfortable, bed was great. Air conditioned!!!! Price was great! Roughly $300 for two nights and breakfast. Lobby bar was quaint. Service was great there. Termini was close by so it was convenient to train station. One block from metro made getting around town easy. Great place for our two day return trip to Rome. For those looking for nightlife, this would not be good for you. If you are pretty self-sufficient in Rome and are looking for comfort, a tub, and value- with breakfast- this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean quiet hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: fuzzywuzzyworm
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canada was a nice quiet place to stay in Rome. Continental Breakfast was quite good. Rooms quiet and clean. Staff was nice and helpful. Enjoyed a glass of wine in the lobby every evening. Very close to termini station.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: OystersHobartTas
Reviews.Content: My husband and l spent 5 nights over 2 seperate visits at this hotel and just loved it. It is close to the termini, about a 10 min walk. If coming from the station, once out the front of all the platforms and looking at the notice boards, take the exit on your left Once out, turn left and its the first street on your right and at the end of this street. We loved our rooms, the service, the friendliness by ALL staff. Breakfast was great, as were the breakfast staff in particular the blonde lady, she always had a smile. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. Close to termini, metro, republica, and only a 20-30min stroll to central Rome. Great restaurants around this whole area. Loved it, loved it, loved it.

Reviews.Title: “sagging beds and no blackouts on the curtains”
Reviews.Author: phdtravel
Reviews.Content: The service was very professional - front desk staff helpful and efficient a rarity in Rome hotels of this range. The location near the station means you have to take a taxi to most sights - beware not to get overcharged with fake meters etc. The room was clean quiet and soundproof. But the curtains were thin with no blackouts so it got very bright. The 4 poster bed sagged in the middle and mattress needs to be replaced. Bathroom fixtures were oldish and need to be replaced. Not that cheap for the non prime location. So a bit of good and bad mixed up here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Close the Train Station, and Everything Works!”
Reviews.Author: kleic
Reviews.Content: No doubt our view of this hotel was shaped in part by the fact that we had spent time in nice but slightly outdated and funky hotels in Venice and Florence, but we loved this place because it seemed really well run, everything worked well (including the air-conditioning!), and our quad room (two adults and two teenagers) was spacious, comfortable, and had every convenience we wanted including free Wi-Fi. It's five blocks from the train station, around the corner from a Metro stop (if you're riding the Metro, hold your bags really close and think twice before getting on a really crowded train), and down the street from a laundromat. The only thing worth noting is that it really isn't convenient to walking around historic sites ... hotels closer to the Coliseum or the Trevi Fountain might be better if you want to walk to everything ... but it was quiet, friendly, and just what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rabia3983
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 days and enjoyed our stay. Here are some pros: good location really close to the metro, very helpful staff, clean hotel and rooms, GREAT breakfast. We had informed them that we don’t drink alcohol so no need for the complimentary champion (we were on our honeymoon)...so instead they had a nice basket of water, juices and chocolate for us. Cons: My husband hated the fact that they didn’t have a printer for us to use. They have a computer in the lobby but to print you have e-mail the information to their staff, who then will print the material for you. Also, you can only print from 8-12. We had the standard room, and the room size was really small. Last issue I had was more with families staying. We visited the Coliseum in the morning and decided to return to our hotel to rest for few hours. There were these 4-5 kids running in the hallway, ring the door bells (of rooms) and being really loud. After 30 min of this craziness, I had to be the mean lady and call the front desk asking them to take care of it, which they did :). Even though i loved the hotel and everything, for next time i would want to stay even closer to the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel value in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: gator0178
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this hotel and appreciated it even more after staying at a different hotel on the second half of the trip. It was nicely decorated, staff was helpful, breakfast was amazing, it was convenient to the metro and termini, and you can't beat it for the price! Also internet was free! Bar and lobby area was nice and great for meeting people from all over the world!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: blakkkobera
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Canada for 4 nights.We were told that the hotel was 300 mtrs from the termini station, so we took the train (Leonardo Express) from Fiumicino airport to Termini, nd walked to the hotel--not a good idea--the two of us did save 20 Euro together as compared to taking a taxi, but we had to walk almost a kilometre with our heavy bags--300 to 400 mtrs at Fumicino, 300 mtrs from the train to exit Termini, and another 300 to the hotel.If you have heavy bags, it may be better to take a cab (45 Euro) and avoid the walk. The first thing we noticed was the huge size of the room and the bathroom compared to the other hotels we have stayed in in Europe. there were huge cupboards/storage spaces also, and the bathrooms were provided with lots of towels and bath accessories. The room had nice wallpaper, and a huge safe, but no mini-bar. The reception staff was helpful, and gave good guidance on how to visit various places, and provided maps of the city. The location is also a big plus because from Termini you can get to anywhere in town, and the bus ticket is only 1 Euro. Breakfast (included in the room tariff) was quite lavish, and the breakfast room staff were friendly and efficient. There were juices, cheese, breads, meats, fruits, cakes, eggs and cereals, and the menu was changed a bit every day to lend variety.Tea and coffee were served on the table.There was also a bar, library and shared internet in the lobby. Housekeeping was not only impeccable, but also intelligent-when my wife used the blanket from the cupboard one night, the housekeeping staff faithfully rolled it into her sheets every morning thereafter, saving her the effort of getting it out of the cupboard every night. On the irritants--the small lift had a mind of it's own,and often would not stop on your floor when you called for it--everyday we could see people getting fed up of waiting for it as it went up and down past their floor, finally walking up and down the (thankfully) wide stairs in defeat. The air conditioning was set to a specific temparature, so it was pretty uncomfortable for a while when one got back in the summer afternoon from a day in the sun.The tv was small, and too far away from the bed in such a big room. BBC/CNN were the only English channels. The free in-room wifi was hopless, and I was not the only guest who gave up on it completely after a while. Overall, however, a big thumbs up for the location, the size of the room, the cleanliness and super housekeeping, and the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - wish I had used this hotel on previous visits”
Reviews.Author: Silverton_Jack
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to Rome, and this was by far the best 3* hotel I have stayed in. Ideally placed in between the main Termini and a Metro station. however, we chose to walk to the Ancient city (30 mins), but the Metro/main termini was handy for sight-seeing further afield or if you need to get around faster due to limited time The staff were friendly and helpful. The room windows faced into the courtyard so we had zero noise from the street in the evening, night or morning. All-in-all excellent value for money and would definitely stay in the hotel again, and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in April/May 2010”
Reviews.Author: txorig
Reviews.Content: We've been back for awhile, but we are finally getting around to writing our reviews. We stayed here on two visits, one initially when we flew into Rome late April and on a return trip in May the night before we went home. The reviews are correct, this place is top notch. The hotel is located in a spot you can walk pretty much wherever you want, or take the metro only blocks away at the Termini. Also convenient is the Bancomat around the corner for getting your money. It is abit on the pricey side, but it was worth it for our initial and return trips when we were the most in need of comfort. The rooms are well appointed and on our first stay we had an inside room that was perfect. We traveled with two other couples and though we all had spacious, clean rooms with plenty of windows, two of the rooms faced the street and the noise made sleep difficult. They have double paned windows for noise, but it seems they do not use the air conditioning until summer so the rooms can get hot and stuffy with the windows closed. On the second stay, the hotel tried hard to get us inside rooms, but they were not available. They did place us in beautiful rooms facing a side street that was less noisy. This helped, but it's still worth requesting an inside room if you can – room 404 is awesome. If you’re tolerant of night noise or heat, no problem though. The beds were incredibly comfortable and the amenities were pretty decent (shampoo, toothbrush, lotion, etc.) They had a music player that was a nice feature, and, of course, a TV. The service was excellent and the staff was very helpful and accommodating. There is a computer in the lobby for quick email or google searches. Ask for a password at the desk, but don’t lose it! They would not give me another one when I misplaced mine. As others have mentioned, the breakfast was exceptional with fresh eggs (scrambled, quiches, and hard boiled), good quality cold cuts, fresh bread and fruit, cereal, etc. and you can order specialty coffees too! It definitely held us until dinner. There is also an afternoon happy hour with snacks -- not a meal -- but great with drinks. The drink prices were cheap during the happy hour, so we were very "happy" when we ventured out into the city at night. The hotel recommended a restaurant nearby that was just ok and a little pretentious (when we asked for tap water the waiter said they didn’t have it and brought us several bottles of water instead; we had no problem at other restaurants asking for and getting tap water). One of the couples in our party liked the restaurant quite abit so it may have just been our meal. You’d be best to use tripadvisor to find your dining. That’s what we mostly did. All of the ones we researched on tripadvisor were awesome. We did take a chance one night and found another restaurant nearby that was decent, Da Nazzarona . which provided a good last night dinner in Rome. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel of our European Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Wizard2010
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service from staff clearly eager to please. Massimo and Giovanni(?) were the standouts, but all were warm, friendly and extremely pleasant to talk to. We received a complimentary bottle of champagne (when they learnt it was our honeymoon) in our room which was a lovely gesture. The room was huge with a large comfy bed. It was serviced daily and kept immaculate. The bathroom was first rate of all the European hotels we stayed in and everything worked fine. The hotel is just up the road from the "Termini"- (Central Train station) where we arrived from Paris. Location is great, we were able to walk to the Trevi Fountain and other sites. Lots of cafes and trattorias in close proximity. Don't miss the breakfast either, plenty of variety, both hot and cold meals are provided. Excellent Quality! Well done Hotel Canada , for a hotel that is rated 3 stars you are up there with the 5 star establishments. We will definitely be returning for another stay!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, great staff”
Reviews.Author: LovestoTravel919
Reviews.Content: Very nice elegant hotel with very spacious rooms and large bathroom. The window opened onto a busy street but they had thick shutters that when closed, blocked out all the noise. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. A nice plus was delicious complimentary snacks in the afternoon at the lobby bar - with a very friendly bar tender. Location of the hotel is ok - we picked it for easy access to return rental car to train station and to catch train to airport. Close to subway but not real close walking distance to any major sites. Breakfast was very nice, however every morning, we somehow got skipped when it came to getting coffee or tea. They bring a pot to each table but when we were there, the servers seemed to be in hiding. We seemed to be the only ones who didn't get served coffee - I think we just happend to come at the wrong time both mornings we had breakfast there. The first morning we finally found someone and requested coffee but after we finished eating and waited several more minutes, we had to leave to catch a Vatican tour before it came. The next morning, again, we were finished eating before we saw someone to ask for coffee and just didn't bother - didn't know how long it would be and didn't want to wait. On the third morning we had to leave to catch our train to the airport before breakfast started. Overall, a good hotel, very elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel with quality service”
Reviews.Author: DerbyHerodotus
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully appointed hotel, which oozes style and class. We stayed one week in June 2010 and would have been delighted with our choice of hotel anyway. What moved it into Rolls Royce class was the attention and care we received when my wife had an accident making her immobile for the last 2 days of our holiday. Nothing was too much trouble in making her feel as comfortable as possible. Would I return? You bet I would!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, lovely hotel, close to station...a perfect way to end a month in Italy”
Reviews.Author: Mary-AnnHansen
Reviews.Content: I travelled on a budget and spent most of my month's trip in convents for about a third of the price of the Hotel Canada, but I wanted a restful night for my last night in Italy in preparation for my long flight home to Australia. What a wonderful choice I made! The hotel was lovely and the staff were wonderful. I wanted to eat a really traditional Roman meal for my last night and they sent me to a wonderful restaurant around the block and then took the trouble to discuss the menu and complimentary digestive with me. They organised a car to take me to the airport and that was a good choice also... rather than fight the mob at the train station I travelled in airconditioned comfort and had a wonderful tour of Rome along the way. Bravo Hotel Canada!! I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “A wise choice”
Reviews.Author: oneOCbob
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time in selecting this hotel for our three night stay in Rome. Positive reviews on tripadvisor were a big part of it. We arrived by train from Florence so a consideration was the logistics of getting to the hotel and back to the train station with a rollaboard suitcase each for our next journey to Sorrento. As stated in other reviews, Hotel Canada is a 10 minute walk from the train station (get the google map directions before going). I finally realized that most of the major sites are a short distance from one of the two metro lines (A, red, and B, blue). A metro station is just around the corner from Hotel Canada (check out the metro layout). The metro has lots of graffiti but don't let that worry you. It's safe with lots of people around. So one euro gets you to the front of the colleseum, or close to Trevi fountain, or Spanish steps, vatican city, circus maximus etc. This hotel is a ways from the central sites but no one hotel is going to get you close to all sites. Use the metro. The hotel rooms are nicely decorated and well maintained. Furnishings are updated, TV gets CNN and BBC, bath is large and accomodating. Breakfast is good with several fruit, meat, cheese, bread, yogurt, juices and coffee choices. Nice upscale breakfast room and staff to handle the morning rush. The best surprise was the hotel bar. Surprisingly you will get the best price in Rome for drinks and wine and in a comfortable living room type atmosphere. A great place to get a cool drink after a day of touring the city. The hotel has a computer for your use if you do not have a laptop (we did not). There are several restaurants close by with reasonable prices and good food. All in all a good hotel with good services a competive price for what you get and a central location that allows you to get to everything by using the available transportation and save some walking.

Reviews.Title: “Everything trip advisor says and more!!”
Reviews.Author: commissaire_10
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel - very reasonable for Rome. Absolutely spotless. Wonderful smiling staff always ready to help. Hotel bar unbelievably cheap with free nibbles after 4. Excellent location 10 minutes stroll from station in a quiet location. Best restaurant is just around the corner called Florians - lovely thin pizzas and fantastic home made pasta. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “First night in Rome erased memory of 15 hour plane trip”
Reviews.Author: italycinque
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th time to Italy and planned 3 nights in Rome train to Rapallo for 3 nights and finishing up in Milan with another 3 nights. Because we were independent travelers we wanted a place by the train stations in Rome and Rapallo, yet a place that we would feel comfortable in. Our plane from JFK was scheduled to leave at 5:30PM, didn't leave the gate till around 9PM and upon taxiing the pilot announced that a light was flashing -indicating that a malfunction in a door, we did not leave the airport till around midnight. Well, we felt that price of travelling now a days. But adding insult to injury, the flight was overbooked and our seats changed from row 25 to row 28 right next to the bathrooms, so for the next 81/2 hours, right when you were about to doze off, you were awaken by the banging of a door or by someone flushing. Upon arrival at FCO, we were both totally washed out and thought we'll just grab a cab, but a nice lady sitting in front of us told us crazy and recommended that we take the train- it would by allot faster and allot cheaper. She was right. After taking the Leonardo express from FCO we were happy that the Canada was only a 5 block walk from the Termini exit -Piazza Cinquecento. The Hotel is CLEAN and though not a central location, it's only a 10 to 15 Euro taxi ride to Piazza Navona or Fountain Trevi. After showering and getting a couple hours of sleep we were ready to see Rome. I asked theindividual at the front desk, shall we eat and walk around the area and he recommended that we take take a taxi to the Centro. We took a taxi to Piazza Navona, had diner, walked over to Campo di Fiori, than onto the Pantheon and ended our walk at the Trevi Fountain. We took a cab back to the Termini and walked the 5 blocks to Hotel Canada. The evening was everything you would hope an evening in Rome would be like. Even though we only had about 4 hours of sleep in the last 24 hours we both felt COMFORTABLE and that evening was worth the 15 hour plane trip. Hey, the airline got us there.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a better hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: chelsea341
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an all too brief stay in Rome and my 3rd visit to the Hotel Canada in 10 years, I was glad to reconfirm the rooms, breakfast, bar/lounge area with library, and service have maintained the same high standards over that time. We chose the standard size room this time as we were only staying for one evening, but it was a decent size with the beautiful frescoed ceilings and moldings prevalent throughout the hotel We especially enjoyed the full buffet breakfast and the bar with reasonably priced drinks and happy hour nibbles. Most of all, each member of the staff is accomodating and hospitable and knows how to make a guest feel at home. Even though it is part of the Best Western chain, it is family owned and it is apparent they take great pride in their property. We will return the next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sentellr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed a two night stay on the Fifth floor of the Hotel. The room was quiet, fairly spacious by European standards, the bath and shower were very nice and the amenities were very nice. The breakfast included in the room price was very good with items for American, European and Asian appetites. The hotel staff was helpful especially in talking to Alitalia to get our lost luggage delivered. The hotel is within walking distance to the Termini train station and is about 100 meters from the metro stop. The hotel is not in the trendy part of town but there are restaurants, trattorias and a small grocery store nearby. We found the hotel convenient, fairly priced, and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE, PLEASANT ROOMS, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: cherylcornelsen
Reviews.Content: This modest little hotel is delightful. Have stayed there twice and will again if/when I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “ECELLENT Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JMelander
Reviews.Content: Going to Europe and staying in hotels that you haven't been to can be scarey. This hotel was EXCELLENT! My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in Rome and found it PERFECT! The ROOM- TOTALLY above and beyond expectations for Europe. Normally Eurpean rooms are TINY- This one was HUGE! VERY spacious, Wonderful antique furniture. HUGE bathroom- Great desk area. REALLY REALLY REALLY impressed. The bed was SUPER comfy. The location- VERY close to the Metro station- EASY to get around. The breakfast- WIDE variety of foods. The service - from the front desk check in to the bar tender, to the maids and wait staff.... OVERALL excellent stay!!!!!! Everyone spoke mostly English. They suggested places to eat. They helped out with EVERYTHING we needed. EXCELLENT! Free Wi-Fi in the room was SO convenient! When we go back to Rome, we will DEFINITELY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RINSO84
Reviews.Content: Location – fantastic 5 min walk to train station and hop on hop off bus, we walked back via many places from the Vatican City.. Rooms – very nice, room bright Ambience- hotel was nicely decorated; entrance. Food – very good, breakfast. Food allergy – prior to leaving UK we contacted the hotel by email regarding the necessity for a wheat free diet for a celiac. Would we use again? Most certainly.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: ThreeLegsIsleofMan
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the strength of Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. Our superior room was well named and worth the extra cost. The beautiful room was kept spotlessly clean on a daily basis, there was abundant storage and the bathroom was kept well stocked with lovely toiletries. Breakfast was extremely comprehensive and set us up for a day of sightseeing. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. Although away from the main tourist sights, it was conveniently located to the main railway station, metro and buses. There were plenty of restaurants within easy walking distance. All in all, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElliottEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is worthy of 4 stars. The reception staff were very welcoming. The bar area was lovely and drinks very reasonable. 2 glasses of wine 6 euros. The bar also had snacks in the afternoon and evening. Hotel only a 5 minute walk from the Termini and Metro. The room was very big and clean and the breakfast was exceptional for Rome hotels. We would definitely go back and would highly recommend this hotel. We used the open top bus for first two days then did everything on foot from the hotel. Took us 40 minutes to walk to the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hotelcritique
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to add some photos and decided to write a bit about the hotel. We stayed in this hotel for two nights, post cruise. We thought the hotel was very nice and featured everything we needed. No need to detail it's location, etc. because this has been done in previous reviews, but these 40-50 year olds found it within walking distance of restaurants, the Termi and many attractions. My 80 year old parents were not able to walk to the attractions, and had to take a cab. We plan another trip to Rome next May, and after checking hotels closer to the attractions, I cannot find a hotel that is anywhere as nice of a hotel - for the same price - as the best Western Canada!

Reviews.Title: “Excellenet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nick T
Reviews.Content: Due to the volcano, we unexpectedly had to make our way to rome to try to get a flight out. Were stuck there for 2 days and managed to find this hotel on line while we were still in Genoa. The staff were welcoming and helpful. We had to stay a third day without notice and again they accomodated us and even reduced the price when my wife took off and there was only 3 of us in the room. Lots of space for the 4 of us in the family size room. Handy to several restauraunts and the train staion. Clean, quaint and generally well run. I would have no problem staying here again with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: Dakotah1
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our stay at the Best Western Canada Hotel in Rome. The hotel in conveniently located about six blocks from the main train terminal and a block from the metro stop. We stayed in the larger double room which was spacious and well kept. The bed was very comfortable. The staff was helpful in arranging a shared minivan to the cruise port with another couple who was staying at the hotel. the free internet was very nice and the inexpensive bar and afternoon snacks were a special treat. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable, reasonable 3-4 star hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amidelamer
Reviews.Content: My friends stayed on the Via Veneto for twice the price and didn't believe me when I described my room and the hotel services and amenities. My room was larger than theirs, the breakfast was bigger and offered a far greater variety, the staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful (I speak no Italian...they all spoke very good English) and the location...while quite busy...was safe, convenient to Termini (the train station), and just perfect for my needs. While I listed this trip as leisure, there was a bit of business at the end and there was one night into the business portion that my wife stayed with me. Since the rate was a bit higher for her than for me alone, I was no sure how to handle the reimbursable portion of the receipt. I mentioned this to Giovanni at the counter during my stay and he came up with a great idea that resulted in two receipts that divided personal and business charges perfectly between them. He took quite a bit of his time to do this but it made filing my reimbursement claim much easier. The only issue that could have been a problem was that there are a lot of college students in that part of Rome and they seem to like to stay out very late sitting at the sidewalk restaurants and being pretty loud (like college students everywhere). My room was right over one of the restaurants and I was, the first evening, wondering if I was going to be able to sleep. Then I closed the windows and...no noise! I don't know how the windows are constructed but they blocked out noise almost entirely. There were several excellent and (for a major city) reasonable restaurants (Leoni d'Abruzzo was our favorite), either on the same block or a block or two away, a great little grocery, and some other shops all within a minute or two walk. I could go on with what I liked about this place but it would take a magazine article to cover it all. Bottom line...if you don't feel you have to be in the ritiziest part of the city and just want a great hotel in a location next door to a Metro stop, a quick walk to the train station, and a 30 minute walk to the Colosseum and other historical stuff...this place is it.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: JustbeCoz
Reviews.Content: Travelling with two families each with children makes it difficult in Europe sometimes in finding rooms that accomodate. The room our families (both) stayed in had an ante-chamber which served as a quaint second bedroom for the children; a well appointed master bedroom and a large bathroom. Though we had gone to Europe several times, we were warned that it would be difficult to find family oriented rooms. The breakfast buffet was hot and had plenty of variety -- well beyond expectations. The small hotels on the street host several restauraunts, however, they cater to the tourist and are less authentic. Ask for recommendations for local fare that will be better suited for someone who wants to have more original and quality fare. The train station is a ten minute walk and the in the heat of August, this is about as far as you want to go. It certainly makes seeing the whole city easier. The hotel is clean, very quaint -- not large and has the caged, small elevator you expect to find in an older building. Definitely a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: JeremyAustralia
Reviews.Content: We booked in to Hotel Canada for 1 night between arriving in Rome by air and travelling to Positano by train the following morning. The hotel that we had booked in Rome for our later stay was not available and due to recommendations from our travel agent and Trip Advisor, we booked a Superior Queen Bed room at Hotel Canada. The room that we had was lovely. It was spacious with a large canopied bed, an ornate writing desk and a small sofa. The room also had a CD player/stereo on the wall with speakers in both the main room and the bathroom. The bathroom was large and clean and the amenities were one of our favourites from our whole trip. The hotel is near the Termini train station, which makes it convenient for the station, but is otherwise a bit far from the main attractions. All in all though, we were very happy with this hotel and my wife insists that we stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: RobertJP
Reviews.Content: All the staff were very helpful and friendly particularly on reception. They have free internet access in reception which is handy. You do however have to email anything you want printed to the hotel from the terminal as there is no direct printing. This was not a problem. The room was perfect. We had a top floor room which helped as we looked onto a main road. However when the windows are closed it makes a big diffirence. If you like it quiet you can request a courtyard room. Breakfast was fine and there was a very large selection. We booked our tickets for the Vatican online which saved us about an hour of queueing. We also bought our combined ticket at the Palatine (smaller queues) before going to the Colloseum. We visited all the top tourist spots so its just a case of seeing what suits you. Eat at Bierra Peroni as it is a very typically Rome experience. It gets very busy. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Termini (the main rail station) which is handy for getting around and for airport access. I would fully recommend this hotel unless youu wanted to stay closer to the historic sights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Amazing staff and great value”
Reviews.Author: SuzieMaree
Reviews.Content: This is the 14th time I have stayed at this hotel for work and I will continue to return as the staff are truly amazing. I feel so much at home here and everyone from the reception to the staff serving breakfast - housekeeping are so kind, friendly and extremely helpful. This hotel is the best value. Complimentary wifi in the rooms (works well), easy access to metro, bus and central station. FANTASTIC breakfast in the morning with hot and cold foods, fresh orange juice and a full selection of fruits, pastries etc. I know the reason I continue to come back to this hotel is the staff - they are the best! Thank you Hotel Canada for another wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: Cairnsholidayers
Reviews.Content: On the advice of trip advisor we stayed in the Best Western Hotel Canada on our arrival in Rome. We were not disappointed! On arrival at 7 am after a long flight from Australia the reception organised free cappucinos and hot chocolate croissants for us. We enjoyed the hotel so much that we stayed in the hotel 5 weeks later prior to our departure from Rome. The hotel suited us as our family of four was able to be accommodated in one room, we were close to the train station and the metro. Probably the only drawback is that it is a little far from the old town to walk and you need to catch the metro or a bus which certainly didn't bother us. The hotel was beautiful, old and quaint with wonderful staff and we would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, beautiful hote, good location”
Reviews.Author: MrsRachaelB
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip as a surprise birthday present for my husband. I chose the hotel due to the location to the Termini and the metro. For 11 Euros from the airport you can get a direct train to the Termini, from the Termini it's a 5 minute walk to the hotel. Then you have the metro around the corner from the hotel which is either 1 Euro for one journey or you can pay 4 Euros for a day pass. The hotel itself is beautiful, very comfortable rooms which are maintained to a high standard. They have CD player in the room wtih an iPod connection so you can pipe your music into the bathroom and free wi-fi. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the breakfast was generous with a wide selection. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing honeymoon in Rome in a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: simbratoo
Reviews.Content: We had read lots of reviews for lots of different hotels in Rome and selected this one as it looked to have what we were looking for and was located close to Termini. We were not disappointed! The greeting on arrival was very friendly and we were shown to our room which was perfect. As wifi was an advertised feature of this hotel we contacted reception and they provided us with the information we required. We also requested tea and coffee making facilities which is not standard in the rooms but is available on request at no extra cost. When we experienced the buffet style breakfast on our first morning it was simply outstanding. The choice was very wide and varied and everything (between us we tried most things!!) was delicious. Each morning there was something different, one morning we have large quantities of smoked salmon to accompany our scrambled eggs!! This is definitely a hit for us and we will most definitely be going back to this hotel (hopefully next year for our anniversary) when we visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for a perfect trip”
Reviews.Author: Wolf72
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day break with friends to take in the 6 Nations Rugby. Having always relied on Tripadvisor ratings on my previous travels I felt confident to rely on the reviews that put this hotel amongst the top 20 of almost 1500 in Rome. We were not disappointed as the hotel far exceeded our expectations. To begin the taxi for 4 plus luggage came to 53 Euros from Fumicino, this exceeded the standard 40 euro charge as the driver explained that the hotel sat a short distance outside of the boundary. The hotel staff confirmed that 53 Euros was about right. If you prefer to take the train then there is a direct link from the airport to Termini station which is a couple of hundred yards up the road. The hotel is an ideal base for a sightseeing trip. Termini offers you buses, trams, taxis, open top bus tours and the metro which give you a wide choice of options dependent on your destination. For the Coliseum, Vatican, Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain we found the metro to be the best bet at 1 euro for a one way trip. Most taxis from the main sights cost us about 10-15 euro when we were feeling lazy! The hotel itself is a very high standard 3 star. It has clearly been recently refurbed and was exceptionally clean and beautifully decorated. The antiquated lift struggles with any more than 3 people and when you are on the fifth floor and there are 70 rooms it did mean that there was either a long wait to get all 4 of us up to the room or more strain on the already over worked legs! The bedrooms were very comfortable with an LCD TV and wall mounted CD player. The player is compatible with MP3 but not iPod or iPhone. The toiletries that are provided were extensive and of a very good quality. We did find the hotel a little noisy in the morning but that was mainly due to inconsiderate guests than anything the hotel could be blamed for. We didn't get any traffic noise or such like as the hotel sits amongst a group of others in a relatively quiet side street. Take a look at the reviews for the Best Western Villafranca which is directly opposite if you want to see a stark difference in what the same hotel chain can achieve!!! The staff were wonderfully friendly and extremely helpful; the hotel did have an intimate B&B type atmosphere. I would wholly recommend that you make full use of the bar facility at the hotel it was only 2 euro for a bottle of Peroni, 4.50 euro for a spirit and mixer and 6 euro for a bottle of wine. Elsewhere in the city you will pay at least double if not triple for the same, so a few drinks before you hit the town makes great economical sense. A table of complimentary bar snacks is also most welcome to help while away the hours it took for the other half to get ready!!! We ate lunch a few times around the hotel area whilst we were there, there is a wide choice of restaurants and the food was always good value and of a very satisfactory standard. If you are looking for a pleasant, intimate hotel with helpful and friendly staff that is ideally located a short distance from the hustle and bustle of Rome yet with excellent transport links then the Hotel Canada is a perfect choice for you. Granted the sights aren't right on your doorstep but we found it nice to retire away from all of that at the end of a busy day.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, staff, breakfast, location”
Reviews.Author: beachsideguy99
Reviews.Content: Dont be put off by the name...this is an ITALIAN hotel. Cozy and intimate. Wonderful friendly staff, sensational full buffet breakfast, HUGE rooms for a city hotel, nice little bar with free finger food and budget drink prices. The staff were incredibly helpful, booking taxis, providing in-room tea and coffee jug, etc Easy 10 mins walk to Termini rail station, plenty of budget eateries nearby. Check for best rates and bargain for longer stays.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: PetenJulie
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night/ 5 day break in Rome stopping at the Best Western Hotel Canada, and eager to write a review. Firstly thanks for all previous tripadvisor reviewers for the recomendation, once again a little research has paid dividends. Location- Best Western Hotel Canada (BWHC) is located on a side street in a less fashionable area of the city but is near to the metro, mainline train and bus station and an ideal venue to tour the sights of rome. Nearby there are a number of bars and restaurants we tried a couple of them out and all served good local food. From the road the BWHC is not imposing but the reception area which doubles as the bar is clean and stylish which probably sums the place up to a tee. We used the location to good effect using a combination of taxis, bus, tube and walking to get about.
