From the airport (Rome international) a taxi for four with luggage cost us 53 Euros, nearby there is a red bus which enables 48 hours travel through the day to major tourist destinations and you can hop on and off (18 euro). Local tubes and busses work out at about 1 euro per adult per journey for 75 mins worth of travel. All ways were effective although walking most enjoyable. The rooms- our party had two double rooms on the fifth floor, access to which is via a quaint lift. The lift holds three people so the two ladies used it for our stay and consigned the guys to the stairs! The rooms themselves again was stylish, ours had a large bathroom with bidet, whilst our friends had a shower instead of the bath. The bedroom was large and stylish, the bed big and comfortable with a tv and radio/cd player. We didn't have a view as our room was at the back of the hotel and there were no luxuries like mini bars etc although tea/coffee & ironing facilities are available on request. In essence our room was clean stylish and functional but not luxurious, we weren't dissapointed. All the staff but particularly the reception staff were very helpful, friendly and spoke good English all had a smile and were eager to accomodate. Food wise- the breakfast was pretty good with a variety of food available. It was always tasty and the staff pleasant and accomodating. Bigger hotels may have more on offer but the BWHC has the friendly intimate service that larger places could not compete with. The bar was cheap with a beer at 2 euros and a bottle of wine at 6 euros, many other places were 3 times as expensive. In the reception area there is also free internet access. On the whole we enjoyed an amazing trip to Rome, which is an incredible city an beyond the hype.This was in part thanks to the Best Western Hotel Canada and it's staff. Thankyou. So would I return and/or recommend it to friends, definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, Great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: thecooks2000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location from which to explore Rome. The train station is a short walk. The metro is one block away. The breakfast is the best of any hotel I have seen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: HopAlot9
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights in early January 2010, and paid 120 Euro per night. Overall, this is a nice hotel close to the train station with a friendly staff. There are many other hotels on the same street. Free internet, very fast connection.

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying here - would have loved to stay longer, made our trip all the more enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: AngeNShane
Reviews.Content: Very spacious & clean room, staff were great, very friendly & helpful. Loved the buffet breakfast - always well stocked & very fresh. We really enjoyed our 8 nights at the Hotel Canada in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: CanuckHorn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a room for four. One queen bed and two twins. The room was gorgeous and spacious. The lobby was great. The staff was very helpful. Good family friendly restaurant next door. Not a lot of sites are within walking distance of the hotel, but the metro stop is a one or two minute walk. The main train station is about a ten minute walk away. The breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice on many levels”
Reviews.Author: dbkaput
Reviews.Content: We had a quad room which comfortably accommodated our family with two older children. The staff was more than gracious, especially Massimo and Edwino who provided the personal touches that made this boutique-like hotel special. Lovely bar and living room style lobby with best priced drinks in town. The extensive included breakfast was exceptional as well. Well located near a metro stop and Termini station. Bellisimo!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Canada”
Reviews.Author: oztravellers1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed previously at this hotel and returned again for 4 nights. The Canada is a lovely hotel, the rooms are spacious, clean and if you ask for a quiet room ( one facing the courtyard) you are assured of a good night's sleep. The location is very handy to both the Rome Termini and the metro. Most of the hotel staff were still there since our last trip in 2003 and were still friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: alzo
Reviews.Content: stayed one night pre cruise ,located 5 min walk from the main train station ,great for our needs ,small hotel restored to a very nice standard all the rooms are small in size but have fresco style prints on the celing .the bar is very relaxing and by rome standards very ,very cheap food was very good in the morning all you could eat ,when in rome i will without a doubt stay again alan

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise Rome stay.”
Reviews.Author: zocko
Reviews.Content: Nice size room and bath, small elevator. Breakfast buffet very extensive, good service. Front desk helpful and friendly. Free lobby internet. Cocktails about 4 pm with snacks in lobby. Met with our friends in the lobby twice, plenty of room. Walked to Termini to catch a bus, convient. No dinning room, found a restaurant around the corner. We only stayed one night precruise, took a car to port about 1 pm took about an hour to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Maurice11
Reviews.Content: We just completed a 4 day stay in Rome at the BW Hotel Canada and wanted to add our support to the already positive reviews. We were greeted with a big smile and shown to a very clean, sizeable room with a very nice bathroom. The breakfast buffet took place in a beautiful room, and the food was very good. There was an adequate variety of cereal, fruit, eggs, sides, etc. We also enjoyed the snacks in the Bar each evening. The staff graciously helped us with touring ideas and choices for good local restaurants. As many have noted, it is about a 5 block walk to the train station which makes it ideal for those using public transportation. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Terrible Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: StanAmana
Reviews.Content: I read with great interest the great reviews that people have given this Hotel for service and then wonder if the staff have been turned over. I was so paranoid I’d had got it wrong that I checked with my wife. Thank God she confirmed my views, that they were shocking. I do agree though that most of the staff bar the front desk staff (Giancarlo specifically) were great. As for Giancarlo, in all the 7 Hotels that we stayed at on our European trip he was the most unhelpful we met. Every time you asked him a question it was if you were disturbing him, to be honest the only thing we ever disturbed him from doing was reading the paper. Anyway enough about these guys, we stayed 5 nights and the Hotel itself was great, clean, good sized rooms, great décor, big bathrooms, handy location(5 min walk to Termini Station and local bus terminus). Great breakfast with lots of variety. Great Pizza place, next block down on the corner that serves pizza by weight(cheap) and has many and varied pizza’s. Rome is ideal to walk around; we even did it in 35 degree celsius heat every day. However if it gets tiresome and you need some relief the buses are great and will always bring you back to the hotel, as a I said great location to base yourself. We never once used the Metro as the buses were so good. There are so many sites in Rome to visit and most of the “pay to get in” sites have long queues, the trick for all of them is to get there early. Everyone carries on about the long line at St Paul’s, well I can tell you we were there just after 9am and we walked straight in, and when we came out the line was hundreds of metres long, but that was at 10:30. Even the Vatican museum, where we were duped and paid the premium entry fee so we could avoid the long queue, when we rolled up with our express entry group there was no one waiting, we could have just bought our entry ticket and walked in. They dupe you because you can’t see the entrance from the St. Peters square and everyone leads you to believe that the lines will be long, just like St Peters Basilica, but they are NOT!! Even when we came out of the Vatican Museum there were no lines. The Vatican museum you can take it or leave it but this is the only way you are going to see the Sistine Chapel, oh yeah while you are in there DON’T listen to the recorded messages telling you not to take photos and video, everyone is doing it. The security treat catching people doing it as a game with no ramifications. I had a security guy put a laser on me while I was filming and when I reliased what was happening and looked at him he was laughing. Take that photo, cause it is priceless. Also went to the Coloseum and we arrived just before lunch (didn’t get there early for this one) as we visited a number of sites before getting to the Coloseum, and the queue was horrendous, ended up paying for a guided tour which allowed us to jump the queue. There are many English speaking people selling the guided tours outside, they are fairly cheap, just $8euro extra, well worth it. This also included a guided tour of the Roman Forum. At the Roman Forum the guide then tries to sell you all the other tours that they do, specifically the catacombs. Don’t take them they are a rip off. We did the San Callisto Catacombs ourselves, we went there by local bus, caught the bus from the bus terminus near the hotel, drops you off right at the catacombs and when you go in and pay the entry it includes a guided tour of the catacombs. After the tour you can then walk around the grounds yourself. Google the San Callisto catacombs for details of what is there. From a family cost perspective it saved us over $200Euro, quite significant. For the Aussies, the priest who does the English speaking tours is from Melbourne, father Owen from Boxhill. Please note we were in Rome at peak season so all this advice is at the busiest time of the year for tourists. It is worthwhile noting that Rome is also very safe; we travelled around at night by foot and never felt concerned about our safety. They are your usual unsavory type in the city but were never harassed. Some Tips: Beware the piazza’s, everything is quadruple the price to seat outside and watch the world go past. Look for the out of the way places and you will find a bargain and even a character or two. We walked out of a café at the Piazza Navona after I realised they were charging, $5.50 for a short black coffee, $7 for a coke and $6 for a small bottle of water…yes Euro. We found a nice small café/ice creamery and sat outside (had the best ice cream in Italy) . Don’t waste your money on the hop off hop on bus in Rome; everything in the city is within easy walking distance. Hop on Hop off is worth it for Paris (big city) definitely not for Rome. If you get a taxi from or to the airport from Rome itself they can NOT charge you anymore than $40Euro and that applies to even Taxi’s that you book from your Hotel. If you get into an argument tell the driver you want to call the Tourist Police, this will end the argument. The great front desk staff wanted to charge us $55Euro for this privilege, not a bad $15Euro tip for doing nothing; we booked our own and paid the $40Euro. Do NOT bring TRAVELLERS Cheques to Rome, no one will honour them and to cash them they want 12% commission….rip off. Best way is to use credit card or do ATM withdrawals. You can drink the water from the many fountains; the fountain at the bottom of the Spanish steps has the coldest and most refreshing water. Beware the pickpockets on the crowded buses.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: NY_Traveler00
Reviews.Content: My parents and I just came back from a wonderful stay at the Hotel Canada, four nights in all, pre- and post-cruise. The lobby and rooms were beautifully decorated and very comfortable & clean. Large bathroom with nice tub/shower, towels and toiletries (bath gel, shampoo, etc - even bath slippers - all produced by the Pucci family, who own the hotel). The breakfast was just as described in other reviews - it was delicious and there was something for everyone. The little bar area was a real treat, with a sumptuous array of meats, cheeses, nuts, olives and other snacks set out each evening. Buying a bottle of wine and spending time there was the perfect way to end each of our evenings in Rome. The true highlight of the Hotel Canada, though, was its staff. They couldn't have been kinder or more accommodating. Special mention must be made of Massimo, who oversees the bar area on many evenings. His winning smile and delightful personality made our stay very special - not to mention his gift for making beautiful hors d'oeuvres! The location of the Hotel Canada is excellent - within walking distance of Termini station (coming from the trains, exit the building on the right side and you're on Via Marsala & Via Marghera; walk one block up to Via Vicenza and then it's just about 5 blocks to the hotel). The Castro Pretorio metro stop is right around the corner from the hotel, so it's easy to get around. But we liked walking around Rome - there's something beautiful and interesting at every turn! We tried two restaurants very nearby the hotel: Florians was good for pizza & wine by the carafe, but we were unimpressed with I Leoni d'Abruzzo.

Reviews.Title: “This was an amazing home base for our stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: TBush103
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Hotel in Rome was one of the best hotels we stayed in over our extended stay in Italy. Though the rooms were small in comparison to the US, they were beautifully decorated, had modern conveniences, and were spotlessly clean. Breakfast was plentiful and the staff was very hospitable. If I get the chance to return to Rome, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Canada is a great little boutique hotel that delivers”
Reviews.Author: FrequentcruiserPa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Canada, Rome in lOctober 20-23 for three days prior to boarding a Cruise to Ancient Empires. We picked this hotel based on the wonderful reviews on Trip Advisor. This hotel will not disappoint. It delivers. Spacious rooms, friendly, helpful staff and superb buffet breakfast. It's location is a stiff, but direct 10 minute walk to the crazy, busy Termini station. Our room, a junior suite , room 214, would have been better suited to a couple with a small child, as it had a day bed in the small anti-room which flowed into the main bedroom, containing a queen sized bed, armoir, HD TV, but no chest of drawers, no night tables to speak of. We did have a balcony, which overlooked a courtyard, which ended up being a waste as it poured the whole time we were there. Nicely appointed bathroon, with tub. Upscale toiletries. The bird cage mini elevator was an interesting experience. It worked well and got us to the lobby and room. Technically, the hotel does not have a restaurant but does serve a wonderful, very full breakfast buffet which is an absolute highlight. A beautiful Senora, Dragica, from Slovenia, and her staff put out an amazing spread each day that contained dozens and dozens of items including prosciutto, soppresata salami, nice selection of cheeses, wonderful eggs, bacon, ham, terrific quiches, many varieties of fruit , large selection of breads and pastries including a fabulous Napolean Loaf and other selected pies and cakes. The italians must love their desserts/pastries in the morning! Great Cappucino, Cafe Latte. We have never seen a breakfast spread this diverse, and so good, not even at the major US hotels.Note; our friends could not get a reservation at this hotel, and ended up staying at another BW property, Hotel Art Deco. On the last morning in Rome we went to pick them up with our limo and I went inside to get them. While waiting I walked into this hotel's breakfast room and was surprised at how minimal and bland the breakfast buffet looked. HotelCanada also puts out a mini spread of snacks at the bar from 5 pm to 10 pm, which varies each evening which included parmesan cheese chunks, salami chunks, several types of nuts including pistachios as well as chips, little cakes, etc. . Adjacent to the bar is a computer, free of use for guests who are provided with a password for their stay. Note:For this they require a copy of your passport. During our three days we used Viator's Green Line HopON and HopOff buses which were horrible . The buses were generally dirty, had numerous broken tape machines so that you had to really hunt for a seat that would give you a working tap ( tour guide info). On one of the buses, the driver actually hit a parked car and laughed about it to the ticket taker and drove away. On other buses, the ticket person couldn't be bothered to announce the various stops. Avoid this bus line which is located across from the Termini, not in the Termini station area. Generally the taped tour is very minimal and we found that we often passed by what looked like major monuments, with no commentary from the tape. Also avoid the restaurant Da Vicenzo on Via Castelfidardo. One of our friends made the mistake to ask for some antipasto for our group of six and out came 10 plates of cold fish appetizers, which were not good. We got charged 70 Euros ( well over $110 US) just for these appetizers, and the entrees which also ended up being expensive were very mediocre. Avoid this restaurant. If you want to go on a Vatican Tour (Sisteen Chapel) prebook online before you go as it is only 14 Euros ( instead of 34 Euros if you wait to buy the tix on-site. Your prepurchased tickets allow you to bypass the enormous long line of people waiting to buy tickets. While you walk past this line, you go in a door just to the right of where everyone else goes in. Beware that the tSisteen Chapel tour is actually 55 different rooms filled with art/statues and takes a good one and one-half hours before you actually see the Sisteen Chapel. Altogether figure on a good three hours at least to see the chapel and St. Peter's church

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: LucyWales_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at easter time on a short braek to Rome and absolutely loved it. The hotel itself is clean, friendly and has everything you need for a short break. There are not that many restaurants very close to the hotel, however it is such a short walk to the train and bus station that everything you need is very close by. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, efficient staff,well maintained and at a good price.”
Reviews.Author: HampshireSue85
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an easy 10 minute walk to Terminii for arrivals and departures in Rome, but the Castro Pretorio Metro station is just around the corner from the hotel and is very convenient - much easier than finding your way through the bustling crowds at Terminii Metro. The hotel is quiet and well maintained - efficiently run. Rooms are quite large and traditionally furnished and our bed was one of the most comfortable we have ever slept in. The shower was superb - masses of hot water - lovely. Breakfast was super - as much as you can eat and a great variety of cold food as well as scrambled eggs and bacon. Coffee and tea freely available - cappucino on request. People quite frequently needed to queue for a table but didn't notice anyone queueing for longer than 5 minutes. Tried some of the local restaurants in the same street but they were, at best, mediocre. 'Seasonal fruit' dessert at one consisted of a pear and a knife on a plate - 3 Euros - you have to laugh - and then make sure you don't return! We would wholeheartedly recommend the restaurant 'Il Cuore di Napoli' on Via Cernia 31, a ten - fifteen minute walk north-west of the hotel and recommended in the Eyewitness Travel Guides. Tourists were vastly outnumbered by Italians, which has to be a good sign, although menus were available in English and some staff were English speaking. We ate here twice - once choosing from the menu and the second time from their Halloween special menu. Steak and seafood were out of this world but there were a wide selection of pizzas available for the less adventurous. We walked a lot during our six day stay in Rome and got around using the Metro with no problem. We wanted to visit the gardens at Tivoli and managed that by using the Metro from Castro Pretoria to Ponte Mammolo then catching a local bus to Tivoli. The guide books recommended a visit to Ostia Antica which we managed by catching the Metro to Piramide then a local train to Ostia Antica railway station. This is an amazing place - not as dramatic as Pompeii but just as extensive. Language isn't a problem as most Italians speak at least a smattering of English, but it doesn't take a lot of effort to learn just a few words of Italian - at least enough to ask for a railway ticket and order a cup of coffees. The Metro tickets are 1 Euro flat rate to anywhere on the system. Take as much care with your wallets, purses, bags etc on the Rome Metro as you would on any tube / Metro system. The bus and local train fares were two Euros each way so there is no need to waste money on taxi fares in order to do your sightseeing and we found the bus drivers and fellow passengers helpful when help was needed. Only returned yesterday evening so full of enthusiasm - as you may be able to tell! We can thoroughly recommend the Hotel Canada and a comfortable pair of walking shoes. you'll have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: GourmetTraveller0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. Lovely rooms, excellent staff, very nice bar with very reasonable drinks - half the price of elsewhere. Superb breakfast table and very pleasant breakfast room. What a shame they don't serve evening meals. Location may be convenient for those wanting easy public transport links but apart from that we didn't find the neighbourhood to our liking - rather scruffy and lacking any special restaurants - those nearby were either too cramped or served what I can only describe as mediocre food - a shame as we were looking for something a bit more elegant - to match the hotel - and had to take a cab ride or long walk to fine something which suited. To sum up - if we could have moved the hotel to a better neighbourhood - perfect!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel provided a very nice place for us to stay while in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: LyndaTexas
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Canada is conveniently located near the train station and also is convenient to the tour bus area where you can ride the "hop on hop off" sightseeing bus. It is also close to many restaurants. The happy hour in the late afternoon at the hotel bar was nice with snacks provided and reasonably priced drinks. The staff was professional and the rooms were clean with lots of toiletries. The best thing about this place is the breakfast. It was absolutely spectacular with lots of choices such as: scrambled eggs, bacon, ham, fruit, cereal, many breads and lots of pastries. We appreciatd this breakfat because we had been in Italy for about two weeks and this was the first time we had experienced any American food!

Reviews.Title: “We really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Likeness
Reviews.Content: We are very picky travelers and I have to say that the positive reviews here are right on the mark. Our family stayed here for four nights before boarding a cruise ship and we really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is clean, the rooms are a decent size as are the bathrooms. It has a lovely European feel and the people that work there are fantastic. They have snacks in the afternoon and the morning breakfast....you will not be able to find anything better. I loved the eggs and all the fresh pastries. There are little pizza places nearby that are quite good. We took taxi's to most everywhere we wanted to go. It is pretty close to most everything in central Rome. We tried riding the bus, but didn't really like it. One thing I will mention, there is a super market one block over. It is convenient for anything that you might need. We didn't find it until the last day. Don't eat at Mama Angela's. We ate there and the food was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Canada is a Gem and the staff are Diamonds”
Reviews.Author: essexgirl236
Reviews.Content: We booked our recent trip to Rome after studying trip advisor and were more than pleased with our very well appointed standard twin room on a corner of the building overlooking a main road along which was Casa Pretoria Metro station - very handy - also the two large double glazed windows kept out any noise . The room was very well decorated and furnished in traditional Italian style with a wonderful tiled floor - kind on the feet after a days sightseeing. Nice bathroom with lots of toileteries and slippers - also room and bathroom were very clean. Breakfast room was very pleasant even though a little busy - the staff were amazing and the choiceof food was very good . The bar and lounge were excellant and the prices very reasonable - the free bar nibbles were excellant also the bar staff were very friendly and efficient and it was a lovely place to relax after sightseeing. The local Pizza restaurants we found to be reasonably priced and nice especially one called Florians . The Canada is very near to the Terminii station and from there you can get an open topped bus with a 24hr. hop on and off ticket for 24hours or 3 days and for the older travellers like us found this an ideal way to see the sights and the buses are very frequent. Also the Metro is only 1 euro for any journey and that aslo is very good and we found the taxis very resonable for a capital city. The Hotel Canda made our stay in Rome perfect

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: LeaLeaChi
Reviews.Content: Rooms a decent size and clean. Good choice for breakfast. Nice seating area with bar and nibbles

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with Hotel Canada, would not hesitate to book again.”
Reviews.Author: ago63
Reviews.Content: We booked because of the positive reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disapponted. The hotel is very attractive, and, from our standpoint, quite conveniently located provided you are okay with public transportation. The immediate neighborhood is close to Termini, but not sketchy. The Castro Pretorio metro stop is conveniently located right around the corner. Our room was quite spacious and well-appointed. The cool tile floors felt good after long days of pounding the pavement; we enjoyed the frescoed ceilings, too. The internet connection was fast and FREE. The breakfast was excellent, served in a lovely bright room. Restaurants in the immediate area are unremarkable, but we enjoyed a nice meal at the Trimani Il Wine Bar a few blocks to the north, an easy walk from Hotel Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Room and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: TomOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canada provided a very pleasant home base in Rome. The room was charming with a frescoed ceiling and large bath. Breakfasts were very substantial . Staff was very friendly and helpful. I had left my cell phone charger in the room and it was held for me to pick up three weeks later. Location convenient to the Termini station and Metro. Manageable walk to the ancient centre and tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Rome - not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: LilyfromSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after reading all the reviews on trip advisor and I must say I was a little disappointed. The room was ok, though the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. This hotel was situated close to the station, which was handy when travelling from the station, however was a bit far from everything else. I had to get a taxi going to and from everywhere i wanted to go unless I wanted to waste time figuring out bus routes etc. The room was reasonably sized and reasonably clean, however it wasn't that comfortable really. The shower was in the tub which was annoying to get in and out of considering the size of the bathroom, and I wasn't able to adjust the size of the shower head. This is a good valued hotel but would look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect find”
Reviews.Author: tanyasiv
Reviews.Content: We loved hotel Canada a lot. Friendly people. Beautiful super clean rooms, big batthrooms. Great breakfast. Easy to get around by public transportation. Would go back there anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: strat01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on TripAdvisor reviews. The room was big, the WiFi was free, the breakfast was free (and good). Within walking distance (with luggage) from Termini and the staff were helpful and friendly. It ticked all the boxes for me. Certainly stay there again when next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hcmk21771
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay in Rome. Rome is a fantastic city and staying at this hotel just may it better. The hotel is a little bit out from the centre but the service and the decor of this hotel makes up for the little more effort you have to make to travel to the sites. The rooms are just lovely the decor again and the views from the large windows. The breakfast and the staff at breakfast as well as all the staff in this hotel can not do enough for you. The man who takes your bags to your room for you is a gem he is also the bar tender. I can recomend the little bar opposite around the corner cheap and friendly was had many salute in this bar. Yes the bar in the hotel is great very cheap and they do put snacks out at tea time each day also free room service. A tip for you is when you check in ask if possible for a tea and coffee tray this was lovely after a day sight seeing. Thanks again to all the staff at Hotel Canada I will return both to wonderful Rome and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: natbro
Reviews.Content: There really is nothing I can add to the other fabulous reviews of this hotel, so I will re-iterate some of the comments. The gentlemen (they were grown-up men, not the kids you find in some hotels) who manned the front desk were very professional and helpful. The room (420) was so very nice. Painted ceiling, comfortable bed, comfortable pillows and quality linens. Nice sized wardrobe for clothes storage. FREE internet- just ask for a code after check-in. There was a safe, hidden behind a wall picture. The bathroom was quite large and had a nice window. There was a shower curtain in the tub/shower combo rather than the commonly found glass half door and a retractable clothes line over tub. Upscale personal care amenities. Washcloths are available upon request at front desk. Breakfast was very good. Selection is better early on (for example- there was smoked salmon at 7am but not at 9:30am). We found the hotel ideally situated. We were arriving by train and departing by air, so being close to Termini (about 3 or 4 blocks from hotel) was great. Both subway lines are at Termini and a one-line stop is even closer, 1/2 block away. Also, Termini is a great place to pick up the city buses. There are a lot of restaurants in the hotel area- some better than others. We ate at I Leoni D'Abruzzo a couple of times, simply because we found the waiters so enjoyable. We've been to Rome a few times and are very sorry we didn't know about this hotel until now. It's a real winner!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, recently rennovated hotel in the heart of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: bambino0
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with our stay at the Best Western Canada. We arrived after a long flight and a one hour train journey into the centre of Rome (via the Leonardo Express which was very convenient), and after a 10 Minute walk from the Roma Termini we arrived to be greeted by the Hotel's lovely, welcoming staff and felt instantly at home in the beautiful, cool marble lobby. This hotel looks like it has been recently renovated and every room is clean and nicely furnished. In addition, the breakfast is excellent value with everything you could want (pastry, eggs, cold meats, cheese etc). All the staff were great including the wait staff at breakfast that brought me my coffee each morning. Most of the sights of Rome are in walking distance, provided you are reasonably fit (we walked everywhere). While the hotel is in a good, quiet area, the restaurants immediately around the hotel are expensive and quite average but walk a few blocks north and you will find much better food. We had a great stay and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: denisem1345
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canada is a very nice hotel. Large room and bathroom with beautiful furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, reviewers have been right on!”
Reviews.Author: gottogonow
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights with friends before a cruise. We cannot say enough about the rooms, the staff and the location. We would recommend this hotel whole heartedly. Breakfast was excellent! Elevator is a trip! Be sure to eat at the little restaurant a half ablock from the front door. Food was excellent, simple but good and the best lemon dessert I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfactory - We will come back!”
Reviews.Author: worldcats
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in September for 3 nights and were very pleased with the comfortable accommodation and helpful staff. Vincenzo greeted us warmly on the evening of our arrival and continued to look after us with his kind and professional manner. He really helped make us feel welcome each night when we returned from our adventures and showed genuine interest in our comfort. The hotel room was beautiful, spacious, clean and comfortable and the cleaning staff very pleasant. The bathroom is big with hot water, soft fluffy white towels, spa-like supplies including toothpaste kits and slippers. The bed is extremely comfortable. We thought the breakfast room and staff were wonderful and the selection of food was excellent. We hope all this never changes as we recommend this hotel and will stay ourselves again in the future. The location is a bit out of the main tourist attractions but cab rides are friendly and inexpensive and at the end of our day of adventures we would simply take the short cab ride back to the hotel. The location is really close to the Termini Train Station so very convenient from that aspect. We did not try riding the bus but is was another option and very close.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: TheRowntrees
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights before and one night after our Med cruise. The hotel choice (based on Trip advisor comments) was excellent in every way and the hotel bar was first class - good value for money, pleasant environment, free food (sandwiches, cakes etc - not just nibbles). Metro nearby (1 Euro per trip), train terminal walkable (trains to Fiumiacino airport) and bus transfer to Ciampino airport even nearer. They gave us an even bigger room for our second stay - both were excellent

Reviews.Title: “Very accommadating Hotel”
Reviews.Author: richs25644
Reviews.Content: My wife & I and two friends stayed at the hotel Canada for 1 night before an 11 night cruise and for 1 night upon our return to Rome. We arrived from the U.S. early after an 8 hour flight and the staff was very accommodating, storing our luggage until check-in. Our room was large, clean and quiet. The bathroom was everything we could want. The décor of the lobby and rooms was impressive, including the frescoes on the ceilings. The free breakfast was excellent, with great service. The lobby bar was a nice place to unwind at night. The hotel is just a few minutes’ walk to the metro, which we used to get to the sights. There are several sidewalk cafes nearby which we enjoyed. The front desk staff also helped us with our airport and port transfers, and arranging a Vatican tour. I would stay here again, and highly recommend the Hotel Canada

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: thkl070
Reviews.Content: Only 500 metres from Termini, metro station Castro Pretorio around the corner. A very good choice in Rome. Rooms are clean, good beds, nice staff and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: cazcam
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 day trip to Rome. This hotel was in a very good location, staff very friendly and helpful and breakfast lovely. Again, we found it was handy being so close to Termini but also within walking distance of most of the sightseeing locations. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Roman hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malgosha
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel exhausted after a 16 hour flight. We were checked in quickly and shown to our room by the bellman. The room was clean and had all the necessary items to make our stay a pleasure. The bed was very comfortable, the air conditioning worked and room was quiet even though it overlooked a busy street. In the morning we were treated to a terrific breakfast which kept me full until a late dinner in the evening. It is close to the train station and there are many family run restaurants in the area that offer the 17 Euro full price dinner (this includes 3 courses, wine and tip) . We enjoyed our 3 day stay at this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service, advice and impeccable professionalism”
Reviews.Author: maderaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I have now been staying at this hotel for many years and I cannot find an equivalent in Rome. The staff is frinedly, hositable and above all professional. The rooms, the service the breakfast are of an excellent standard and the staff remember you, greet you and ensure that your stay at the hotel feels like home. The ambiance is warm and private, the bar service is condusive to entertaining clients and friends, and I have found over the years that the staff bend over backwards to assist with you travel not only in Rome but other destinatiions. I HIGLY RECOMMEND this hotel to everyone going to Rome for business, pleasure or fun! Gianfranca, Vincenzo, Giovanni, Raffalele and all the crew at the hotel including Signora Dragiza and the ladies in the briakfast room are marvellous Last but least is Massimo and Sdwin who are always obliging. Franca Smarrelli, Melbourne

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Rome!!!”
Reviews.Author: barca99utd
Reviews.Content: Do not listen to those recent, malicious reviews of this fantastic hotel. From the wonderful Vincenzo, on the front desk to the guys who work the bar area( especially Massimo, Marco and Edwin!) this hotel cannot be faulted. Wonderful breakfast served from 7 to 10.30 with a fantastic choice of food. The hotel is a 5 to 10 minute walk from termini and is an ideal launch pad for the wonderrful city that is Rome. The room was cleaned every day with fresh towels and toiletries replaced. We asked for tea making facilities and this was duly provided. Whenever i come back to Rome, this is the only hotel i will stay in!! Superb choice, cannot be beaten!!

Reviews.Title: “HUGE ROOM...”
Reviews.Author: gyrocompass
Reviews.Content: Location is not in the touristy part of Rome. The hotel is about 10min walk from the Rome Termini. Room was huge and very clean. We were pleasantly surprise to get such a nice room. Great value as well. We picked this hotel due to the proximity to the termini to catch the Leonard express for an early morning flight...

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the High-End of the 3-Star Hotels”
Reviews.Author: cr1000
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights and was impressed with the nice room and perfect location. I had a corner room on the first floor and despite the proximity to a busy street, the double windows worked well in keeping the noise out. No problems with AC noted unlike other reviews. Room was very nicely decorated with antique-style furniture (desk, dresser, wall mirror, etc.) and a vaulted and painted ceiling. The breakfast buffet was small but tasty and filling. Termini station was a 5 min. walk away, which made it easy for transportation to/from the airport. Also, the Castro Pretorio metro station was immediately around the corner from this hotel, which allowed you to get to tourist attractions like the Colloseum and Circus Maximus directly on the Blue Line for just 1 Euro each way. If 3-star accomodations is what you are looking for in downtown Rome, then this hotel is definitely worth staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, convienent hotel”
Reviews.Author: TwoInParadise
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. The hotel was nice and close to the metro and a short walk to the train station. The breakfast was quite good. There were often snacks int he lobby/bar area in the evenings. The front desk staff was extremely helpful with making restaurant recommendations and reservations, and helping with sight seeing plans. We did find the hotel to be a bit noisy at night, perhaps due to the other guests, and the shower was a bit small/oddly arranged. Otherwise we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay at the Canada”
Reviews.Author: snoopyhelen
Reviews.Content: Just recently returned from a 5 night stay at this wonderful hotel. We stayed in room 320 from 30 August - 4 September. The hotel had everything you could want and more. Very friendly efficient staff, very smooth check in by Vincenzo on the front desk. The breakfast was lovely, so much choice and the quality was fantastic. The cappuccinno is very nice. The rooms are very nice, big comfortable bed, fully equipped bathroom with whole range of extras including slippers which came in very handy and the air con kept us nice and cool. The hotel itself is beautiful and we frequented the bar on many occasions while we were there. We always found the barmen to be extremely efficient and friendly, in particular, Massimo and Edwin. The prices are extremely good as well and you can take advantage of the room service which is free. All in all a great stay at a wonderful hotel. I highly recommend this hotel. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AUSTRALIANRULEZ
Reviews.Content: How on earth is Hotel Canada ranked 13 on tripadvisor? I think it’s missing a few 00’s. Should be ranked 1300th. Stayed here for 4 nights in late August with my wife and little boy. After the first night, we were tempted to forfeit our money and move to another establishment. I can relate to the past few reviewers comments which mention “hot hot hot”. This hotel should not be allowed to advertise air conditioning when they clearly don’t have any. We all baked – doesn’t help when your little one is up all night. Bad no sleep after bad night sleep – came close to ruining our Roma trip. I have stayed with Best Western’s before and have always had an “Ok” experience. I don’t expect the Hilton but I don’t expect a bad experience either. Other then baking to death each night, some staff were friendly (in the kitchen, bellhop). Front desk staff are unhelpful/rude. Eg. Bellhop chap was tied up helping guests. People in the bar wanted a drink. Fat Chap from front desk refused to lend a hand. Bit odd if you ask me. Food at breakfast was a hit and miss. The first 3 breakfasts were terrible. The last day we had a nice breakfast (with parma ham). Not sure where the Parma ham was the first 3 days. Stale bread isn’t nice either. Juice was more like lolly water (probably had 2% real OJ). Now for the good: Rooms were a good size, I will give them that. Bathroom was adequate. Furnishings in room were up to scratch. No mini bar and no staff at the bar was a bit annoying. The restaurants near the hotel were ok as well. Be careful at night as the hotel is in a dangerous area.

Reviews.Title: “HOT HOT HOT.....No Air condition”
Reviews.Author: EnglandChap
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a recent business trip to Roma last week. This was my first (and last) stay with a Best Western Chain Hotel. I can confirm that the hotel rooms lacked air conditioning. Although the room/hotel was for the most part clean, I was extremly uncomfortable due to the heat. There was a built in fan in my room but it didn't produce any cool air. Maybe this is the place to stay in Winter...when its cold outside...the rooms may be toasty warm (like they are in summer). I had breakfast at the hotel the first day. Was not impressed. Ended up grabbing a piece of pizza at a near by pizzeria. Second day, just had a cup of coffee at the hotel - didn't want to try to the breakfast again. Oh yea, there was no minibar in the room which was annoying as I needed to cool off with a drink. There was a bar downstairs but I didn't try it. Locaton - about 10 minutes walk to train station, a bit far from town.

Reviews.Title: “cute and well situated”
Reviews.Author: SteveCE
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an authentic feel, with spacious and well decorated rooms, and a really nice old-style elevator. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Great location for discovering the city centre. Located only a few minutes from the central station for easy access by metro to all the main attractions. The hotel's neigborhood itself has some nice bars, restaurants and piazza's very close by. Wireless internet available for free, all you have to do is ask an access code at the front desk. No parking but they have a deal with a guarded parking down the street so you have access to a reduced price. Overall a really nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Let down - not sure how this hotel got such a high rating”
Reviews.Author: lamandude
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights last week on biz. Hotel is clean-ish. Staff our rude, Breakfast was terrible. Room size was good. Cheap bar is good. Air condition - terrible. Management need to fix this problem as Roma can get very hot. I am perplexed how this hotel received such a high rating. Something is fishy to me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good location, wonderful helpfull staff. clean. Excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: foxymark
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 3 night break to Rome In August, mainly on the recommendations of trip advisor reviews. We were not dissapointed . Hotel is within easy walking distance of the Termini station, Metro and Bus routes. Room was a great size, very quiet, lovely big bed. breakfast was excellent with all main choices you could think of. it was great to come back to the Hotel late afternoon to the air conditioning and a good shower. The staff were excellent and bar staff remembered our drink order after the first night!. Would definately recommend this Hotel and stay here again when we return to Rome. Go on, book it, you wont be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “A great Find - stayed there 3 times”
Reviews.Author: candlesNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Trip Advisor and we're very glad we did. Super Clean. Excellent staff. Stayed 3 nights in August (Thank goodness for air conditioning) Stayed 2 weeks in Calabria (loved It!) Went back to overnight in Rome again on our way to Florence & Venice. Before returning to New York, we again stayed for two nights. We had 3 different rooms and all were elegant and beautiful with frescoed domed ceilings and new bathrooms. Great Full Breakfasts in a lovely salon. What else can I say other than I would recommend this lovely gem to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Hotel Canada - Simply The Best!”
Reviews.Author: SableRostron
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay here. This was my 2nd trip and it won't be my last. I absolutely love this hotel and the staff. You couldn't stay in a nicer hotel in Rome for the money or indeed meet such nice and attentive staff. Incidentally although this is a Best Western Hotel it is independently owned by the Pucci family which obviously is why it sets it apart from the rest. We arrived at 11.30 am which was clearly too early for check in but that wasn't a problem. Vincenzo on the front desk advised us to take a seat and our room would be ready shortly so we took a seat in the bar and had an ice cold drink and sandwhich while we waited. The bar is extremely inviting and relaxing - the prices for drinks here cannot be beaten in Rome - only 1 euro for ice cold water and 2 euros for Italian beer. We often called in at the bar after a morning of sight seeing to take some water and ice up to our room and also used room service which is free! The room was light and airy - the bed was extremely comfortable and the room was supplied with everything you could need and more - toiletries i.e. shower gel, body lotion, shampoo, soap, cotton buds, nail file, toothbrush and paste etc. In addition I like my tea and so I requested a tea and coffee kit from reception which is free and comprises a kettle and cups and coffee, milk, tea and sugar for you to use for the duration of your stay. The room was cleaned on a daily basis by the maid and we always came back to a freshly made bed and a fresh supply of towels. The breakfast here is legendary - I have stayed at a number of hotels in Italy and have never come across a better breakfast than this one - the choice and quality are excellent - scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, tomatoes, turkey, ham, cheese, boiled eggs, numerous fresh pastries - I can higly recommend the chocolate one!, croissants, cake, biscuits, a selection of different fruit every day, fruit juices, yoghurts, breakfast cereals etc. The cappuccino is excellent - we had one every day! It is only a 5 minute walk maximum to Termini train station and we have found this to be an excellent base as you can get around so easily on the Metro system which is very easy and very cheap being only 1 euro for a single journey. We used it every day and find it much easier and convenient to use than a bus. Although we had heard that Termini area can be dodgy we have never found this to be the case and have always felt safe and been OK even when out late at night. This was our 2nd trip to this hotel and it certainly won't be our last. We love Rome and we love this hotel and the staff which for us contributes to a good holiday. In summary if you are looking for a beautiful, comfortable, clean hotel with excellent facilities, frendly accommodating staff and a good base in which to explore Rome then look no further!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value Small Hotel - American Service and Cleanliness with Italian Charm”
Reviews.Author: RoseAlice
Reviews.Content: I have just read the previous review of this hotel ("When In Rome Don't Stay Here"). We also stayed in the Hotel Canada in August this year and had a very different experience. I can only re-iterate what the majority of tripadvisor members have written. The hotel was clean, the breakfasts were terrific, there was a nice small lounge area and bar to relax in after sightseeing all day, the room was a good size for the four of us (2 adults and 2 young(ish) children) - we had a queen sized bed plus two 'camp' beds, tv, desk, 2 comfy armchairs and a spotless en-suite bathroom. Coincidentally, our air-conditioning worked perfectly throughout the blazing August heat. The service was exceptionally good I thought, everyone we encountered was friendly and helpful. For us the only slightly negative aspect was the hotel's location. It is a little way out of the city centre. Although being a short walk from Termini train station does mean you can get a bus to any location you like because it is also the main bus terminus for the city. Termini (like any other city train station in Europe) does attract a fair number of migrants and homeless people and lots of hawkers trying to sell you watches/plastic parasols etc. It is fine during the day, but coming home at night with young kids we tended to take taxis back to the hotel rather than going via the station since it did feel a little unsafe. I would still highly recommend this hotel. If you are heading out at night a tip is to walk from termini towards piazza della Repubblica, this is a much smarter area, with nice bars, restaurants, opera house etc. We came across a modern italian restaurant there called 'Cotto' (Via Torino) which was fantastic. Do stay at this hotel! There is a reason it is currently rated #11 of all hotels in Rome on tripadvisor...

Reviews.Title: “The Staff restored our faith in Italians”
Reviews.Author: glumball
Reviews.Content: After being charged 29 Euros for the very short taxi ride from nearby Termini Station we arrived a little flustered at The Hotel Canada. We were consoled by the desk staff and told that our taxi driver was not typical. During our four day stay at this hotel we experienced levels of service that we have rarely experienced elsewhere. They ordered tours and taxis for us and suggested good, moderately priced places to dine always with a smile and saying "no problem". Our lodgings were excellent, our room was really two with separate sitting and sleeping areas and a huge bathroom. Although the bed was firm it afforded a good night's sleep. The decor throughout all the public areas was very Italian and perhaps a bit overdone but it created a Roman atmosphere. The level of maintenance was excellent. Breakfast in the bright breakfast room was delicious and the service was sharp and cheerful. Although it is off a main thorougfare the hotel is situated only a few hundred metres stroll from Termini and Tour bus terminals that provide a gateway to the city's sights. Words cannot express our delight at finding this gem of a hotel - thankyou TripAdvisor. Take a look at our photos to see what I mean. If we ever return to Rome we will be heading straight to The Hotel Canada.

Reviews.Title: “when in rome, DONT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Downunderman
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at the Hotel Canada in Roma. In all honesty, we were very disappointed with this hotel. Here is our review: Good Points: - Hotel Room: Good size rooms. - Furniture: Traditional old furniture which was nice. - Bed: Comfortable four poster bed. - Free bottle of cheap wine included as part of our stay, Bad points: - Air Condition: What air con!?!?!?! I could not sleep for the four nights I was there as their Air Con machine was more like a gentle fan. We sweat to death every night. - Breakfast: The breads were soggy and you felt like they had been purchased off a bakery who couldn’t sell their goods 2 weeks ago. It was gross. The meat was foul. The juice was water with flavour added. - Staff: Staff were not friendly. They were too old and grumpy. - No coffee/tea in room. - No mini bar. - Bar: Despite the barman also having to be the bell hop, when three people were waiting at the bar to be served (and pressing the bell), the gentleman behind the front counter couldn’t be bothered to serve us. We all sat there for 25 minutes waiting for the bellhop/.barman/concierge to get a chance to do his bar job. - Snacks at bar: Stale and gross. I wouldn’t serve it to my dog. - Shower: Poor shower pressure. - No free internet. - Staff recommendation of restaurants: they only recommended restaurants in the area where they get a commission for you to eat there. - Location: About 15 minutes walk from the station. It is on the wrong side of town. It is about 1 hours walk into the “old Roma” town. It is close to the metro but is in a dodgy area. - Lack of tv channels. All in all, this is the final drop of the hat with me and best western hotels. I will never ever stay with this chain again. Extremely disappointed. I hope they go broke.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome Sleep in Canada!”
Reviews.Author: servok
Reviews.Content: This hotel is delightful. The breakfast is superb: meats, cheeses, pastries, juices, eggs, cereals, bread, jams, fresh fruits and coffee. The breakfast room is beautuful. The staff were extremely helpful. An internet connection is in the lobby for 3 Euros. A Metro station is around the corner. A cash bar is in the lobby & priced right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJoe_9
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the hotel. The hotel is close to metro stations and the train station. It is centrally located. The hotel is nicely decorated. The breakfast is great . There is a good selection of foods. The hotel understands the north american concept of a breakfast. The waiters in the cafeteria are overwhelming nice. The hotel comes with wireless internet. The desk personnel at the reception are very helpful. The hotel had a mini-van pick us up at the airport at a good price. The driver was ponctual and good-mannered. The rooms in the hotel were well decorated and clean. The hotel is great value. I was surprised that it is rated a 3 star. For what you get, it definitely rates greater than a 3 star. It is a definite recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room, good service, next to Termini”
Reviews.Author: ottwatrvlr
Reviews.Content: My experiences at Best Western's in Europe have been generally good but not necessarily great. Rooms have always been clean, sometimes larger than average, sometimes in historic settings/locations and some with an interesting decor. The Best Western Hotel Canada in Rome is not your typical Best Western hotel. The only thing similar at this location versus other BW in Europe is the ridiculous small lift/elevator. This is where the simalirities end. The BW Canada is located apprx. 5 minutes walk from Roma Termini and this has to be one of the premier hotel in the area. It is a bit more expensive than the other nearby BW but quite worth it. Upon check-in, front desk and bell staff were very friendly and helped with luggage, as mentioned previously, the lift is narrow. The room assigned (queen deluxe) looked and felt very luxurious and spacy. It compares very favorably to higher end "chain hotel" located in more prime location. The bathroom was also very large and was furnished with well above average toilettries, including unusual (ie: non-standard) items such as 2 toothbrush kits, tissues and more. The decor is very tasteful and the room seemed to have been extremely well maintained. Free wifi is available by obtaining userid/password from the front desk. Note that like most Italian hotels, they will make a copy of a piece of ID prior to giving you internet access. Breakfast was included in our rate. There are several food options available. Others have commented before that this was a very nice breakfast. I have founf the fruits and pastries to be of high quality. Hot items were prepared in a way that left me somewhat perplexed however. A great hotel for a long-term stay, or a quick overnight stay if commuting by train from/to Roma Termini and within reasonable walking distance from some of the tourist attractions (and the metro at Termini)

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Canada was exactly what I expected it to be and more”
Reviews.Author: didi2009
Reviews.Content: Based on all the comments and feedback that I got from trip advisor, it was exactly what I expected and more. The service was good, the breakfast was great and above all else, the room was spotless. I am a neat freak and both me and my spouse were so happy with this hotel. The proximity to the "termini" and the metro line was definitely a plus. We were close enough to everything and our area was full of cute little restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: PattyT123
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Canada was recommended by two of my co-workers. As this was our first time in Rome, what we needed was a location close to the train station and a very helpful staff. We got it all. It was a short walk from the terminal to the hotel, very easy to find. The staff was able to give advice and book tours for us, with pick-up at the hotel. Best of all, they arranged a taxi to the airport at a flat rate. The breakfast (included) was fantastic. Lots of variety - something for everyone. The lobby bar was comfortable, and drinks were very, very reasonably priced - probably the cheapest we've come across in any hotel in Europe or North America. The hotel had yummy appetizers in the afternoon and early evening. A pleasant surprise was getting a full bucket of ice whenever we wanted it - have never had this experience in Europe. Our room was comfortable with a balcony overlooking a courtyard. We had trouble finding the safe, but the staff advised us it was beind the picture on the wall - so cool! I would definitely recommend the hotel Canada to anyone travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “CAUTION: Employees at the front desk/reception are dishonest”
Reviews.Author: EuroTraveller1000
Reviews.Content: CAUTION: Employees at the front desk/reception are dishonest. The room was old but comfortable. Employees in the breakfast room staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: gioia26
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel from the reviews posted on this site. I agree! It's a great small hotel in a great location: 6 blocks from the train station and 1/2 block from the metro! The staff was great and helpful. Happy hour is fun. The rooms are beautiful with painted ceilings, similar to ancient Roman frescos! We were greeted warmly by the staff at the front desk. They knew it was our anniversary and congratulated us. We found wine and a lovely Roman tour book in our room as well! I would highly recommend this hotel. The breakfast was really wonderful! It was everything we wanted in a Roman hotel. We will stay here again! Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful price/quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: French_Traveler31
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I would like to grant our best award (!) to the Best Western Hotel Canada in Roma, Italy. We only spent 3 nights there but we would like to underline the quality of service that was granted to us. From our arrival to our departure, the whole team of this superb hotel just made their best to fulfill our needs and expectations to our utmost standards. Any request?Just ask them! Our room was very beautiful and isolated from the noise coming from the streets. The bed was of excellent quality and the cleanliness at the best. Air conditioning worked like a charm. The bathtube was too small compared to our standard but this was not a problem. We are used to stay in many hotels of varying quality and this one will stay as our best memory for a hotel even if there is some room for improvement (noise from housewives at 07:00 (am) and no fresh fruit salad for breakfast). Congratulations to the team of Best Western Hotel Canada in Roma, Italy! And we really hope you'll love it too!

Reviews.Title: “Superb staff, great location, very good deal”
Reviews.Author: john_Bones3
Reviews.Content: An unexpected medical emergency hit my companion while we were at the Hotel Canada. The wonderful staff at the Hotel--all of them--couldn't have been more helpful and supportive during this time when we had to extend our time there. They went out of their way to assist us. And, as the other reviews note, the hotel is conveniently located, has a delightful feel to the place, rooms are fine, walking distance to lots of things, and the breakfast is first class. This is an excellent deal.

Reviews.Title: “Made our stay in Rome and Enjoyable one!”
Reviews.Author: brunello_fan
Reviews.Content: Recommended by a colleague, I wasnt able to book a room from the US due to it being full. I attempted one more time from tuscany and was surprised when I managed to book for 4 nights with one days notice! The room (double) was on first floor near elevators, so there was some hall noise, but it didnt affect our stay. Breakfast was great, staff was friendly and helpful and the location was excellent. Metro and bus around the corner with good directions from staff on getting around the city. In house Bar was great value for those afternoon drinks. Room AC worked well and bed was comfortable. Great Value, good location. Made our stay enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Good Loacation,cheap bar drinks, rooms to Hot!!”
Reviews.Author: Saaris
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location due to it being close to Termini & Metro, bart drinks were very good value,breakfast good. The room was ok although we had no safe and the aircon did not go below 24 Deg other than that not to bad, will probably go back if needed an overnight in Rome. Bar has a sort of Happy happy serving the odd snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Average to very good, but quiet, very clean, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: mickey75
Reviews.Content: We have stayed five times at this hotel--mostly because we can count on it being clean--no bugs-- and quiet--not to far from the railroad station--about a 7-8 minute walk--. one block from the metro/subway which takes you to many main sightseeing spots, although you might have to transfer. Also, one block behind the hotel is a bus which goes to lots of main spots, like trevi fountain, very close to piazza navona, etc. We bought a one day pass so we just hopped off and on the subway/metro, or bus and got around very easily The staff is mixed--not overly friendly, but will answer questions. Rooms are smallish, but adequate and very clean. One very nice feature is a free cocktail buffet starting at about five o'clock which has hor d"oerves, nuts, chips, cookies, . It is very nice to take the edge off before dinner and if you are really scrimping, this with a slice of pizza somewhere would be enuf for a meal. The hotel is pricey for what is it but for a few dollars more, you can be assured of a quiet, very clean-no bug place and oh, it offers free internet for up to four days.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a family!”
Reviews.Author: Familytraveler1966
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Canada. We were in Rome for 3 days and stayed here with our 2 children (ages 10 and 12). We stayed in the family room with consisted of a queen bed and two singles. The way the room was set up was great. It was very roomy for 4 people. They had a great breakfast buffet that was included. The first day we slept too late and missed it, so my son and husband went out and had breakfast and it cost 60 euros - and they didn't even like it. The buffet was great - eggs, cereal, breads, yogurts - perfect for picky kids! The location was o.k. It is right around the corner from the subway and about a 10 minute walk to Termini station - bus and trains. Very easy to get around using these but not a lot of great places in quick walking distance. We walk to the Spanish Steps and it took about 1/2 hour - not bad normally but in 100 degree heat was hard. Restaurants around the hotel were not very good. We ate at a couple that the hotel recommended and just fair. Room was very quiet. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone - especially with kids. Very clean, not a bad location if you are willing to use subway, buses, etc, and great breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “well run good hotel with attantive service”
Reviews.Author: patakidiak
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Hotel Canada in Rome in June. It was our last night after two weeks of traveling with kids in Italy. We needed an oasis to rest up for the transatlantic flight, and that is just what we got. The rooms were clean, quiet, air conditioned. As a bonus they were stylishly furnished and had beautiful frescoes on the ceilings. Excellent showers, good beds, Wifi, and full breakfast included in the price. The front desk staff spoke good English, was knowledgeable and eager to help. There are several small restaurants within walking distance, like the "Meidenaples", that served authentic and good Naples cuisine. Cannot comment on sightseeing from this location,( we did not try) but the Metro stop and the Termini railroad station are very near. Occasionally we could smell faint cigarette smoke-that is the only negative I can think of. Definitely a hotel to keep in mind for the future.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: sissy2007l
Reviews.Content: This place is great.The staff goes out of there way to help you,give you advice of local resturants in area.The room was wonderful plenty of room great products in bathroom.close to metro stop.Every evening in the bar area they would put out great little snacks and drink prices were very reasonable.internet was free.Trattoria Leoni d Abruzzo is a resturant down the sidewalk it is Great.It was our anniversy and the hotel sent up Champane and chocolates.It was just wonderful.This hotel needs to be more than a 3-star.A perfect hidden little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Excellent Staff, Terrific Stay”
Reviews.Author: merlinandme
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Canada from May 23 through May 29. The hotel is lovely with a charming lobby and excellent rooms. Everything was sparkling clean. The beds were comfortable; the water was hot; the staff was helpful. Breakfast offers a wide choice of fresh foods, ranging from good pastries to an array of fruits, with all sorts of protein in between. The hotel is close enough to Termini that you can easily walk from the station to the hotel and avoid taxi fees. Yet it is far enough from Termini to avoid the noise and bustle. There are metro stops just around the corner. I highly recommend this hotel and commend the staff for their excellent attitudes, upkeep and service.

Reviews.Title: “best best western!”
Reviews.Author: tripsrme
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Centrally located just a few blocks from Termini. Smooth and efficent check-in although not standard check-in time. Standard room, well appointed, clean, quiet and comfortable. Good breakfast with plenty of choice. Bar was a welcome haven after very hot and sticky Rome days. Fantastic measures served with complimentary snacks in late afternoon and evening. Prices unbelievable..have never none such value in a hotel bar, all drinks/snacks served with a cheery smile. easy access to Metro around corner (B line) while A line can be accessed either from here with a change of line or direct at Termini. Restaurants within proximity of hotel OK but not that special. Suggest you walk up Via Bachelet across Piazza Indipendza into Via Castelfidardo.Several good restaurants here... though avoid the tourist menu places....try Da Vincenza near the top of road or restaurant on other side of road (can't remember name but all waiters Indian) both serve good food and many locals eating so good recommendation. Don't beafraid to refuse obligatory bread...usually quite dry and you get charged whether you eat it or not unless you refuse it! Try the open top bus tours..red ones have 2 day passes and run every twenty minutes...easy to hop on hop off. Can honestly say have never stayed in a Best Western before that gave 5 star service for 3 star charge. Use Terravision transfer from airport... 8 euro return either online or at bus stop....don't buy bus tickets on Ryan Air as they charge double price for same transfer...rip off merchants!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb quiet hotel in central position.”
Reviews.Author: NannyLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 days here with my sister. Cannot recommend this hotel more highly. Staff very helpful, drinks cheaper than anywhere outside. Room spotless and very comfortable.Very quiet at night. Hotel very near to Rome Termini. Good choice at breakfast. You won't go hungry. Dont eat in the nearby restaurants just have a wander up the local streets and you will find better restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Zurich
Reviews.Content: All the positive reviews posted here made me booking this hotel. What a great find, indeed. We stayed a whole week in a deluxe room, which was very well appointed. This hotel gives evidence that a hotel's quality does not depend just on its number of stars rather than on its level of maintenance, decoration, service and staff. I would give this hotel and its staff full marks! Breakfast was outstanding, good to high quality items, Staff there was kind and attentive. Housekeeping was reliable and did a very good job. We frequently enjoyed having drinks at the bar with friendly staff and extremely moderate prices. The hotel is conveniently located (and as a European I would never hesitate to call the neighbourhood fully safe), access to metro line B around the corner, central station nearby (many busses start there). Indeed, this hotel is a great find. After arrival, when entering our room, I was so happy about my choice. And I still am after having left.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than Stated or Expected”
Reviews.Author: Deidre_A
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from an 8 day trip to Paris and Rome and stayed in this hotel for 4 nights while in Rome. I cannot tell you how much we loved this hotel. The staff greeted us and had our room ready when we arrived. The room was exceptionally clean and quite spacious, especially having just left our very clean closet of a room in Paris. However we did have a delux room, but it was more than enough space for two with a spacious bathroom and a sitting area. The hotel offered free wireless internet as well as a great breakfast that you can get included with your room rate. There is also a hotel bar which has very resonable drink prices. The neighborhhod was residential but had lots of family run restaurants and other small hotels. I highly recommend the first restaurant just across the street from the hotel. We ate dinner here twice as well as two other restaurants in the area, but the food here was excellent. The neighborhood is just 3 blocks from Termini train station (a major station in the city) which is very convenient from the airport as well as a metro station. We did the hop on/hop off buses to get around (which I also recommend as they run on a 24 hour block, meaning if you get your ticket today at 3:00pm, it's good untl tomorrow at the same time so you can get a lot of site seeing done this way. All of the hop on/hop off serivces start and end at Termini and there are at least 6 companies to choose from for 20 Euro a day, or 30 Euro for a two day pass. Well worh it. You can buy tickets for the green Line company at the front desk of the hotel. Overall, I will definitely stay at this hotel again, as I plan to return to Rome in the fall. I can't wait. Sincerely, Deidre N. Arrington Atlanta, Georgia

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Melbournian3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Canada for 4 nights in a triple room and found all aspects of the hotel excellent. Was great value and would recommend highly. We arrived before check-in time after a 24 hour flight and were able to check in straight away and have breakfast which was a great start to our trip. Our room was lovely and spacious, comfortable, clean, quiet with large bathroom. The hotel is in great location, could walk from termini station with cases and close to metro which takes you to all the sights in just minutes. Breakfast was the best we had in Italy, with a big selection there is something for everyone (loved the fresh strawberries!). Free use of internet in lobby was also a plus. The bar and lobby area at the hotel was a major positive. It was great coming back to the bar and relaxing after a day sightseeing. This was something we missed in other hotels we stayed. We loved Rome and were very happy at Hotel Canada. Will definitely stay there again when in Rome. Our only disappointment was that we couldn't stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: ooookch
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Canada is a nice, old style hotel in the Termini area, about a 5-10 minute walk from the station. Considering the level of hotel prices in Rome it's a very good choice if you want to stay at a nice place without paying a fortune. The area around the hotel is quite noisy (restaurants and bars out in the street, but almost no traffic) and the walls are as thin as paper so don't forget to take your earplugs along. The elevator with the old fashioned two manual doors is somewhat fun, but it requires quite a lot of patience waiting for it when the hotel is busy. Be careful, some of the restaurants nearby are really bad tourist traps; ask the friendly and helpful people at the reception for tips.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rc_dc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our last night in Rome. This was our second time to Rome and we're really sorry that we didn't know about this hotel on our first time to Rome as the convenience of its location is absolutely fabulous. If you take the train into Rome, you can just walk over to the hotel which is not more than a ten minute walk. Take the via Gibaldi exit at the termini, hang a left on your exit, take your first right which is Via Vicenza and follow that road all the way up.....hotel is on the left hand side of the road. The metro system is excellent in getting you to any of the major sites you want to see when in Rome....take the line A towards Battistini to get to St. Peter's square, trevi fountain, spanish steps.....max. 7 minutes on the metro to get to St. Peter's square. This hotel had great rooms, great service, excellent breakfast......the choices were exceptional compared to all the other hotels we have stayed at in Italy. We highly recommend staying at this hotel for anyone visiting Rome. Bravo Canada Hotel.....keep up the excellent service!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't ask for better..”
Reviews.Author: Missy3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Hotel Canada and it was just wonderful. Vencenzo was a terrific help arranging transportation and resturant suggestions. The buffet breakfast was very good and the service was top notch. The rooms were emaculate and very comfortable. We would gladly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: wjnireland
Reviews.Content: train to termini, walk to the end, exit marsala, turn left, first right, almost at the end on the right. perfectly safe, spotlessly clean, excellent value for coffee and drinks. try the bath, perfecto!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: MargMac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Hotel Canada for 3 nights at the end of May. As soon as we arrived the staff made us welcsome. The room was very nice, it included a nice chair and settee for relaxing. Breakfast was very enjoyable, a good selection for all. This gave us a good start to the day. Location was also good. Easy for walking, metro and the Termini station. Lots of nice affordable restaurants close by serving good food and wine. All in all a very enjoyable time in Rome. A couple of tips, be careful when leaving the metro at the Vatican. The doors closed very quickly knocking both of us to the floor. Also, watch out for the price of drinks in the cafe opposite the Coliseum, they charge €5.50 for a coffee or a soft drink.

Reviews.Title: “All the reviews are correct! This is a wonderful hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dbcme
Reviews.Content: We spent hours online before the trip trying to find the perfect hotel. We had hesitations with this property because it's a) Best Western (not a great brand in the U.S) and b) it didn't seem like an authentic Italian hotel experience. But...the reviews for this place convinced us to stay here. Absolutely worth it! Pros: (MANY) -Breakfast Buffet (complimentary).
