We enjoyed waking up each morning knowing we'd have a hot and extensive selection of items to choose from, including an amazing selection of fresh pastries. -Multilingual staff regardless of the hour, able to answer questions. -Clean, spacious to European standards, decorated and comfortable rooms. -Great toiletries, complimentary internet (1 desktop) and Wi-Fi. -No problem accommodating 3 of us in one room (without the third person getting stuck with a rollaway bed!) -It rained on 6/1/09 during our last day there and they offered us umbrellas to take with us around town. Cons: -Lacking tour options/suggestions. They had a few pamphlets, but were not proactive in suggesting ideas of places to explore. -Location (mixed). The area is safe and clean. There are a handful of Tratorrias and dining options within a few blocks, but none we visited were particularly lively or authentic. But, the hotel is a 6-7 minute walk to Roma Termini which made for easy transportation to the airport (11 euros by the way), and connections to other cities outside Rome. Overall, we were impressed by the quality of the hotel and service received. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. I'd recommend it to singles, couples and families. Not for backpackers so much - as there are more backpacker friendly stays in the same neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “very quaint hotel with easy access to major places in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Lafayette1
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in this hotel pre-cruise and had a great experience. In true European style, the rooms are a bit small, however the charm makes up for this. There are frescoes on the ceilings in the rooms and public areas. They have a great breakfast buffet along with complimentary hors deurves in the evening. The hotel is across the street from a subway stop and only a few blocks from the main subway terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: travelswithdiane
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to Termini. We booked and paid a month in advance for superior category rooms at 168 euros (approximately $220) per twin room (we had two rooms for four people. Our rooms were quiet, spacious and well decorated. The beds were comfortable with nice pillows and linens. Terrycloth robes and slippers were in the rooms. They offered an excellent breakfast (including buffalo mozzarella!). The location is a bit out of the way for many of Rome’s tourist attractions, but they are near many bus routes and a metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: bazzaAndover
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights after reviewing previous comments on this site. We were not disappointed. Lovely rooms, flat screen tv (and no german tv stations!!) plus very nioce breakfast and very attentive staff. Perfect base for exploring Rome very close to Termini station (but not too close) and very close to Metro just round the corner. Weather very hot but air con made it very comfortable. The bar as others have said is very very reasonable. 1 euro for bottle of water, 3.50 euros for large gin and tonic! Exchange rate a problem but you cant blame the hotel for that!! Plenty of good quality restuarants close by. Dont talk to the waiters about football, you'll be there all day!! All in all a very nice place and the other reviews are very accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: sam_241286
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very nice lobby and great priced drinks! Variety of restaurants at average prices near the hotel, very nice food! Rooms were lovely and clean and flatscreen tv. the bed was extremely comfy! Visited all the sights and the colleseum was a short walk away, the furthest away was the vatican but you can easily catch a bus or train from termini which is just down the road... you cant miss it! The breakfast was great and served until 10.00! great variety for all and english breakfast too! quick and friendly service! The staff are always with a smile serving free snacks with the drinks! The rooms even had free slippers and toiletries replenished every day! Terravision buses will take you to and from the airport if you havent booked, and it takes you to termini which is great because you dont have to drag your luggage far! Would definately go again! Rome was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “We will go back!”
Reviews.Author: TynesideTraveller65
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well located with a number of pleasant restaurants within a 10 minute walk. If you are in a perty of 3 or more, consider taking a taxi from the airport - it may not cost much more than the train, with the convebience of luggage being transported. Take a street map - Rome can be "walked" fairly easily (but not to the Vatican)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a tourist visiting Rome”
Reviews.Author: jarfykk
Reviews.Content: Located on the eastern edge of the major sights in Rome (and right off the B-line metro), the Canada was a good place to call home for four days. It was a convenient enough to most everything in Rome, had an excellent breakfast buffet, wonderful staff, and it was clear why it is so highly rated on this site. The staff was extraordinarily helpful when we had questions. And while Rome is an overpriced tourist trap in my humble opinion, the hotel was a welcome respite from it all. The computer in the lobby was a god send, but the staff was helpful enough that I could have easily just asked them to look up the few things I wanted. The room itself was lovely, big, and had a nice bathroom (with tub). It was recently re-done, or at least appeared to be. It was quiet as a mouse with the window shut, and had AC (which was un-needed). The neighborhood is nice and quiet, with a small supermarket 7-8 minutes away, though I couldn't manage to find an above average place to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cuspic
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Rome before and made our choice of Hotel by reading the reviews. Almost all were good,so we booked with them and we were not disappointed. The location was ideal with the Metro station very close and the Termni only a ten minuit walk for those of us over 60. The staff was very friendly, and the rooms very clean. Great eating place near by ( La Tavernetta) so you can drink that bottle of wine and not worry about the 1/4 block walk back to you room. If you want modern decor forget it. One thing we would ask you to ignore is the pamphlet in the room for Green Line Tours. They are a TERRIBLE OUTFIT and we suggested that staff remove the booklet from the rooms. Hope that did not fall on deaf ears. All and all a very positive experiance.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: scrowley
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel whenever we're in Rome due to location. Really close to Termini and another metro stop whose name escapes me (castro?) but takes you right to Coliseum (and other key stops) for those interested. Rooms are nice and big, very clean (might sound silly, but bathrooms are great - which can be an issue in Italy). Staff are a bit lacking in customer service but such is Rome. Breakfast (buffet) is really good (dont expect good cappucini!) and there is lots of variety. Hotel staff can arrange rides to/from airport . Dont let the phrase "close toTermini" get you scared - this location is safe, lots of restaurants and pizza bars (and peple) around and walkable to some of Romes sites of interest (e.g. Santa Maria Maggiore). Overall good price, decent service and location is huge. We have stayed there 3 times and will do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, safe location and excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: SJH27
Reviews.Content: After reviewing other comments on here, we decided to book in this hotel from 23rd April for 4 days and we weren't disappointed. Although the room was quite small, it was beautifully decorated and very clean. The bathroom was surprisingly bigger than i expected with free toiletries (the body lotion was lovely) and slippers. The free breakfast served was all you needed to fill you up for the long day of walking you had ahead! Pastries, cakes, cooked meats, eggs, bacon, fresh fruit, cereals,yoghurts, juices and so much more, it certainly filled us up and was very tasty! Although we didn't use the bar area, there were free nibbles and comfy couches to sit on and i even saw someone playing the Wii that was set up in there! I assume there is a small charge for this though. We always felt safe walking back to the hotel as the street has lots of bustling restaurants. The area does have a fair bit of graffiti but this is also throughout Rome and is the only thing that lets it down. We walked to all the sights as the weather was lovely and did not see a need to use public transport so cannot comment on the transport system but overall, i would definitely stay here again and recommend it to couples and families alike.

Reviews.Title: “close to the train station-don't take a taxi-they will rip you off. just walk”
Reviews.Author: deejayrussia
Reviews.Content: They have a great breakfast- Nice rooms Quiet and helpful

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: GatorNation
Reviews.Content: Very clean, great service and the price a bargain. We stayed for a week and had very, very few complaints. The staff treated us wonderfully (especially Edwin, one of the bartenders!) The breakfast buffet was good and a big money saver. The hotel is not right in the middle of everything, but the neighborhood is safe and the trains are very convenient. Most tourist sights are very easily reached. The drinks at the Hotel Canada bar are about half the price (or cheaper) than any other restaurant or bar that we went to! Amazingly reasonble for a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff, very clean, good practical location”
Reviews.Author: Steve081974
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Canada for a week at the end of March, and would confidently recommend it to anyone travelling to Rome. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was a good size and nicely decorated (as was the rest of the hotel), with a good sized bathroom too. All was spotlessly clean - the hotel looks very well cared for and is a credit to those who clean and maintain it. For what is a very pleasant hotel in a European capital I thought the price was pretty good value too. The breakfast buffet offered a good and plentiful range of hot and cold food and was easily able to fill me up until dinner time, and the bar prices, while not cheap, were reasonable and certainly cheaper than in some other hotels. The free evening nibbles at the bar also went down well! Tea-making facilities are not automatically provided in the rooms but are available on request at no charge - they arrived quickly, but it took a couple of days to establish the 'process' to refresh supplies reliably... hardly a catastophe though! Free wireless internet access was a nice touch and very useful, and there was a good size room safe. The location was great - I had heard that the area around Termini was not too hot, but in seven nights there (including one unseemly 3am stagger back from the Pantheon) I never saw anything or anyone which gave me the slightest cause for concern. Hotel Canada is north of Termini and I'm lead to understand the area south of the station is 'worse' - whatever the case, the area immediately around the hotel, and between the hotel and the station, is fine. While Termini is certainly not central to the major sights, it is the only place where both underground Metro lines cross and is a five minute walk (10 minute stroll) from Hotel Canada. From Termini the Metro (16 euros for a 7 day pass, including busses) will get you within about 15 mins of all the key sights - the Metro can be very busy but if you've been to London it's no worse, and at least it's smaller and simple to understand! Termini also has a great Eurostar link to Naples (something like 90 mins and 36 euros) which we used to get to Pompei, and the same train in the opposite direction will take you to Florence for the same price and similar time. It also has a direct rail link to Fiumicino airport (about 30 mins, 22 euros (taxi would be 50 euros)). In the week I was there I didn't need to use (the apparently pretty suspect) taxis once, and being so close to Termini made getting anywhere, both within and outside Rome, easy. More generally in Rome there are a tedious number of street vendors trying to sell you crap (they switch from sunglasses to umbrellas in the blink of an eye at the first sight of rain - actually quite remarkable!). While I did not see/hear of any pick-pocketing activity while I was there I understand it is rife, and you do see some strange characters on the trains sometimes. The secret I think is to look like you're conscious of what's going on around you and that you have any valuables/bags under close observation - and to be very direct if approached by anyone you don't like the look of. The vast majority of Romans though are friendly and happy to help out if you're stuck - it's a wonderful place and I'm looking forward to going back already. When I do, I will certainly stay at Hotel Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: U262554
Reviews.Content: This is my first Tripadvisor review - just wanted to contribute because I've been consulting TA for several years now and wouldn't stay anywhere without checking here first. My wife and I stayed at the Best Western Canada for 6 nights in February during our first overseas vacation (we're from the U.S. near NYC). I want to testify to the pages and pages of satisfied reviewers. We too thought the hotel was terrific for the same reasons - nice room and bathroom, tastefully decorated, spotlessly clean, nice breakfast, friendly staff, and fantastic location near Termini and subway. I would definitely stay there again. I would like to give some perspective to my 5-star rating. This hotel is rated as a Class-3 based on some independent scale of hotel amenities. Are there posher hotels in Rome? Sure. My opinion (and others too I think) is that it's a 5-star Class-3. I'm a value shopper so here were my reasons for booking based on the previous reviews that I had consulted. Number one was a very fair price (at least off-season when I went - $130 euro per night). Number two was location. My wife and I are public transit people (as opposed to cab people) and don't mind, even expect, and mostly enjoy a healthy degree of walking (which of course fits right into my value shopper bent). So my intent was to take the train from Fiumicino Airport to Termini Station ($11 euro each) and then the subway one stop to hotel ($4 euro each day pass). I'm happy to report that this worked out perfectly and that the hotel is one block from the Castro Pretoria station on the B-Line. The Rome subway system is comprised of 2 lines that intersect at Termini so for my money the hotel couldn't be in a more perfect location. That said if money were no object at all are there better locations to stay in Rome (near Spanish Steps, etc.)? Well, maybe - but if money is a consideration and/or you intend to do public transit then I don't think that there could possibly be a better hotel in Rome than this one. If you've been to New York City it would be like staying in a nice hotel near Penn Station instead of uptown on Fifth Ave. Rome was fantastic. First thing we did after checking in was to return to Termini and purchase a RomaPass (south side of Termini at street level). Next thing was to take the TrambusOpen hop-on hop-off from Termini (we never got off) - it was a great way to get a 2 1/2 hour overview of the city (about $15 euro each). We took a day trip to Florence via TrenItalia train from Termini. Random thoughts...Never felt unsafe anywhere (but use a money belt). We enjoyed every place we ate. Fantastic pizza to go around the corner near the subway (Pizza Rustica) - stopped for a slice every night on way back to hotel whether I was hungry or not. Use Google maps to plan out your itinerary and check out the street-view tool - I knew what our walk to the hotel looked like before we even got to Italy. Hotel bar prices very modest - had a nightcap every night. If this sounds like your kind of place then don't think twice. Grazie, Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WexfordTheresa
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at this hotel last week and it was a total pleasure. The room was very comfortable, quiet, spotlessly clean and well equipped. It's convenient for the Termini (less than 10 minutes stroll) with lots of nice and reasonably priced restaurants close by.The staff are helpful and welcoming and the breakfast is fantastic and will set you up for a day pounding the cobbled streets of Rome, I especially enjoyed the olive rolls and delicious custard croissants.Prices at the bar were much better than most hotels with the charming Edwin providing great service and yummy complimentary snacks. I can highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: katiemarg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really went out on a limb when we booked this hotel. It's in the Termini section of Rome, which we had heard nothing but bad things about. But the price was good, it was near the train station, and we only needed it for one night before we caught our flight back to the States. What a pleasant surprise it was in person! The hotel itself is beautiful inside, the English-speaking staff polite and helpful, and the location is great. We never felt unsafe, even when we went out for dinner after dark (though we didn't venture too far). Each room appears to be unique, and ours was very beautifully decorated with a painted ceiling. The bathroom was enormous and appeared to be newly renovated. A HUGE breakfast spread was included in the room price, and served in a delightful breakfast room. And on top of all that, FREE internet! (Nothing in Rome is free, least of all Internet). We had almost wished that we stayed here the whole time, because the price was quite a bit less than what we had paid the rest of the week. The only downfalls I can think of is that you will have to take public transportation of some sort to get to the major sights, there is some traffic noise, and it may or may not be less safe in peak season (we were there off peak). But other than that, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Try not to get room 134!”
Reviews.Author: laneck
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located from the Termini train station (about 5 blocks away) and it has a really good breakfast service (try the chocolate-filled croissant!). The rooms were large, clean and the staff were incredibly helpful. Unfortunately, the room we stayed in (room 134) was probably one of the noisiest rooms I've ever stayed in. I don't know if it was because the room is located at the beginning of the corridor or not, but we heard everything, including the person sneezing next door! Also, there are several steps leading into the hotel and several steps leading up to the lift, so if you have problems with steps and/or are disabled, this could be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Style and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetic_Engineer
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through Tripadvisor and I was not disappointed. The building is an old villa and has kept its old world style. There are painted designs on the ceilings and an elevator that takes you back in time. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are spotless. While there is no restaurant, they have a full hot breakfast buffet in the morning and snacks at the bar in the evening. The hotel is located near a metro stop and the train terminal. Rome University is also close by. There are several good restaurants nearby. I would stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Characteristic & immaculate with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: PinkFloydCambridge
Reviews.Content: We are not easily pleased but really couldn't find fault with this hotel in any way whatsoever. I e-mailed the hotel and explained our stay was a romantic trip to celebrate being together for 3 years and asked if we could have a romantic room on a high floor with a good view. We got all three! I think they upgraded us to a junior suite because we had a beautiful large room with a seating area too. The decor in the whole hotel was in immaculate order with some really lovely original features, like the old style lift. Everywhere was spotlessly clean. The staff could not have been more professional, friendly and extremely helpful. The gents on reception were always willing to share their knowledge with you on the best way to get to any particular attraction and anything else you may need to ask them. The hotel wasn't in the smartest looking area, hence the price, but it was extremely well located with just a 5 minute walk to Termini Rail and Bus Station. This meant we were close to the Metro and the Buses which were very frequent, cheap and a very efficient way to get to any part of the city. Bus numbers 40 and 64 take you to the majority of the attractions on the main roads through the centre. We got a 'Terravision' bus to and from Ciampino airport which took 30 to 40 minutes. It cost 24 Euros for two of us return when we booked it Online and I would highly recommend it as again, it is quick, efficient and easy! It picks you up right outside the airport arrivals area and drops you off at the Termini, just a 5 minute walk to the hotel. I must mention one restaurant but I'm a little hesitant to as I'd like to keep this hidden little gem a secret! It is the L'Archetto in Via Germanico, a road just round the corner from the Trevi fountain. The staff are really friendly and the past is really fresh and tasty. It's magnifico! There must be around 40 pasta dishes to choose from as well as pizzas and various meat dishes. The menu is really extensive but I would highly recommend a trio of pastas where you have three different pastas of your choice (or the chef's choice if you ask him). It isn't a really heavy dish but very tasty and a wonderful way to try different pastas and flavours. The house wine is very good too. We had 2 starters, 2 main courses, a litre of house white and a coffee and it came to 52 euros which beleive me is very reasonable in Rome for such excellent quality. It is a very typically Italian restaurant, small and cosy. One tip on the trips, we purchased an 'Audio Tour' for the Collosseum, Pallatine Area and the Roman Forum for 6 Euros. You have your own telephone looking device and a map and when you get to each point, you tap in the relevant number and it tells you all about that section as well as the overall history. We thought this was great as we could go at our own pace and learn as much or as little as we wanted to. It's very reasonable too. We hope your trip is as good as ours! Gill & Rich There was a really good selection in the beautiful light and airy breakfast room including juice, tea, fantastic coffee, cereals, fruit, yoghurt, delicious pastries, toast and jam / marmalade, cold meats, cheese, hot egg omelette / scrambled eggs and bacon. On our last day, we were touring the Collosseum from 9-30am to 12-30am so they happily allowed to stay on in our room until 2pm at no extra charge which meant we could freshen up before spending a leisurely afternoon in one of the beatuiful piazzas sipping wine, eating pasta and taking in all the street performers, artists and people watching! A perfect end to a perfect trip which we packed so much in to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation”
Reviews.Author: mrsH69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Canada on a weekend break for my son's 21st birthday. We had a good sized family room which was spotlessly clean. Cannot fault the service from checking in, breakfast service and bar service. Breakfast typically continental but hot bacon and eggs available to. Have stayed at other hotels in the Termini area which we were quite happy with but would definitly stay here again. Also took the Angels and Demons tour whilst here this weekend which was great fun and extremely informative with historical facts highlighted in between the fiction of Dan Brown's best seller.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: novick
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed for 4 nights in the Best Western Canada. It was our first visit to Rome and we wanted to see as much as possible during our stay. Our room was spacious, clean, comfortable and stylish. The breakfast was delicious with all kinds of Italian treats. The staff in the breakfast room were warm and friendly and seemed to enjoy being cheerful and hospitable to all the guests. The lobby was small, but intimate, and Edwin was a personable barkeeper who made wonderful coffees and drinks. The Best Western Canada was conveniently located near a subway stop (Pretorio), the main train station (Termini) and several bus stops. The rooms were well insulated and thus very quiet. What I liked the most about the hotel was the friendly and personal advice given by Vincenzo and Gianfranco at the front desk. It was a joy to begin and end each day with a chat with these two gentlemen! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a convenient location where service and good hospitality are important. I was very sorry to leave the place on our day of departure. Nancy Novick The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: Gab577
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on the reviews of others on this site. As outlined previously, it seems very high quality for its star rating. The rooms are stylish and very clean. The bar area is nice, with drinks well priced and free snacks put out early evening. The staff were friendly and the breakfast is excellent. The area is a bit run down, but it is well placed for tube / bus or taxi. There are a number of good trattoria within a minute's walk of the hotel. We stayed for 4 days and would stay again without hesitation. Thanks to those who gave detailed reviews as it helped us choose this great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Roman Masterpiece”
Reviews.Author: DisneyParis
Reviews.Content: Dates of Stay: 18 January - 19 January (1 night) Room 424 Lots of antiques-terra cotta tiled floor-spacious room 2 nice beds-ample outlets TV with many channels in several languages 2 windows (corner room I think) 1 great view 1 ok nice bathroom-with tub/shower lots of amenities-just perfect armoire with plenty of space to hang clothes and large safe We had to leave very early so they gave us a "special breakfast" which included 2 oranges, 2 apples, chocalate croissants, coffee/tea-all included in price...we blew the circuit breaker when we plugged the kettle in the bedroom-had to go downstairs at 5:30 to get desk guy to reset electric box-he came with me and had it all ok in less than 5 minutes-kettle worked in bathroom without blowing fuse!--would love to try their regular breakfast and will next time since it will be a stay for more than one night. They gave me a superior room for 102 euros prepaid rate on the Best Western site. Fantastic service-everyone very friendly and professional. 2 great restaurants nearby- a pizzeria where you walk down stairs to access and a large restaurant with a very large menu on the corner. Hotel 1 block from subway stop which will get you most anywhere in Rome-change at Termini for Vatican. We boubht a 24 hour pass, but it's really a day pass as it did not work the next morning even though we bought it the prior afternoon!! Nice, quiet safe area of Rome away from the tourists-about a 500 m walk to the train station. Great direct non stop train from there to main Rome airport. We only stayed in Rome because we had an early flight out in the morning but will return for a longer stay. The first time I went to Rome, I stayed just across the river on the Vatican side at the Hotel Diplomatic. This one was much nicer and had more restaurants (and the subway) in close vicinity. With the fantastic service at the great price, why stay anywhere else in Rome?

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location, breakfast and staff”
Reviews.Author: CMfreqtrav
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed BW Hotel Canada for 3 nights. Stayed in their larger room with two adults and two teenagers. We spent very little time in the room as we were constantly out sightseeing, dining, walking, etc. When we were all back at the hotel, the lobby and adjoining "living rooms" were very enjoyable places to relax with a large TV, good book and magazine selection and a friendly bar. Staff was always very helpful whether it was a key locked in the room, directions, or efficient check-in and out. Lastly, breakfast was excellent. The four us us always left well fed and rarely ate more than a snack for lunch because of the great BW breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: TimandDenise
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our honeymoon. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. It is just a few blocks from the main train station (Termini). The breakfast was good compared to the Best Westerns we stayed at in Venice and Florence. The hotel has a bar which we also enjoyed very much. We ended each day with a cocktail or cappuccino. It was a quiet atmosphere and good place to unwind. All the staff we came in contact with were very friendly and nice.

Reviews.Title: “4 star quality”
Reviews.Author: TezR
Reviews.Content: As with many others, we chose this hotel after researching Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. We can only reiterate what others have said: friendly staff: good sized, clean rooms: excellent breakfast with a huge choice; nice, quiet bar area with very reasonable prices (and cappucinos that were heavenly after a day of walking) and a good location near to Termini and metro. We visited in the 'quiet' season and stayed in room 412. A lovely room with period furniture, but being close to the lift, it may be a bit noisy when the hotel is busy. On rainy days (yes, it does rain in Rome!) reception offered us the loan of umberellas (a nice touch). A good range of restaurants are within easy walking distance. We love walking around the places we visit to soak up the atmosphere and see all those quirky little places that you miss out on on 'official' tours but, if you need good transport, then the metro is almost on your doorstep and can get you reasonably close to all the main sites (Vatican, Colloseum, Forum, Cathedral -- San Giavanni in Laterano). Apart from the area of the Domus Aurea, we felt safe when walking around.... (Our guide book did say that Domus Aurea was a place best avoided after dark!) Anyway, all in all, we had a great time and our special thanks to Vincenzo and Massimo. I'm sure we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tampa33629
Reviews.Content: Booked a week at this hotel after reading other reviews on Trip Advisor. Pictures don't do it justice and what a great deal. Close to Termini station so we walked to hotel from station. Rooms were very very nice and quiet. Very nicely decorated and I truly believe this is a 4-star European hotel. Great breakfast in AM, huge bathroom, and windows that opened up to see city. We booked deluxe quality room. I love Trip Advisor and thanks for recommending this hotel. One of the best European experiences we had.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: TexasChemE
Reviews.Content: I would agree with the other reviews here - the hotel is reasonably priced and very nice. It was one of the few hotels which had rooms for 4 people which we needed. The staff were great in helping us get around, in particular with local restaurant recommendations. The location was great with a metro stop within 50 meters of the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Another 5* for this superb hotel!”
Reviews.Author: maldrich
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review for TripAdvisor before but the quality of this hotel inspired us to do so. The staff were brilliant - all extremely pleasant & obliging. Our family quad room on the 5th floor was lovely - good size, beautiful big bed and drapes and no problems with noise. The snacks at the bar (and toasted sandwiches) were very welcomed by the kids and the small pizza restaurant down the road was ideal for evening meals. The hotel really enhanced our stay and its closeness to the Metro was a real bonus. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jon_Mendel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel is in a good location -- easy to walk to station, but far enough away to give the feel of a better quality location. The hotel was very quiet, so I slept well. My room was compact, with a mixture of "old" furniture with modern fittings (eg new flat screen TV). It had a bath tub which I appreciated. The room had an excellent safe (although it took me a while to find it behind a painting!) The hotel is very near many restaurants. One night when I popped out for dinner it was raining and the hotel loaned nice umbrellas to guests. The staff at reception were always professional and helpful. The staff in the bar were particularly friendly and free snacks were offered to patrons. The price of drinks in the bar were reasonable. The hotel has free Wireless internet connection (you get your password from reception). Officially the hotel is three stars, but it was superior to many of the four star hotels I stayed in while travelling around Italy. It was not cheap (A$278 a night) in high season, but I can certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Other readers were right--a great place”
Reviews.Author: JorgeB
Reviews.Content: Everything everybody else said about this place was correct. The hotel is excellent, comfortable, clean, pleasant, and low-key. The snacks in the afternoon and evening are a nice touch, and the lounge to eat them in is comfortable and pleasant. The room we had was a very reasonable size, and in the off-season, a bargain at less than 100 Euros a night. Oh and the breakfast buffet is also top-notch; you can eat enough here to skip lunch if you were so inclined (but why would you? you are in Rome after all). The only very minor thing I found lacking is that there was no fridge in the room. The neighborhood is not full of interesting sights, but nonetheless perfectly agreeable, with a number of delicious and inexpensive trattorie around the corner (even the slightly grimy looking "pizza del seculo" on the next corner from the hotel actually turns out some of the most delicious pizza I have ever eaten!). Plus the location is really incredibly convenient given the metro station just a few steps away. Also, the proximity of Termini station--either one metro stop or a few minutes' walking--is great because you can get a train or bus to literally anywhere from there. All in all, an excellent choice. And just to reiterate, the hotel looks and feels 100% Italian--it has nothing to do with Canada other than the name!

Reviews.Title: “Best 3 stars I've already seen”
Reviews.Author: EduBrazil
Reviews.Content: It was our honeymoon. We arrived from Paris on fiumicino and took the bus to Termini and walked to the hotel. Ten minutes of walking. The taxi drivers on Termini are terrible, keep away from them. The ride would cost 40 E!!! It was raining and the prices rised. We just waited a little for stop raining. It was an excellent surprise the kindness of our reception. I made the reservation on the hotel website and told them about the marriage. The room was terrific and there was champagne and chocolates waiting for us. The location is very good. Near the trains, buses (on termini and on the next block), metro (100 m). It was very easy to know the city, mainly by metro. We bought a special pass valid for 3 days and used buses and metro. Bus is better because rome is beautiful and nedd to be known. We visited everything: Fontana di trevi, piazza navona, di Spagna, Coliseum, Vaticano, Tibre, Panteon, etc. Use buses and metro. You don't need taxis. Italy's very beautiful but is very expensive. Watch out for your money. A couple in Rome spends ~ 250/300 E per day, including the hotel. Lesser than Paris and MUCH LESSER than Venice. We'd stay again in this Hotel. It's perfect for a couple.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL WITH 3* RATING BUT 5*TREATMENT”
Reviews.Author: sussextraveller8
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel above its three star rating. Our room was very well decorated with a spacious bathroom. We asked for tea making facilities on arrival and asked daily for milk which was plentiful and bought to our room. Everywhere was spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated. The staff were all so helpful and professional. Clean towels were given every day. Breakfast was excellent with lots of choice buffet style but waitresses served tea and coffee which was re-filled with smiles! The bar served lovely little nibbles each evening and drink and sandwich prices were very reasonable. The hotel is an excellent choice for exploring Rome with the Metro stop around the corner two minutes walk. Buy a ticket for a few days travel and just hop on and off at the right stop -all so easy! We stayed in a non-smoking room and it was very quiet. Just out of the hotel are various cafes and restaurants all so convenient. We hope to return and would definitely stay here again. Jane and Peter Brooke U.K.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near Termini”
Reviews.Author: libtravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights following a cruise. Excellent hotel. The room was clean and relatively spacious for a european hotel. New TV, bathroon was good (tub/shower plus good hot water). Fantastic breakfast offered. Everything from cold cereal, toast, yogurt, fruit, pastries and cold cuts to hot entres like frittata, bacon, eggs and hard boiled eggs. Staff was friendly and arranged transportation to the airport for us. Free internet and appies in the lounge in the afternoon. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mickeybrit
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this updated 130-year-old gem. Delightfully decorated room with painted ceiling, marvellous buffet breakfast, afternoon tea and evening bar. Near Metro, Termini Station, buses and lots of Trattorria.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: msmith
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay, 3 nights, traveling with 3 other couples. We were all super satisfied with our rooms, hotel location and reception check in. The bathrooms were fantastic with lots of nice sundries supplied. The beds were comfortable and there were extra pillows and blankets if needed. We arrived early, our rooms were not ready, but they took our luggage and kept it in a secure room. When we returned later in the day, our bags had been moved into our rooms. Internet was included, a safe was in the room, if you don't see it ask, it is hidden! Breakfast was fantastic with a variety of egg dishes, meats and cheese, fruit, cereal, pastries and breads. It was the best breakfast set up of all the hotels we stayed at. Around 6 oclock there were snacks, cookies, meats, cheese, nuts etc set up in the lounge area. It was so nice to come back after a day of touring and sit and talk, sip wine and have a snack before dinner. There was also wine tasting! We were given suggestions of places for dinner, and one was a real good choice, about a block away. We could walk to the train station where we could also get the metro and the hop on hop off bus. The reception staff was amiable and spoke excellent English. There was always someone there to help, order taxi, or make arrangements for transportation to the airport. Umbrellas were also available for a rainy day! Nice hotel..very happy with choice!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury for 3 star rating”
Reviews.Author: quickpacker
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in Rome and chose this hotel based on other reviews from this site. Wow! We were not disappointed. This hotel is 5 star posing as 3 star. We chose an upgraded room, well worth the extra money as it was large, with queen size bed, sitting area, dual aspect views across the city. Housekeeping service excellent, wonderful decor and furnishings (Room 512). Bar service brilliant with free appetisers and on our last night there was free wine (Novello - which is the Italian equivalent of Beaujolais). Bar prices cheap considering it is Rome. Massimo is an extremely polite and endearing Italian barman and hotel assistant. He's always smiling! Concierge service first class - they all speak excellent english and remember you very quickly, having your key ready for you as you approach the desk. Breakfast is good considering the kitchen is quite small. We had a good variety of foods to choose from - something for everyone I would say. Getting out and about from the hotel is easy as it is just across the road from the Metro station - giving you access to historic Rome. We used the tickets you buy at the Metro which give you unlimited access for buses and underground (7 day ticket). Don't forget you need to validate your ticket as you get on the bus by using the machines on board. The best bus to use from the hotel is the 492 which you catch just around the corner from the hotel. It goes all the way to Vatican City (St Peter's Square). Easy bus ride into centre of city as the metro doesn't go that central, the 492 is great for visiting the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, and Pantheon ( a must-see at night when the square is all lit up ). Eating out is great wherever you are in Rome but it does get expensive when you are near the major sites. We chose to eat out near the hotel and loved the 'Taverna Pretoriana' (opposite Mama Angela's) on Via Palestro, a couple of minutes walk from the hotel. It gets very busy with Italian businessmen, families, trourists, etc and has a fabulous atmosphere. Food is very reasonably priced and it is good quality. Some of the other Trattorias close by sell cheaper but poorer quality meals. At Pretoriana you get a free taster of Bruschetta, and a complimentary glass of their own Limoncello - nice touches. A word of warning about 'Terravision' who operate a transfer service to/from airport to Termini rail station - we booked as the reviews from this web site were good. We won't be using them again. Their service on the morning we arrived in Rome was abysmal. There must have been about 200 people waiting for the shuttle buses when we joined the queue. The Terravision Team were very dismissive when asked how long the buses would be. They kept shrugging their shoulders and saying '5 minutes' or '10 minutes' - we waited an hour! The organisation was very poor, and we have since found out that you can actually come out of the arrivals building and pick up an ordinary shuttle bus which costs less than Terravision. Finally, a word about Ciampino Airport - chaos! You queue, and you wait to check in, you queue and wait again to go through security (which takes ages), queue and wait again at Passport Control and hope they have more than one person on duty, then you queue again at the gates and if you are lucky you can get one of the few seats available while you wait again to board the buses to the plane. Watch out for the people who short-change you at the coffee bar once through security. They did it to us and other people who were on our flight. It might have only been a euro each time for us but think how many travellers pass through this area and buy food and drink from them. Nice little scam! Very few people would notice they were short changed as you are easily distracted by other things going on in this area. Check your change before you walk away! Highlights of our holiday - Best Western Hotel Canada, The Sistine Chapel, Trevi Fountain, and the Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: cat15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Hotel Canada following our cruise for 2 nights. We stayed in an upgraded room with a small balcony that overlooked a courtyard. The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is in an area away from most of the tourist stops, but close to the hop on hop off bus stop. We took advantage of this and rode the bus everywhere we needed to go. It was a good deal, enjoyable and a safe way to travel. The area near the hotel is fine and we felt safe wandering around. We liked the internet cafe nearby with reasonable rates and all 3 restaurants we ate at near the hotel were very good.. My only complaint was that the front desk staff are not very friendly or helpful. Everytime I asked a question they appeared annoyed and short with me, which is not very good customer service! We had stayed at the Hotel Antiche figure in Venice before our cruise and the staff at that hotel were fantastic! I guess the Hotel Antiche Figure staff increased our expectations? Despite the unfriendly front desk staff, I would recommend this hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeresaOntarioCanada
Reviews.Content: Having read all the glowing reviews of this hotel at Trip Advisor, we went ahead and booked this hotel for 5 nights. We were very happy that we did. The price was reasonable for Europe and the hotel really was the nicest we stayed at during this vacation in this price range. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was always kept spotless, the breakfast was very good - warm food too - this we later found was not the norm in Italy. The location was good for us as we took the train to Venice after our 5 days in Rome were up...it's about a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel, so easy to do. There are a few reasonably-priced restaurants close by - we ate at the one just down the street - fantastic pizza! Being from Canada, we were curious as to why this hotel was named BW Hotel Canada...and we were told that the owner did indeed spend about 14 years in Canada, gradually buying up units in the building till he had acquired most of the building and then opened up the hotel. We would definitely stay here again if (hopefully in the not too distant future) we are fortunate to be able to come to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anniepotts66
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this lovely quaint Hotel in Rome. Very clean, rooms of a considerable standard in size. Edwin the bartender was always accommodating - supplying us with endless goodies while we shared a drink at the Hotels Bar. This hotel was ideal in its proximity to local transport - train station only a short walk away. Would recommend it to anyone wishing to stay in Rome! Thank you,

Reviews.Title: “roman holiday”
Reviews.Author: Anna666England
Reviews.Content: This is a very pleasant place to stay, quiet & comfortable. The buffet breakfast is excellent with a good selection of hot & cold dishes. Although evening meals are not served we found good places to eat nearby. Staff are very approachable, pleasant & efficient. Our room was nicely decorated, not the usual bland effect. Everything was very clean & spacious. The location is good as there is a metro station opposite or a short walk to Termini, where trains, metro or buses can be found.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rightboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The BW Hotel Canada for 3 nights in late September. We were extremely pleased with the cleanliness of the entire property, the friendliness of the staff and the size of both the bedroom and the bathroom. There are numerous small cafes and restaurants within a 3 block walk serving very good medium priced meals. The train station is an easy 8 minute walk away. We are walkers, but I would not say that the historic sites are an easy walk away; however both bus and metro are very close by and provide good service to all historic sites. It certainly made good sense to us to pay about $150 less per night to stay at The Hotel Canada vs. hotels in the historic center and then use quick and easy mass transit to get around the city. This hotel provides excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect companion to a great city!!!”
Reviews.Author: Palsoftravel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in something of a hurry, having left it a little late to book for our holiday. We booked it through air-miles (would be decent value for money generally anyway), and were pleased with the reviews on this web-site. However, there was a hint of nerves as we have had variable experiences of Best Western hotels in the UK. It turned out to be a perfect choice for us, and it was great to have such a lovely base for several days of tiring, but massively fulfilling, walking around this amazing city. I can only speak in very positive terms about this hotel. The hotel, generally, felt very classy, very well furnished, and full of lovely little touches (e.g. antique looking desk in room, shoe polishing kit in wardrobe). The room was a good size and very well presented. We had read another review of issues with the lift in the hotel being too small etc. With respect, I think the reviewer missed the point somewhat as the lift is a wonderful addition to the hotel, and has a charm of its own. Staff at the hotel were very polite and very helpful, any requests were dealt with quickly even if busy. Breakfast was very good, a good selection of options to fill you up for your day of walking, including hot food which is always welcome. Get there early though, as it become very busy after 7.30-45am and its not the biggest breakfast room. Location is excellent, easily located within 5 minutes walk of termini station (its right at the far end of Via Vicenza) and Termini is a helpful compass point to find your way back to the hotel from wherever you are in the city. In terms of the other areas of interest, the hotel is no more than 20-30 minutes walk from most attractions. The Vatican is a longer walk, and we caught the Metro/Underground (very easy) from Termini to the Vatican (awesome place!) as we wanted to be there early to avoid the queues. A lovely stay in a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome Hotel - Close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: hall999
Reviews.Content: You will love this hotel. The hotel is not far from the termini where you can catch the metro or a bus to just about anywhere you want to go. There are lots of local eateries with very good food. The free breakfast has everything you could want and coffee is excellent. Our room was spacious, modern and clean with a balcony on a shared courtyard. The staff was very helpful and we had no language problems. I would deifnitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Yarra1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very convenient location and is good value for money compared to others in the vicinity. It is very clean and well maintained. Breakfast was very good with a wider range than most Italian hotels. (Be careful asking for a cappucino though..my wife got one under sufferance, but I was not so lucky!) Our room was well appointed and the bathroom very clean. The only problem we had was that the mattresses were quite uncomfortable and ready for retirement I suspect! Apart from this we were very happy with Hotel Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Mollyhandsome
Reviews.Content: This hotel we found thanks to Trip Advisor and our stay was outstanding! Our room was spotless and huge for Europe or America for that matter with a separate room with a desk and a love seat. The bath was large as well stocked with every toiletrie you can imagine...even slippers! We had a small balcony overlooking a courtyard also nice for fresh air and to check the weather before heading out. The hot breakfast was yummy and really something for everyone. A great way to start a day of sight seeing! We also orderd " free "room service of toasted sandwiches and really good gelato one late afternoon when we had a late tour. The best prices in town... and so good! Be sure to go see the 3 to 11 bartender Massamo he will take really good care of you! They also have slices of sandwiches and chips and really good cookies set up, a nice surprise after a really long day of sight seeing! Now for the best Rome tip I can give you...buy Rick Steve's Rome book and follow it to the letter! This book was worth its weight in gold! You will also see 500 other folks that are not over on a tour with this book, I have them all but this one really broke it down! Have a great trip and Thanks Hotel Canada folks who wrote and Hotel Canada for an excellent stay !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: milktray
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend break 19th September 2008 based on tripadvisor reviews. Can only agree with the majority opinion. Very well run hotel,friendly and helpful staff. Not in a great part of town but with the Metro Castro Pretorio just around the corner and Termini an easy ten minute walk away makes for an excellent base for exploring Rome. Prices for drinks in the hotel bar were very reasonable and the bar is a very pleasant place to relax. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a very large selection. Our room whilst not that large was very clean and comfortable. The air conditioning worked well. The hotel provides free wifi access which was fast and never dropped. The double glazing was extremely effective in keeping out the street noise. Will definitely return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome Experience”
Reviews.Author: bsmith408
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Canada in Rome for three nights. We were three adults and one child. This hotel was excellent. It is well maintained and beautifully decorated. The price is very reasonable considering the experience. We had a suite with queen size bed and a covertible sofa. The room had AC, flat screen TV, and a bathroom with granite countertops. The staff was very helpful. The breakfast was great. We were able to park directly in front of the hotel entrance for the entire time, we just had to put 11 euros in the meter each day (there is no hotel parking). The bartender, reception and breakfast room staff was all so nice. Prices for drinks at the bar are cheap by Rome standards. The hotel is one block from the blue train line which takes you directly to the colosseum or the main train station for transfers to the red line and the other tourist sites. The neighborhood is nice. The local restaurants are not so great, I would recommend going into the city for the restaurants. I would definitely stay here again, it was a big part of our great holiday in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location & very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: smiglani
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the end of July. Just a few blocks from the termini and about a block away from the local metro, this hotel is located in a convenient area of Rome. The staff was very friendly and helped us pick out the main sites to view in our short time there and forms of transportation. The room was big and cozy. There were 3 of us so we got a queen bed and one single. The bathroom had all the amenities and was also really big. They had the lift you see in the movies where u have to close the double doors before the lift goes up, very cute. The hotel offers a buffet breakfast, which is free for all guests. Probably one of the best buffet breakfasts i've been too with a great selection of food. All in all, our stay at the Best Western Hotel Canada was amazing. From the friendly staff to the location, everything was great. Rome is a place i would like to visit again and again, and when we come back, we would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient and Nice Welcome”
Reviews.Author: MmePeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this summer during the first leg of our holiday as we wanted a good secure and safe base for a family so we could see all the major sites in Rome with ease but without a very high cost. The hotel is about 500m from Termini and as we arrived in Ciampino we took the express bus direct to the station and made the short walk to the Hotel. There is a metro station just behind the hotel so its easy to get around and there are also some convenience shops nearby in caee you need anything. The staff are very welcoming and the rooms are well maintained and have a very traditional style. We stayed in a family room and there was plenty of room and the bathroom was very nice. The bar is very friendly and comfortable but unfortunately there is no restaurant. In the local area there are quite a few nice restaurants though and although the streets are not particularly typical of the clasical parts of Rome the food is excellent. I recommend the resaurant 2 doors down from the hotel which was great for a quick bite to eat and the food was great. The breakfast is very nice and the dining room was very light and comfortable. Only slight criticism would be that some days there did not seem to be enough staff and so you had to wait a long time to get a cup of tea or coffee. But overall a very pleasant stay at Hotel Canada Overall

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: roxy2177
Reviews.Content: I loved hotel canada. the service was great. the rooms were very nice. and the breakfast was delicious. Its a few blocks from termini and there is a subway stop right around the corner. there are several places to rent scooters around the hotel as well as many restaurants and cafes. I did not take pictures because the pictures online are acurate. One tip is DO NOT exchange money at any of those little exchange places around rome. you are better off using your credit card. The cards get a much better rate and even if there is a fee is not as high as the fees charged by the exchange booths. they charge us 17% and when I told her I didn't want to exchange she refused to give me my dollars back... well that has nothing to do with Hotel Canada but just a warning.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaiser_8
Reviews.Content: We (three young middle aged couples) stayed at hotel Canada for 5 days recently and had a great stay. The rooms were large, comfortable and clean compared to other european capital city hotels. The bar drinks are cheap and free nibbles were a nice touch before seeing Rome by night. The breakfast provided was more than enough to keep you going through the morning sightseeing. Everyone of the staff were very helpful and friendley and we would certainly return to this hotel. The hotel is close to the main rail station and the metro is just around the corner. The area is abit run down but we never felt any unease walking about. Be careful of pickpockets on the metro we had a camera stolen from right under our noses.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY! CLEAN and PERFECT LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: blackberrypie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel two separate nights, a week apart. Each stay was great. The rooms were clean. The breakfast in the morning was wonderful. The staff was friendly. The hotel is just a few blocks from Termini Station also the subway line around the corner, which made it a great central location to travel around Rome from. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant choice”
Reviews.Author: lindylouVirginia
Reviews.Content: My husband, teen daughter, and I stayed at the Hotel Canada based on other message board recommendations. This hotel lived up to my expectations from the other reviewers and I was not disappointed. The rooms, reception area, and breakfast area were comfortable, clean, nice. The location is not right centrally located but we were able to taxis to any city location. We dined at a great restaurant 1/2 block away on our last night. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice near the subway”
Reviews.Author: dmorcareers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel for three nights. First in room 308 and then in room 208. Both rooms were great. The 208 was more modern and had been renovated recently. The room was spacious and the bathroom lovely. Very large closet and there was a safe in the room. The room 308 was for three people and very traditional in design with alot of wood accents. The room was lovely and the bathroom very nice. The hotel is very clean with modern facilities. We have stayed in about 6 hotels in Rome (from four star to six star) in the last 10 years and this one was among the best. You can't beat the price of the hotel. The breakfast was lovely and the there were some choices for vegetarians. There is a lovely selection of snacks at the bar every day at 5:00pm and the bar area is quite nice for drinks also. The staff were very nice. For example I mentioned that I would like to purchase the tea cup and saucer (It said Hotel Canada) as I collect them and I thought it was so pretty. The next day I had a box in my room as a gift with a cup and saucer. How nice is that???? I was so surprised. Overall the location is far from the historical sites and we took the subway and taxi's alot. We walked also an incredible amount but we knew when it was time to take a taxi. The most expensive cab ride was 10 euros and we were about 20 minutes away from the hotel. Overall I was so pleased with the hotel and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!!”
Reviews.Author: Thrillrider
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Hotel Canada was a great pick for our two night stay in Rome. It is spotlessly clean, the room was quite large (for European standards), air conditioning worked great, good breakfast and convenient location to both Termini station and subway station literally right around corner. Area around hotel seemed fine, with plenty of restaurants, etc. Highly recommended, and price seemed totally reasonable for summer accomodations in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: cobbia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights and found the hotel to the best I have ever stayed in. We had booked a standard double room and asked to be on a high floor. When we arrived we were shown to the 5th floor and given a four poster bedroom. The room was large, well presented, clean, tidy and much beyond what I had been expecting. Breakfast was advertised as continental, but as well as the usual continental selections there was warm bacon and scrambled eggs, which gave a much needed energy boost to survive 5 days sightseeing in Rome. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from Termini railway station, where you can also catch the underground and buses.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room”
Reviews.Author: 60sAussiecouple
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights in early July, having checked it out on TripAdvisor and booked through Best Western's website. The hotel was rather expensive, but perhaps not by Rome's standards. We chose it partly because of its proximity to the railway station. In fact it is a fair walk, being right at the end of Via Vicentia. The area is quite pleasant and there are plenty of restaurants in nearby streets and a good laundromat around the corner with Internet access. Our room was quite spacious, likewise the bathroom, and the air conditioning coped with some very hot weather. The room had a tiled floor and was very clean and reasonably equipped (but no fridge). Probably high in the three-star range. But our advice would be to try not to visit Rome after mid June. It's just too darned hot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CarlysGamma
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canada is a great Rome Hotel for the budget minded. Yes, it costs 147 Euro, but it is worth every penny. The rooms are good sized, as are the bathrooms. The elevator is small (but that is normal for Europe). The breakfast is the best we had in Italy: Scrambled Eggs, Meats, Cheeses, Yogurt, Fresh & canned fruit, bread and toast, Cereals, breakfast cakes, water and juices. Coffe and Hot milk are brought to your table once you sit down. The front desk personnel are very helpful, and there is internet access (you just have to get a password from front desk). They also have a bar with afternoon "happy hour" treats. The hotel is in the Termini area, and easily walkable from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, modern hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Earthtourist68
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Canada to be very clean, modern, and had some nice touches like an afternoon bar with snacks, European elevator car, and great air conditioning! Definitely would stay here again and it's very close to the metro subway stop.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Billyholiday
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in June had a great time. Staff were charming ,courteous and helpful. Room was to a high standard of cleanliness & furnishings. Breakfast was splendid with many choices on offer. The Bar staff were friendly and helpful. Can't wait to return. We have stayed in Rome twice before and this is the best yet.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: thbucu
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Rome and I selected the hotel on the basis of the Tripadvisor reviews and found it much as advertised. Booked from the hotel website a few months in advance (just before the room type sold out). Liked the location within walking distance of Termini which was very convenient for airport transfer and local bus travel. Used the metro around the corner for going across town to the Vatican, tho this station seemed a little deserted at times. It is otherwise not an easy walking distance from too many other places but on a quieter street. The room was pleasant and quite satisfactory in terms of space and cleanliness. The bathroom was very nice indeed. The balcony looked in to a central courtyard and we ended up keeping the doors shuttered most of the time. Wireless internet access from the room was free though not well advertised so you have to ignore the price menu on the web page; just go to reception with your passport to obtain the password. The only problem was that in order to plug in the computer at the desk, we had to unplug everything else at the desk, namely the lamp and the television. Breakfast was an impressive selection. Sometimes you have to wait for a table and nearly always for the coffee but it was very good. Agree with prior reviews that for food, the place on the corner closest to the hotel is to be avoided. The one further up the street on the other side is better. We did not use the bar in the lobby but found a convenience store in Termini station. Would definitely recommend and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: J0123
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at this hotel. I booked it from the recommendations on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed. We booked two rooms, one of which was of the superior type. Both were of a good size the main difference was in the size of the bathroom, the ordinary room having a shower only, and there was an extra bed settee in the superior room. We were on the 5th floor and it was very quiet. The air conditioning worked efficiently (we had a heatwave whilst there!) There was a good supply of toiletries, even down to cotton buds and toothbrushes. The beds were extremely comfortable and everywhere was very clean. Breakfast was buffet style with a very good choice of food from bacon and egg to ham, cheese, fish, fruit and many types of breads. The only criticism was that we had to wait ages for our tea and coffee. The bar in the hotel was very reasonably priced (unusual for a hotel!) and they did toasted sandwiches for 2 euros. Also they served lovely free nibbles during the evening. The barman was really pleasant and helpful. The reception staff were very helpful though they appear rather standoffish to begin with and they could provide information as required and a useful map. There is a room to leave luggage in if you arrive early or depart late. There are plenty of restaurants nearby to choose from so we never had to walk far to be fed! If you want the tea and coffee making facilities you need to ask at reception for them - they are not supplied in every room. The trays are not automatically refurbished each day, you need to ask at reception for extra sachets etc. The hotel is situated about a 10minute walk from Termini, the main railway station where you can catch the A and B line Metro and there is another Metro station just round the corner from the hotel that you can use to get to the Colosseum. The Metro is not that useful for getting around to see the main sights but at present they are constructing a Line C which will connect many of the famous landmarks. Termini is also good for getting one of the open top bus tours round the city, you can pay one price for staying on the bus or another price for using it as a hop on, hop off facility. There is a big taxi rank at Termini or the hotel will order taxis for you. Comfortable, flat shoes are an essential to bring with you! I booked two tours with Presto Tours (having read some reviews about them on TripAdvisor) before we went to Rome. One was for a tour of the Coliseum, the Forum and Ancient Rome and the other was to the Vatican. Both were excellent. We were in small groups (up to 16 people) and the guides were very well informed but with a sense of humour so we were not too bogged down with information! The advantage of the Vatican tour was that this tour company are one of the few that can miss the very long queues (2 hours) to get inside and we had fast track entry which really helped. I would certainly recommend them if you have limited time in Rome and want to make the most of your visit. This was my first trip to Rome and really enjoyed it. I did the touristy thing and threw a coin into the Trevi Fountain so hopefully I'll be returning soon. I would certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The Wonderful Hotel Canada”
Reviews.Author: Global-Travels
Reviews.Content: This property is about as good as they get. The hotel is located a short 10 minute walk from the Rome Termni. The rooms are large (especially when compared to other 3 star hotels in Italy and spotless. Furnishings were in great condition, flat screen TV, spotless and well appointed bathrooms. If breakfast is included in your rate you'll have a choice of eggs, bacon, meats and cheeses, cereals, fruits, and a large selection of breads and rolls. The bar behind the lobby is a price performer, 6 Euros for a bottle of wine (750ML). Light snacks, at the bar, wireless internet access (for a fee), and a PC located near the bar (for a fee). There are 2 Internet cafes on the same street, 4 blocks from the hotel, much cheaper than the hotel's 3rd party internet service provider. The staff was very pleasant and spoke English much better than I speak Italian. There are restaurants all around the hotel. Walking distance to most monuments, Metro station around the corner for those outside of walking distance (beware of the pickpockets, they're all over the Metro and at the larger tourist spots). The desk clerk will happily call a taxi if that's your preferred mode of transportation. 20 Euro taxi ride to the Catacombs, then 10 Euro ride back to the Fountain of Trevi. There are taxi stands and bus stops about 500 meters from the Catacombs, so don't worry about using a tour company to take you there. Ask the desk clerk for a street map. The neighborhood around the Termni and the hotel seems a lot better than it was 4 years ago, cleaner, more police presence, with significantly fewer pan handlers. We weren't bothered by anyone, even when returning to the hotel on foot late at night. I would use this hotel again without hesitation and would recommend it to others staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect base for enjoying Rome”
Reviews.Author: claire0
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned from our 4 day stay in Rome and can't praise this lovely hotel enough! We arrived mid afternoon, having decided to take the train to Termini station from the airport and although it is only a fairly short walk to the hotel we now know that it is even closer to the Castro Pretorio metro located 2 mins round the corner. Access to all the sights is very easy from this metro station and the trains are frequent,clean,air conditioned and far better than what we have to put up with in England. On arrival we were assisted with our baggage to our twin room which was tastefully decorated and furnished to a high standard with thoughtful touches such as a clothes care kit, slippers and even a toothbrush kit together the usual toiletries. Everything seemed to have been considered to ensure a comfortable stay.We were even provided with maps and a free tea and coffee pack was available on request to take up to our room. We went down to the lobby/bar area to plan our evening out and enjoyed a couple of glasses of lovely chilled wine -together with free canapes on offer ,on a help yourself basis, at the side of the bar. Staff were attentive and courteous at all times.The other guests were friendly and there was plenty of chatter going on between the various groups of residents over our drinks. The beds were lovely and firm.There was no noise to disturb our peace, either inside the hotel or on the streets outside,although in the morning when we opened the window we could hear the traffic noise which neither of us minded as it added to the ambience and sounded entirely different to rush hour at home! Breakfast was excellent, bacon,eggs,tomatoes, cheese, ham, cereals, different breads,pastries ,fresh fruit and juices were all available, with tea and coffee brought to the table by a very polite waitress. After the second day of walking around Rome my feet were very sore from shoe rub and the reception staff provided me with plasters for the rest of my stay. Room service was excellent too and our towels and linen were fresh each day. The pizzeria next door is fine if you need to eat closeby and although the immediate vicinity is not as beautiful as other parts of Rome we found it to be safe and friendly. I would have no hesitation in recommending Hotel Canada and would definitely return here on my next trip to Rome. Its a 5 star hotel at a 3 star price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities and location”
Reviews.Author: duesseldorf67
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Canada just a few days ago for 3 nights on our Honeymoon Trip and we were treated well. Apart from a card from the management, champagne and chocolates on arrival in our beautiful room, a great breakfast each morning and excellent quality and variety in bathroom accessories such as shower gels, lotions and potions, the hotel impressed with outstanding cleanliness. Approx. 10min walk from Rome Termini (Central Railway) it was very convenient for us. The staff speak english and nothing was a problem. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. Other than that beware of the pizza/taverna restaurant directly opposite on the corner. Whatever you do, do not go there. The waiters are rude, a mixed salad consists of 6 leaves of lettuce 8 sliced pieces of carrot and one halfed cherry tomato with no dressing for 4 Euros. You have to be kidding! Tourist Trap, beware!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LaurenMLondon
Reviews.Content: We chose this great hotel after reading reviews from Trip Advisor and were pleased we did. The room was quiet as we had a courtyard facing one and it was plenty big enough. We arrived in a downpour and the front desk had a coffee making tray sent up, this was not re-filled though sadly. Breakfast was very varied and plentiful and the bar was welcoming. They do supply lots of bathroom goodies so no worries about packing shower gel, shampoo, body lotion etc. We used to phone in the room to book tickets for Gallery Borghese - go there it is wonderful! and were only charged 50 cents to do so. There is a metro round the corner from the hotel - Pretorio but Termini is in walking distance too. The 492 bus from Tritone goes to just round the corner from Pretorio too. There are several restaurants close by to choose from too. Use the Roma pass if you are there for three days or more as it is great value and saves having to think about train/bus tickets. We ate at La Tavernetta in Via Sistina and if you find yourself outside thinking about going in, keep walking!!! At best you'll have a very poor meal, at worst you'll be well and truly ripped off. We were charged 101 euros for a terrible meal and I left shaking and nearly in tears as the waiter was so horrible to us. Overall Rome is lovely, the sights and the art are worth the visit. But it is very expensive, the people seem to dislike tourists and we were constantly wary of pickpockets, so we probably wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MH0873
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 5 min walk from Termini Station. The rooms are fantastic, very clean and spacious. The hotel itself is great value and competitively priced. The breakfast is plentiful with a wide selection of cereal, meats and fruit etc. The only critisicm would be that the staff on reception were a little grumpy.

Reviews.Title: “Just Excellent”
Reviews.Author: grandme
Reviews.Content: Hi from the USA: My Husband, Sister-in-Law and Brother-in Law stayed 2 nights on April 2 , 2008 at the Best Western Canada in Rome, our stay was excellent. Price,Room, buffet breakfast, location and the people that work there are just excellent. I would tell everyone you would enjoy this hotel. Joan , Bill and family from New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “Grrreat Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TouristNI
Reviews.Content: Grreat Hotel close to Termini Rail Station. Exit station by the Via Marsala exit, cross the road, turn left and the Via Vincenza is the first street on the right, hotel at end of road, only five minute walk. We stayed here for 3 nights in April and thought the hotel was lovely, it is full of character. The staff were friendly and there was a lovely quiet relaxing bar with very reasonable prices. Our room was very comfortable and clean, although there was some traffic noise from the road. There are quite a lot of reasonabley priced restaurants close to the hotel so after a busy day sightseeing you don't need to venture far at all. We were able to walk everywhere although the Metro is nearby although you should make sure that you have comfortable walking shoes. We would stay here again and would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Convenient to Train”
Reviews.Author: patrema
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Canada on two separate trips to Rome. Our main reason for choosing this hotel is its convenience to Termini train station for trips outside the city and also for easy access to the airport train. It is just a few blocks away so it's an easy walk to the station. We appreciate the fact that the rooms are well-maintained, the staff is friendly and they speak English quite well, and the breakfast buffet is good. Room rates are reasonable too. Definitely would recommend the Best Western Hotel Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kelly630
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of the good reviews and we were not disappointed. We are a family of four and the room was a good size (even had a small sitting area). The large bathroom was well stocked and had plenty of towels. The breakfast was good by continental standards.
