The bar was reasonably priced very friendly and the children were very happy with the complimentary snacks. We had a coach transfer from the airport to Termini station and was able to walk the short distance to the hotel. Most sites were walkable but quite often we went on the metro which was two minutes walk away and cost 1 euro to anywhere. Rome was fantastic but be aware of being ripped off both on the streets and in the restaurants. Our only slight complaint was that the room was sometimes warm but we were told that the air conditioning wasn't switched on until May. Overall we totally recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not really great”
Reviews.Author: Lapidus
Reviews.Content: It should be 31/2 stars rather than just three. The hotel was good in several respects. We stayed there recently as a family of 4 with two teenagers. The room was great - large, clean (although somewhat dimly lit) and near the corner of the building so we had some views. Double glazing stopped the traffic noise. What did not work so well was that we struggled to regulate the temperature of the room - it was tightly sealed as a result of the glazing and it got very warm. We were advised that the airconditioning was not turned on until later in the month so we had to have the windows open to cool the room (We had two sick children at this end of the trip) which made the room very noisy - we were woken several times at night by car alarms. We had come to the end of a long trip so were a bit tired and with the kids sick we sought advice on the first night on where to eat locally (we were happy with pizza) and it was spot on. The next night was a different matter. We asked the other receptionist on the second night for suggestions and were directed to a "highly recommended" local pasta restaurant. (The first guy had said there was no local good pasta restaurant) We went anyway but it was very ordinary and filled with people from the hotel! Obviously a kick-back deal rather than a true recommendation. This set up a situation where we could not trust his advice so for everything else we had to go back to our original receptionist for any further advice. While the hotel does have its charms, the service generally did not have the warmth that we had just experienced in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The best three star hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: manzana
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently close to the main Rome train terminus which has a direct and efficient link to the airport. The reception was pleasant and efficient and we went up (in a delightful old fashioned but quiet and efficient lift) to our room. The room was large and very well furnished. Two bucket chairs and a table set to one side meant that if one of us slept the other could read comfortably. The room was furnished in quality repro 'antique' furniture which included a large desk with good lighting at which I was able to work. The bed was large and comfortable and the pillows superb. I wanted to find the supplier to buy some for home! The bathroom was large and had all the usual extras. We normally don't go below four star hotels and this more than matched recent examples. There was free use of the hotel's computer for internet access - although this was in the bar and rather public. Had I had a laptop this would have been free and there were several being used in the lounge. Breakfast was good with a spledid choice of many things the English don't eat at breakfast (apple pie?) but good yoghurt, breads, rolls, scrambled eggs and smoked salmon. The location was very good with a bus service round the corner which took you to the centre of town and a metro station two minutes away. An excellent choice and my visit to Rome was only marred by a pickpocket getting into a zipped jacket pocket and relieving me of my camera. Be aware that the buses are quite small and the surge to get on and the extremely overcrowded interior leave you vulnerable.

Reviews.Title: “best western hotel canada was good choice”
Reviews.Author: Mid-MN-Tourist
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 nights april 3-6 2008. the hotel is very clean and the rooms are very nice. try to book thier early bird web special and get a break on the room prices. ask for a room away from the elevators, it can get noisy. overall the breakfast buffet and free internet that are included in the price are a plus. it is a 5 min walk to the termini and we felt it was a safe area. we ate dinner all 4 nights within 2 blocks of the hotel. lots of great little resturaunts within walking distance. they have a happy hour with food snacks that was a added little bonus. we will return to the hotel canada on our next visit to rome. good luck :):)

Reviews.Title: “Over rated reviews”
Reviews.Author: IrelandLikestotravel
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Rome having booked Best Western Canada Hotel, Rome following reviews read on Trip Advisor. I have to say I found the reviews were over rated. I have stayed in many hotels and travel a fair bit. This hotel did not offer anything above the norm. As for friendliness, I would say they were just passable. Good morning or good evening comments were exchanged but that was it. There was no conversations or offers of help to assist where you might be going to. I requested a triple room. There were three single beds which appeared to be temporary camp beds which were narrow and hard as rocks. No tea or coffee making facilities were provided. Breakfast is from 7:00 - 10:30. I needed to leave the hotel at 7:15 am and the man at reception kindly told me if I was at the breakfast room at 6:50 the kitchen would be open and we could get breakfast. On the morning of departure I was given my bill. I was not asked if we had a nice stay or a bad stay. The man at reception was obviously tired and short of being rude. I asked if we could get tea or coffee as advised the night before. He gruffly stated the kitchen opens at 7 and we must wait till it opens. So much for the little bit of hospitality I was expecting. Perhaps this hotel puts in the extra effort for big groups but I would not stay here again or recommend. The prices are not cheap and I would expect more value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western is Best(!)”
Reviews.Author: Humax
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my fiancee in February 2008. Initially concerned as we walked though run down streets to approach the hotel, my fears turned out to be unfounded and my faith in trip advisor - which I had checked before boooking my stay - fully justified(!) The hotel was great - the staff were helpful and the standards of cleanliness good. The hotel in some respects was worthy of more than its 3 star rating (quality complimentary slippers and toiletries), but in others you were reminded it was not a 5 star establishment - styrofoam cups with the tea and coffee facilities in the room etc... Location is excellent. It is a 5 minute walk from Termini rail and bus stations, from where the whole of Rome can be accessed, but it is a leisurely walk, as supposed to a hike, from a number of sights further afield in any event. Generally, value for money is exceptional. The inclusive breakfast a treat that can set you up for the day! Something of a hidden gem, I would happily stay at the Best Western Canada again.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding choice”
Reviews.Author: ArrowCapet
Reviews.Content: This hotel truly does live up to its reputation and reviews here on TA and other sites. I booked 10 rooms here for a group I put together and everyone, hands down, loved the hotel. There was a mix of budget travelers and some who could have afforded something much more expensive, and no one was disappointed. Super clean, friendly staff and owners, who were all very helpful to me. They organized a champagne reception in their bar the evening we arrived, placed a bottle of wine in every room that I'd had shipped from Coltibuono, and many other little touches. Breakfast here was by far the best of all the hotels on our 10 day trip. No issues whatsoever with safety or security. Massimo, who runs the Trattoria next door was an incredible host to our frequent visits, offering limoncello and coffees late in the evening. Taxis were called when we needed them, questions were answered about tours....every detail and request was handled perfectly. I am returning again this September, and am certain to make this my home in Roma from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not a great location”
Reviews.Author: Rouby Lou
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, rooms were very nice (we upgraded to a bigger room which was worth it). Breakfast was good (ask for Capuccino!) and the room that breakfast was served in was light and welcoming. Only downside of this hotel was the location as it's a trek to walk to/from major sights. The bus station is just down the road, but if I was to visit Rome again (which I will one day, as it's the best weekend break city I've ever been to - fab), I would not choose this location.

Reviews.Title: “What good value and service”
Reviews.Author: voyagerLeicesterUK
Reviews.Content: We booked online and got discount for being over 60 (so there are advantages!!). The hotel is good, spotlessly clean and very convenient. The room was excellent with very comfortable beds. I think it must have been one of their bigger rooms with an ante room.The metro is just round the corner and only 3 stops from the Colosseum. The Termini railway station is within easy walking distance even with a suitcase. The breakfast is very good; the free bar snacks very welcome.and both breakfast and bar staff were very friendly. NO extra charge for room service and bar prices very competitive with other bars. All in all a most enjoyable stay for 5 days and we would certainly return to the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leselee_and_spouse
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated a few minutes walk from the main Termini station from where you can get the buses or metro to all areas, as well as the tourist buses, which makes it easy to get to all the main tourist sites if you don't wish to walk. A lovely small hotel, we had a pretty room with a four poster bed, and our friends room opened onto a balcony leading on to a private courtyard. The rooms were very clean, and our booking included breakfast which was served in a pleasant room on the ground floor. There is no restaurant, but this wasn't a problem for us as there is plenty of choice all around. A nice touch was the complimentary petit fours in the bar each evening, and the drinks were very fairly priced. (Much cheaper than some of the bars). All in all excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kc1705
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend in Rome and I booked this hotel after reading other reviews on this site. It is one of the best 3 star city centre hotels we have stayed in. The pictures are accurate and our room a queen deluxe was gorgeous. The hotel is spotless and there is a good selection at breakfast. It was a little further to walk to the main attractions than we thought but this was not a problem. Our only criticism is the over zealous barman, who was a bit officious and never smiled, all the other staff were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel - convenient and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: LivingInWien
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three-night stay at the Hotel Canada and I would enthusiastically recommend it to anyone visiting Rome who is looking for a comfortable, reliable hotel with good location and a reasonable price. The hotel is located about 4-5 blocks from the Termini train station (tip - there is a side entrance from the train station you can go out of that will save you a good bit of the walk as well). It's easy to walk to when you've first arrived and are getting oriented, but it's also on a metro line and one stop from Termini on the subway as well. The neighborhood around the hotel is just okay - not a lot to see and do - but the location one block from the Castro Pretorio subway stop makes it really easy to get around. Also, many of the bus lines begin and end at Termini so that gives you even more options for transport (don't try to walk everywhere - Rome is big!) The hotel is very nice - it has a comfortable lobby, offers a nice breakfast with delicious cappuccino, and has good sized rooms and bathrooms. Our room was on the 5th floor, facing an interior courtyard (including some offices) and was very quiet. My only possible complaint about the hotel was that the beds were *firm* to say the least (my husband's words - "hard as a rock"). That said, we both slept soundly and well for the duration of our stay. For what it's worth, the pillows were much better than some of the fluff we've slept on throughout Europe.... The staff was top notch and very accommodating. Everyone was very pleasant and helpful, giving out information about directions, bus lines, etc. and we also found the cokes and beers from the bar to be better priced than in any cafe was came across in the city. We were very happy with our stay and would gladly stay there again. We looked at some other places that were significantly more expensive and I can't believe they would have offered any better of an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Roon-Bop
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and we had nothing but an amazing experience with the Hotel Canada. The staff and owners were very kind and accommodating. They were pleasant and helpful and made us feel more than welcome. The room was large and clean, close to the Termini Station and was on a quiet street lined with delicious restaurants. We booked the room through hotels.ca and wrote in the notes section that it was our honeymoon. As such, they delivered champagne and chocolates on our first night. Once we got home from our trip, we got a card from them a couple weeks later thanking us for staying with them and filling out the comment card. Continental breakfast is included, which includes, coffee, toast, croissants, fruit, eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. They do not skimp. Very classy for a great price. I have recommended this hotel to family members and recommend it to you as well. I did not have one bad experience related to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: RueDePassyParis
Reviews.Content: An outstanding hotel. Incredible central location right near Termini with access to both subway lines and buses, but in a rather quiet location. Many great restaurants nearby. The hotel is beautiful. Room was large and comfortable with a big, beautiful bathroom. The breakfast is outstanding - so many choices. And the nice "happy hour" in the early evening is a nice touch. Staff were extremely helpful with directions, etc. Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: ginoNice
Reviews.Content: Hotel was conveniently near the train station, which was why we picked it as we were travelling around Italy by train. Hotel was nice and fresh. Rooms were equiped well and very clean. Breakfast was good and the staff were very helpful. Would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “It's a beauty”
Reviews.Author: loutri
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, within walking distance to the train/bus station. Our room was even nicer than we anticipated. Breakfast was plentiful and delicious. We will stay here again when we return to Rome. The staff was very helpful, they even arranged a driver to get us to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cazzy42
Reviews.Content: Should have posted this sooner as finding a good hotel in Rome that doesn't cost a fortune is like looking for a needle in a haystack! Stayed here mid June with hubby and 3 Children 11,14 and 16 . Lovely comfy hotel, great location for Termini station, lots of lovely restaurants nearby and if you don't mind a bit of walking pretty much accessible to the main tourist sites. We walked to the Colosseum, Trevi fountain and the Spanish steps from the hotel ,but got a taxi to St.Peters (shut your eyes its a scary ride!). Would definitely stay her again when we return to Rome, although would go Spring or Autumn for sight seeing it as it was very hot in June.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jandgbl1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was wonderful. Next to Termi Station about 5 minute walk. There is also a great Pizza place down the street ask the clerk they will tell you where it is. If you dont eat there once you have not experienced this portion of Rome. Someone wrote earlier the bed was like cement. Welcome to Europe!! Excellent breakfast in the morning!! If you eat enough it will get you through the day. We took on the vatican our first day and did not even get hungry until later that afternoon. There is no free computer in lobby you have to pay by the minute. There is a bar that had decent prices and excellent happy hour if you got there in time. We stayed two nights and were treated with great kindness and professionalism. Would recommend to others especially the pizza place.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: pc-utd
Reviews.Content: We got married in Rome in May and choose our hotel very carefully. Hotel Canada was personally recommended by a friend and we are so glad, as it was perfect. We booked 5 rooms in total. With everyone really enjoying their stay. We stayed in a suite and found it to be very nice. The hotel is located close to the main train station and is a prefect location for visiting Rome. Rome is easy to get around by foot or by metro. The hotel staff were very firendly, we did not tell them we were getting married and when we arrived back from the Church after our wedding they had prepared some light snacks for us with our Champaign. Also, they left a bottle of Champaign in our room which was such a nice surprise. All I can say is that we will not look to stay anywhere else when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jens123
Reviews.Content: What a super hotel! We weren't expecting anything like this considering the 3 star rating, I know star ratings are largely based on the facilities a hotel offers but this had everything we needed for a city break. I have stayed in 4 star hotels which haven't come near the standard of the Canada. Our room was on the first floor and was very comfortable and spacious with a separate area for our daughter through an open doorway. The room was decorated with antique furniture and frescoed ceilings, the bathroom was clean and spacious with an ample supply of toiletries a hairdryer, even toothbrushes. Previous posts have mentioned the street noise, which would be unbearable but for the 2 double-glazed units and shutters. Thankfully as it was October we were quite comfortable so didn't need to leave the windows open at night. There is a small bar behind the reception area furnished with sofas and pictures of the Pucci family who now own the Canada which gives it a personal touch. The bar has a small menu offering drinks, tea, coffee and ice-creams and sandwiches, enough for a lite bite between sightseeing, and Massimo the barman puts on a spread of nibbles, little pastries, olives etc, every afternoon and evening which are free to customers. The breakfast room is situated at the foot of the stairs and opens from 6:50am til 10:30, and as we had to leave at 7:00am on our first day it was a bit rushed! There was always plenty bacon, omelette, fresh fruit, bread rolls, pastries yoghurts, all nicely presented. All the staff were very pleasant and efficient and happy to answer any questions and on our last day we were able to leave our luggage while we enjoyed our final hours in Rome. The hotel is situated at the end of via Vecenza just a short walk from the termini so no need to hire a taxi. We just made our way there every day and hopped on one of the many buses and found it quite easy to negotiate our way around with a little forward planning and a map. The only negative point I would make is that the area around the hotel is quite noisy and dirty, it surprised me how much graffiti there was, but this isn't the fault of the hotel and many areas were the same, it wouldn't put me off a return visit. I would gladly recommend this hotel and would love to return in the future. Ciao Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel but beds of Cement”
Reviews.Author: jub6620Halifax
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canada is close to the bus station and is a very clean pretty hotel. We were pleased with our selection until we went to bed. The beds are like sleeping on cement and unfortunately the most uncomfortable beds we have ever slept in (and we travel extensively). We both suffered back aches for several days and lack of sleep. This is unfortunate for the Hotel as I could never recommend it to anyone and we would certainly never go back.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs, mildew, and smoke”
Reviews.Author: HappyBelly
Reviews.Content: We didn't have the wonderful stay that so many other reviewers had. Our bathroom smelled of mildew, and our room and the halls smelled of smoke so we had to sleep with the windows open. When we called downstairs about it, they said they'd look into it, but the smoke continued through the night (someone was smoking on the floor). My boyfriend had bug bites over his body the next day, and suspects our room. This isn't worth the money. I know Rome is expensive, but next time, I think I'll try to stay in a B&B to get better value for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Grindley
Reviews.Content: Myself and my cousin (both middle aged women) stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in the second week in September 2007. I booked this hotel after reading its previous reviews in TripAdvisor and was not disappointed One of the recent reviewers wrote that Hotel Canada was 'not that exciting'. This for me was one of its strengths. The hotel is based on a quiet side street near Termini - the perfect contrast to the sensory overload that is midtown Rome in early September. It was so lovely to get away from the more touristy areas in Rome and by taking a €1 bus journey end up somewhere quiet and uncrowded. The other plus is that the hotel is exceptional. Its rooms are spacious, clean and tastefully decorated. The air conditioning worked well, which was essential this very warm summer in Italy. Staff are pleasant and obliging. Breakfast was wonderful. Of the three hotels myself and my cousin stayed in during our recent trip to Italy - this was the best. Should I return to Rome as I hope, I wouldn't dream of staying in any other hotel in Rome other than the Hotel Canada.

Reviews.Title: “near the Termini Station, but not an exciting neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: HLChang
Reviews.Content: We stay in this hotel for one night, before heading for the airport. Compare with the hotel we stayed during arival (at Via nationale, on the left side of the station), the location of this hotel is not that exciting. The hotel itself is ok, room is small, but that is ok for European standard. Breakfast is good. But this hotel is situated on the right side of the station, there is less attraction around this area. I would recommend staying in serviced apartment type hotel while in Rome, for about 170 Euros, you can have a one bedroom apartment, with kitchen, and a sitting room with sofa that could accomplish 2 more people!

Reviews.Title: “The best in Rome”
Reviews.Author: toronto24
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hotel Canada on August 31/07. We loved this hotel. It is close to the Termini and the Metro is around the corner. The staff at the hotel are very nice and helpful. The breakfast is great. The hotel is meticulously clean. We stayed at other hotels during our stay in Italy and this was by far the best even better than a 4 star we stayed at in Sicily which cost us more.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrishaHamilton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Canada on August 8-11/07. We loved this hotel. It is indeed close to the Termini and the Metro is around the corner. We walked to the Colesseum in about 15 minutes (all downhill). The bus station is on the opposite side of the Termini from the side the hotel is on but all very easy to find and to use. The folks at the hotel are very nice and helpful. Especially Giancarlo who jumped to our rescue when a limo company we had hired did not show and he got us another one within15 minutes!! He also arranged for them to meet us again in Civitavecchia to take us to the airport once our cruise ended and both times the drivers were great. Thank you so much Giancarlo!! The breakfast is great, I don't care what other people say; if you leave here hungry then you are extremely fussy. If you are extremely fussy then you shouldn't post an opinion as you are not being fair to the hotel. The hotel is meticulously clean. The beds are a little on the firm side but we slept like logs. The air worked great and may have made a little noise but again we slept like logs. I should mention that both my husband and I are fairly light sleepers so this was great for us. Our room was always made up when we came back from our day's excusions and our room was quiet and it was quite large. We unpacked all the clothes we brought for a 2 week cruise after we left Hotel Canada and we had no trouble putting it all away (and there was lots!) If you have any questions that you think I might be able to answer please contact me; but don't second guess this hotel; you will be pleasantly surprised. My e-mail address is: Legend_of_the_seas@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to the train station”
Reviews.Author: cookie43
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location near the train station and the friendly helpful staff. On the downside the walls are very thin, you can hear noise in the hallway all night. Breakfast had a good selection but was not to my taste. Our air conditioner made a loud noise, I only discovered the last night that if you turn the fan down, the noise went away. If you are only in Rome for a few days and need to be near the train, like we did, this is an excellent location. If you have a week in Rome, stay near the Ancient City. It is truly beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with family feel”
Reviews.Author: bordeauxWhitleyBay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights (our first trip to Rome) It was easy to find, from the Termini. There is a bus at the airport to take you straight to the termini - return tickets very reasonable. Like most cities there were some vagrants around the Termini but certainly not around the hotel - five blocks away. The hotel (although a chain)was managed like a very good family hotel, immaculately clean and room serviced every day, lovely bathroom and comfortable bedroom. The room was completely sound proof (external traffic noise) and we had very little disturbance from other guests. Air conditioning in the room worked very well. Breakfast was buffet style with loads of choice -Italian bacon and eggs! fruit, cakes, cereals yoghurts and cold meats and cheeses. Edwin, the barman was a very friendly sort who served us free snacks after snacks with any drinks we bought, which incedentally were very cheap. The Metro line is a two minute walk away and very easy to navigate. It's easy to find the tourist spots in Rome, which are magnificent. We left our luggage at the hotel on the last day as we had a late evening flight. As far as the small lift - well so what, you can wait a minute or two and it is part of the history of the building. No complaints at all - would definitely go back, after all we did throw the coins in the Trevi Fountain!

Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: nypana
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Canada! We stayed here for 3 nights. The location is great even though it is not RIGHT NEXT to the attractions. It is within walking distance (3 city blocks) to the Termini (main train station) so we were able to get anywhere we wanted (and back for siestas) very easily and quickly - buy the Roma Pass and you're able to jump on and off the trains in a snap! The lobby was very pretty and clean. Vincenzo checked us in. He was great. There was a discrepancy with our reservation (1 person instead of 2) and he just fixed it without all kinds of problems or grumblings (completely unlike our experience in our hotel in Sicily which was a nightmare). We speak English and Spanish and Vincenzo spoke to us in both (plus the little bit of Italian that we tried on him!). He was so helpful in finding out info for all different sites and was esp. helpful getting us info on the free Genesis concert at Circo Massimo that weekend! Our room was very nice and VERY clean - the most important thing to us actually is cleanliness so we were really impressed. We even strip the beds in hotels to make sure there are no bed bugs and these matresses looked almost brand new. There wasn't alot of surface area in the room which was kind of annoying - everything ends up piled on the one desk and 2 tiny night stands. The room's architecture was really pretty - vaulted ceiling, soothing mural painted on it. The bathroom was VERY clean but the shower was too small - but I think this is common in Europe. Also, the drain was clogged in the shower and we had to have them come up and fix it. They came and fixed really immediately after we called though so it wasn't too aweful. I have to say, the MOST FABULOUS thing about Hotel Canada was the breakfast! Tons of food and variety for the price. No, it was not the best food we've EVER had but it was the best hotel breakfast we've ever had anywhere, by far. There were lots of Americans and English speakers which was interesting. This is def. a tourist hotel so if you want an authentic and more "rustic Italy" sort of experience, don't stay here. This was our first time in Rome and we really liked the fact that this hotel was so nice, safe and that we looked forward to going back to our air conditioned room after our days of marathon walking in the 100 degree heat. There is a really good restaurant called "Rossi" right across the street which was great too. VERY overpriced but so convenient and the food was really good. Ottman was our server and we just loved him - he helped us with everything we needed from food to directions to sites to teaching us about the differnt pronunciations for Italian foods in different parts of Italy! We really liked the hotel bar area too - it was quiet and relaxing and they had a little desert bar one night with little cookies and chocolate cake. We hung out there and talked with Edwin who was serving at the bar one night. Such a nice guy - we had fun talking to him in English and broken Italian. He told us about the Americans who he had met there and what states they all came from ( which was almost every state in the U.S). Overall, we had a great time in Rome and staying at Hotel Canada was a huge part of it being such a great trip. We would absolutely stay at Hotel Canada again! Also, we did not find the area of, near or around the hotel shady at all. It actually seemed quite busy with tourists and locals, even late at night, so we never felt uncomfortable. Rome is sort of like a European Manhattan (only a million times more beautiful) - if you are aware of your surroundings, hold on to your belongs and walk like you "belong" there , you shouldn't have any problems.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel hidden away....lets hope the secret never gets out!”
Reviews.Author: Indianna01
Reviews.Content: I had researched this property quite extensively as I was looking for something that was a little bit special, not going to cost the earth, which is difficult to find in Rome..especially for something like this....something that was memorable...it was all that and more. We booked this property after I had spent ages researching and searching for exactly what I found....and what a find! I had booked the Hotel Canada for 2 seperate visits to Rome in the same month as we were transiting Rome..once enroute to Florence, and another enroute to Positano. On both occasions the rooms given to us were absolutely beautiful! Had we stayed somewhere closer to the normal sites of Trevi Fountain, the Colleseum, The Vatican etc etc, it would have cost us 3 or 4 times what it did. The rooms that we were given were spectacular...and we were impressed. I still can't believe how lucky we were to find it, and how reasonable the rate was. The Hotel Canada is down the end of Via Vicenza, near the Roma Termini...within easy walking distance. I haad read that it was a somewhat dubious area, being near the train station and all, but we did not find it to be a problem at all. Infact we found a nice little restaurant close to our Hotel that we went back to as it really had the best food in Rome that we had! The rooms...the first time we stayed there..we had a great room with big windows out to the street. It was huge especially compared to European standards. We had a beautiful ornate king size bed, a sitting room with stunning furniture, and a great big bathroom- the size of some rooms in Rome! The room was superbly decorated, with lovely pieces of furniture, beautiful bed linen, and loads of space. I really felt spoiled, and very much like I had stepped into a a fairy tale. It's nice to feel like a Princess.. :-) The room was spotlessly clean, as was the bathroom. The second stay that we had proved to be as good as the first. Which I thought would have been impossible. The room we were ggiven was just as beautiful as the first. We had a lovely big bedroom decorated with lovely furniture, and a little Juliet balcony, a seperate sitting room with a lovely chaise and desk in it, and again a huge big bathroom. It was spectacular. The public areas are really nice, and we spent one evening after being out for dinner in the bar, which was pleasant, and unbelievably priced. Infact, I would go so far as to say that it probably has the cheapest bar prices in the whole of Europe! Great cuppucino's as well! The breakfast room was really nice....very bright, and very pleasant. It also had the best breakfast that I had during my entire 6 weeks in Europe!! Everything you could want or ask for was provided. All the sites are close by, and easily accessible. Would I stay there again? Of course. Infact, I would onll go to Rome if I could get a room at the Hotel Canada. It made our stay in Rome exactly as I would have wanted it to be..

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Family_Travelers_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel. We were 2 adults and 2 children (12 and 14 years old). The room was really big with two beds for the children in the front of the master bedroom. The room and bathroom were really clean. We really enjoyed the air conditionned and the windows that were closing tight so we did not hear any city noises during all night. We appreciated the location, 2 minutes walking to Metro(subway) and 7 minutes walking to Termini Station, where you can take all buses. The breakfast was excellent (Buffet) and people working there were very kind. If you book by Best Western Internet site, you will get web price which is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Rudeness”
Reviews.Author: kindj
Reviews.Content: We returned to Rome and dropped our bags off in the room our friends were staying with no problems. It was family room, a king bed, and two singels. They were paying 280 Euros for the night. We went out for the evening and came back with our friends to retrieve our luggage and go to our hotel around the corner. The main at the front desk was absurdly rude to us. He would not allow us to go and retrieve our bag citing Italian law. He said we could wait in the lobby, well as our friend left he just kept staring at us and made a comment about how we should have known better. Our hotel room was also a family room but was 100Euro for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Gilbert13
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the beginning of our trip of 2l days in Europe and by far this hotel was the best 3 stars hotel we went. Our room was big, very very clean and well decorated. Our room Floor was ceramic instead of carpet which is a big plus. Every place in this hotel is spic and span (very clean & tidy). The breakfast buffet was huge and everything was delicious. They even opened 10 minutes before in order for us to have more time for breakfast since we were leaving at 7:10 hres for our tour. They picked up our luggages in our room and brought them down in their bagages room the day we were leaving since we were gone on a tour until 14:00hres. The front desk persons did everything they could to help us. We had A1 service from them. The location is very close to termini. I do recommend this hotel and I would booked again. It is a 3 stars hotel but I would quote it as a 4 Stars. Try it you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecki14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, while in Rome after a 2 week trip around Italy. This was by far the best hotel we stayed at. It is very close to the metro station and the central train station making it easily accessible to those coming into Rome from a train. It is only a 5 block walk to the train station. We drove in and it was not that hard to find the hotel, it's in a great location. The Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and Colosseum, and Forum were only a 20 minute walk from the hotel The rooms were fantastic! We had a HUGE room with a canopy bed, enormous bathroom and good view. The staff was very helpful in fielding our questions about Rome and places to go. I'm sure they get asked 100 times a day about trips to the Vatican or Colosseum, but they never let on that they were tired of answering questions. They were helpful and friendly. The breakfast was amazing! The eggs were wonderful and there was a wide variety of fruit, pastries, cereal, meat, cookies, yogurt ect. We wished we could have stayed an extra day or two here as we had such an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: johnnie_scotland
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Canada is a fantastic hotel, it may only be rated as three stars, but I've stayed in four star hotels that do not come close to the standard of this hotel. The service and friendliness of the staff was second to none. They will arrange a taxi to the airport for you for the same price as the train (although after seeing the driving in the city we chose the train.) The Breakfast was lovely and is a buffet style with a mixture of hot and cold, you can eat enough to keep yo going all day. The room was exceptionally clean with plenty of space. The hotel is situated only 5 minutes walk from the bus and rail station and only 20 minutes walk from the main attractions (although you can use the bus or the metro system) On our first night we ate at the restaurant just next to the Hotel on the Via Vicenza after being recommended this by the hotel, it was by far the best meal we had during our stay and cheaper than the other retaurants we used closer to the centre of City. We would definately use this hotel again if travelling to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “satisfactory stay”
Reviews.Author: StChris
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice, once in April, and once in May. The first room was on the backside, facing other rooms/buildings. The first part of the room had a desk, chair, and couch and occupied a lot of space so that the bed area felt a little cramped. There was also noise from some piece of machinery outside the bed area window which may be a problem for light sleepers. The bathroom was large and had a tub. The buffet breakfast was fine and you could have hot chocolate instead of tea/coffee. Our second room overlooked a side street but with the windows closed it was quiet for sleeping. The layout of this room was better and felt more spacious. The train station is close by and there's a metro station just around the corner. Overall we were happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: winther
Reviews.Content: I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. Our room was large and very clean. The breakfast was very nice. Metro stop ( the B line) around the corner and the train station is very close. We felt safe in the area. The staff was very nice except the men at the front desk could have been more helpful, they really seemed not to care too much. The hotel is located one or two blocks from the office of "Enjoy Rome" but when we asked the hotel for directions they told us that they had not heard of that tour company .....My family was very hesitant to take a guided walking tour ( Ancient Rome) but ended up loving it and thought it was a great value. We highly recommend 'Enjoy Rome". Don't forget to try "Forno" (Campo de Fiori) for pizza, fantastic!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very well run 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeThelma
Reviews.Content: People sometimes hesitate to choose a hotel near a main-line station but the Canada is located in a district which also contains the German and Russian Embassies. Although three-star it feels like a much better hotel in many respects. It is impeccably clean, very comfortable and the staff go out of their way to help. No mini-bar but room service for drinks is free and the prices are the same as in the lounge - some of the lowest I've ever encountered in a city hotel. The lounge also lays on an impressive range of snacks and nibbles. Breakfast is much more than the simple 'continental' variety with an very good choice allowing a hearty start to a day's sightseeing. The reception staff efficiently arrange taxis which cost about 8-10 euros into the main sights, a very economic option for 3/4 people. There are a number of excellent trattorie within 150 metres, some of which give discounts to Canada clients. We stayed there for seven nights and would happily recommend it to friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Base Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoesAnywhere
Reviews.Content: We were a family of five. One senior, two aduts, two children (ages7 & 11). We were intially drawn to the Best Western name because we feared small, dirty hotels and felt a known corporate name was safer. We were pleasantly surprised to find excellent traveler reviews of this hotel and we weren't disappointed. The staff was friendly and easy to communicate with. Our children really enjoyed the Italian lessons as the staff encouraged them to ask for the room keys in Italian. All in good humor, we never felt any pressure to speak Italian. We made all of our inquiries and the reservations via email and had no problems at all. There were many restaurants within easy walking distance. The main train terminal (Roma Termini) was a very, very easy walk from the hotel. There was a laundrymat a block away with very reasonable prices and a fantastic pizza by the slice place a few doors down. We always felt safe in the neighborhood, day or night and definitely always felt safe anywhere in the hotel. The rooms were spotless, the entire hotel was truly immaculate. The buffet breakfast, included with your room, was very generous, quite tasty and had plenty of different items to choose from. This was a fantastic hotel to use as a base. In addition to the train station so close, a subway station was literally around the corner. The room shared by four of us was very large, which we didn't expect. The senior room was smaller, but since it was a single occupancy, that wasn't any problem. Closet space was generous. We had a color TV, 2 phones, large private bathroom and wireless internet access (about 6 Euros for an hour). There were plenty of channels on the TV, but most were in Italian. We mostly watched CNN World News or viewed DVDs on the laptop we brought. But, there is so much to see in Rome, we really weren't "home" enough to need entertainment via a TV. It was truly a pleasure having our coffee in the lounge areas. They also offer complimentary cookies in the bar area in the evening. If we had anything at all negative to say, it was just personal preferences: our room faced the street and it was pretty loud. If we closed the window, no problem, but we were there in March and the air conditioning was not on yet. Turning on our in-room thermostat would only get us heat. We like it cooler and had the window open most of the time. It did usually cool off the room for us, but made it difficult to hear even the TV. It took some getting used to the constant car horns. So...if we didn't need the window open, we really wouldn't have anything negative to say. Oh, and for those of you with little ones, they don't have the safety bars on windows like we are used to in the U.S. - no screens either. If you open the window and the shutters, keep the little ones away from the window. We just couldn't say enough nice things about this hotel and the neighborhood. We are always ready to go home at the end of any trip, but we truly felt sad leaving Hotel Canada, and Rome. We will return to both! We've attached two photos, just the two sides of the room with beds. There was also a desk area and the bathroom not pictured. We had concerns planning a trip with such a mixed group of ages. If you have the same situation, feel free to contact us. We are happy to share our tips for what is worth your time or a waste of your time.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with the Best Western Hotel Canada”
Reviews.Author: Michevo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Best Western Hotel Canada in February 2007. The hotel is situated just east of the Termini Station, about a 5 to 10 min walk. You are able to access the various tour buses from the Termini. The hotel is also just a couple of minutes' walk from the nearest Metro/subway. Despite being a 70-room hotel, it has the feeling of a smaller, family run hotel. The person who took our suitcases to our room also served us drinks in the bar and was seen again the next morning, working in the kitchen! The reception staff were courteous and helpful and were able to communicate in English (although we always used the bits of Italian we had mastered to show willing! This seemed appreciated). The room we had was a quad room. We were very impressed with the layout - our boys had two single beds in an area separate to us - and the room was clean, ornate and high-ceilinged. The bathroom was clean and had a shower over a bath. Our room was on the Metro side of the hotel. There is a fairly main road on that side so the nights were quite noisy. Once we found our ear plugs, we were fine! The breakfasts were self-service and good enough to set us up for the day - scrambled eggs, bacon, cheeses, hams, etc,, plus cereals, fruit, yoghurts, toast (with various jams etc), sweet pastries and orange juice. The staff were quick to clear tables and to provide coffees and hot chocolates. Apart from a toasted sandwich, this is not the sort of hotel where you can eat and lunchtime or in the evening. We were directed by the Reception staff to Rossi 3, just a block away from the hotel (towards the Termini and on the other side of the road). This is a breakfast/pizzeria/bar restaurant just a couple of minutes' walk away at Via Vicenza 23. We ate there 3 out of the 4 nights as our young children didn't want to venture far in the evenings after a day's sightseeing. The restaurant is casual but attentive. The menu was mainly pizzas and pastas (which our children adored) with a few alternatives. It was very reasonably priced, good food and easy. All in all we were impressed with the hotel. It is basic (hence the 3* rating) but is extremely good in its class. The area isn't very central but the transport links are easy to access. It is also a little `dark' along the Via Vicenza but we didn't feel uncomfortable with it as there are always plenty of people around. We would be happy to return to this hotel although, as an alternative, might opt for a more `central' hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but far away from main attractions”
Reviews.Author: Claudinha1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in October 2006. This hotel is in an excellent location if you come by train or from Ciampino airport after taking the bus shuttle. The hotel looks ok, breakfast is very good for a 3 star hotel and staff is friendly. Bad point is that you need to walk 10min to go to Termini. In the evening it feels quite unsafe to be walking around the neighbourhood. We always took a taxi back to the hotel from the center in the evenings. On our 2nd evening the airco broke down and we were only informed about it because we asked for it. It was warm in Rome and we needed to sleep with the windows open - it's really really noisy if you get one of the rooms on the subway station side. Overall it's a good hotel, but not spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Keep looking”
Reviews.Author: bragger
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, but not worth the money. I feel confident there are other places out there at a better value. Rome tends to be expensive, but this hotel was over priced. Although, the hotel staff was pleasant it was not the best place we stay on our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Five star Hotel in three star size!”
Reviews.Author: NixNix
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We had room 312 which had double aspect windows and a lovely painted ceiling, even in the bathroom! There is a supermarket nearby. We travelled around the sights on an open topped bus, the 'Christian' tour seems to cover most hot spots including the Vatican. The Termini is only a short walk to catch the bus. It cost around £13 each for a 2 day pass to go on the bus as many times as you wished and to get on and off as many times too. Go by night and see Rome lit up, very Romantic!

Reviews.Title: “not handy”
Reviews.Author: fisches
Reviews.Content: After carefully reading this hotel reviews about how convenient it was and nice, we booked it. The room was spacious, however not many surfaces to place your stuff. There was one pair of slippers (for two) and they are needed since the floors are tile. Definately 3 star but with a bit of funky style. Bed was OK, breakfast was also only OK. Very little counter space in the bathroom . Couldn't even put my toothbrush anywhere and the glasses were thin plastic. No minibar so we had to put our drinks out on the window sill. The elevater is a hoot! However, if you like to be where the action is and be able to take a break during the day in your room to drop things off or rest , don't stay here. Also don't eat at the Trattoria next door, which the front desk recommended to us when we arrived late and hungry. Seems like this Trattoria caters to British or Americans as there were no locals there and the service and food was pretty bad. For us, it was not convenient at all to the areas we wanted to see. It was a major thing to get back to the hotel from the old center . The neighborhood is safe but not very nice to wander around in. Too far to walk into the old center. So, if you like to walk and wander and go back to your room once in a while during the day or go back to that cute little restaurant you saw during the day for dinner and enjoy the piazzas at night...what a hassle to get back here! The lobby and lounge were nice enough...they don't allow smoking, even in the bar. Only hotel guests were in there. Hopefully this information will save some people booking this place because they thought it was handy to the old city...it's not. We like to immerse ourselves in Rome, not out in some tourist enclave away from the beautiful old city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: runners2
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on previous reviews and the convenience to Termini station. It entirely lived up to its high rating. The hotel had a very pleasant lobby and lounge. The breakfast was the best we had anwhere in Italy. On the 2 nights we stayed, there was complimentary wine tasting and snacks. Our room was large, clean, well decorated and quiet. The desk staff were somewhat cool but did respond to all our needs and their dining recommendations were excellent. The neighbourhood is dark but we felt safe enough at night. Very convenient to transit, metro 1 block and Termini station 5 blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelouge
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the most charming one we stayed in, in Italy. We initially only booked it because it was within walking distance of the train station (just barely however ! there are closer hotels but not as well spoken) and the budget airline bus stop (much closer by) and were pleasantly suprised at how nice the hotel turned out. The room we had, which was done in a classic italianate style that we found charming, was very good sized. We were a bit concerned at first with noise as it was at the end of the street and directly next to a main road but this did not pose a problem in the end. The lobby and lounge were very nicely decorated as was the beautiful breakfast room. The breakfast spread was also good and the staff, very polite and fast with the coffee. It was very very pleasant. Highly recommended regardless of whether you need to be near the train station and perfect if you do and more so if your coming by a budget airline and need to arrive in rome by airport bus from ciampino airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: CousinGreg
Reviews.Content: One of the best breakfasts that we had during our trip to Italy. Our suite was very large. The hotel has a very old, quaint elevator. The staff is not overly friendly, but that seems to be the Italian way. The hotel is a couple of blocks from Termini station, which is convenient. While the neighborhood is not really the best, I didn't feel endangered walking the streets at night. I would stay here again. Staff will arrange a private car to the airport that costs $45 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: wwlowe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a few blocks north of Termini on Via Vicenza which is about 10 minutes walking distance of where the Terravision Ryanair bus drops off and picks up for Ciampino airport. The area around the hotel seems quiet and pretty safe. Around the corner from the hotel is a Rome subway stop (Castro Pretorio). For traveling around Rome, this hotel is well situated. The Castro Pretorio stop is on the same line as the Colosseum stop and for other sights you can change trains at Termini. The elevator is small and the three of us were able to squeeze in with 2 rolling luggage. The room was large, comfortably fitting a double bed and a single bed. There was no carpeting on the floor and the bathroom was roomy and clean and stocked with complimentary toileteries. The room has double glazed windows that effectively shuts out all noise from the streets. We were on the 5th floor. Breakfast (included in the room rate) was a wonderful buffet of hot and cold items, like fresh fruit, Italian pastries, egg dishes, yogurt and served in a small dining room. The staff was efficient though not overly friendly. There are some restaurants and pizzerias in the area and also a convenience store. Overall, a good hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Option”
Reviews.Author: chipirrina
Reviews.Content: We just came back from spending a weekend in Rome and stayed at hotel Canada. The hotel was very nice for the price, but I disagree with other reviews regarding the room size as our room (#518) was quite small, although enough for us as we were just there for 2 nights and did not have much luggage. Breakfast was excellent. We did not eat much as we wanted to save space for a good italian lunch, but certainly you can eat enough to keep you going until dinner. Waiters were very nice, but the people in the reception desk were not that nice at all, specially the man in the morning. He does not seem to like to give information, talk to guests or take any effort to make your stay nicer. Beds are inedeed a bit hard. The bar area is very home-like, very nice and drinks very reasonable priced. We spent there several hours as we had to take an evening flight and thought it was really nice. Regarding the situation, it is a bit out of the way of the main cultural sites, but on the other hand is very convenient as you are 5 minutes away from the station where you can take a train wich takes you to the airport in 30 minutes, subway and buses to every touristic site. If you feel like walking you can also do it, as we did and even got blisters from all the walking we did. In all, we think it was a very good hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: fiona229
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. Stayed withhusband and two teenagers. Great room with double bed for us and two singles just off the room for the guys. The breakfast is excellent with a wide range of choices. Best of all the bar prices are very good indeed and the free selection of hors d'oeuvres is most welcome. They do great hot chocolate. The staff were very helpful and we all enjoyed it. There are also some nice restaurants nearby and it is a short walk from termini. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome....”
Reviews.Author: katkruiser
Reviews.Content: The reviews are right on. Number one complaint was hard beds. If they upgraded them it would be almost perfecto! A bottle of wine in the lounge 7.5 Euros and good I may add. Very appetizing hors d'oeuvres with nice presentation on pretty china. Massimo one of the waiters so accomodating and humble-he lives near Greve. Can't say as much for waiters or the food in the nearby eateries. We asked the front desk for a restaurant reccomendation and walked down a few blocks to Aggrapola D'Oro. Very overpriced, the waiter spoke hardly any English (not his fault) and waited 40 min for a check after asking a few times. Most of the restaurants have the same menu in this area. The Bistro was good as well as Rossi 3 . Don't bother with Gemma alla Lupe. We were seated next to the WC unknowingly at first. The waiter brought drinks and we moved to another table 10 feet away without using any napkins or tableware. Well, the waiter went on about the cost his boss would suffer for laundering the napkins which we pointed out we didn't use all to no avail. One morning I asked the desk to call a taxi. We had a reserved time for the Vatican tour. He tried a few times and said to me they are all busy. No other explanation. I guess that meant walking to the train station so off we went and found the buses were on strike. Huge long lines for taxis. Needless to say we missed the Vatican tour. I am a seasoned traveler working for an airline and hadn't been to Rome in 35 years so the inconsistent level of customer service and general indifference was eye opening. However, take what you need and leave the rest is a good attitude to have. And don't hesitate to stay at the Hotel Canada!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carnaghan
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our trip to Rome. We booked the Hotel on the strength of the reviews from this website. The hotel is excellent and the location is great-very close to the Metro. The breakfast will keep you going until afternoon. The bar is also cheap and includes free snacks. The staff at the bar and those serving breakfast are very friendly, but the staff at reception I found to be a little dry to say the least, but this did not take away from a great experience. The rooms are spotless and the high pressure shower is just what you need after walking all day.

Reviews.Title: “What a value!”
Reviews.Author: 3sons
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Canada for 4 nights after a cruise and were pleasantly surprised at how nice it was since it was a good value. After reading another review, I emailed the hotel to ask if they still offered an AARP discount which they do (10%). Get this in writing and then bring your card with you. Before we arrived I had emailed them 2 or 3 times and they were always quick to respond and very helpful. Without exception, the staff was polite and kind throughout our stay. We stayed in #522 which is a very large room with a king bed and sitting area. We were amazed at how hard the bed was (like a slightly padded pool table), but were even more surprised at how well we slept...must have been the 3 or 4 miles we walked every day. There are a lot of beautiful paintings/prints throughout the hotel; even the ceilings are decorated nicely. A large breakfast is offered (free) every morning from 0700-1030 which kept us satisfied until around 2pm when we would stop for gelato and an espresso. For dinner the hotel recommended several restaurants within a block or two of the front door which we were always happy to visit after a long day of touring. Internet access is available downstairs for 9.50 Euros an hour. This rate allows you to go online repeatedly to use up your time. If you only want one log on session, the hour is 6 Euros. On Sunday we walked the 5 blocks to Termini train staion and went to Orvieto for the day with our Rick Steves guide in hand. This was one of our favorite days. Italians are out with the children in hand and it's quite sweet to watch. We enjoyed the St. Brizio Chapel in the Orvieto cathedral even more with the RS art history notes about what's going on in the murals. There is a 5E entry fee, but worth it we thought. The funicular ride up to the town is fun, then a little shuttle takes you to the cathedral (Duomo) square. Before you take the shuttle be sure to do a quick tour of the fortress ruins and the gardens to the left for lovely hilltop views. A fun day away from Rome. The morning we left the hotel arranged for a driver to take us to the airport (allow 3 hours ) for 45E, which included our luggage. This is only 5E more than calling a taxi yourself and we thought, safer. You could also take a train from Termini, but we had too many bags.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Leong's
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, free breakfast was tasty, staff were friendly but not overly helpful in getting around other than to tell us generally how to get to the main train station. The hotel is walking distance to the main train station. At the train station you can catch various hop on/ hop off tour buses. Most of the main tourist location and activity is to the west of the hotel beyond the train station. The room was large for European hotel and had a really good powerful shower which was nice after a long day of walking and site seeing. I would recommend this hotel for it's price and generally a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “A lovel little hotel”
Reviews.Author: VanTraveler
Reviews.Content: Being Canadian, we were sure we couldn't go wrong with the Hotel Canada!! I read the Trip Advisor reviews and they were pretty much right on. The location is convenient, right by the train station (10 min walk), lots of great little restaurants in the area, and the hotel was clean and reasonably modern. The breakfasts that everyone raved about were very good with a huge selection and quaint breakfast room. Staff weren't overly friendly but overall our experience was just fine and we'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kimsansone
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Close to the Termini Railway Station, but off the beaten path just a bit, which I enjoyed, because it's quiet. Breakfast was awesome. Hotel staff was knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. Room was large and clean. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: resourcefultraveller
Reviews.Content: Great value for Rome, hotel is very clean, our room had a wonderful ambience, (eg fresco on ceiling) large well appointed bathroom, room also has a safe for valuables. Full breakfast is included with cost of room, and complimentary afternoon/evening snacks. It's a 10 minute walk to the Termini, and about 1/2hr walk to the Trevi.

Reviews.Title: “We love "Canada"”
Reviews.Author: Nocko
Reviews.Content: In May 2006 we stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. One of the reasons for choosing this hotel were the reviews on Trip Advisor and the vicinity of the railway station. Hotel, staff and breakfast were excellent and the drinks in the bar were really cheap. Upon our recommendation our friends stayed there as well and also thoroughoy enjoyed their stay. We would definitely go here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CockneyBrum
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the basis of Tripadvisor reviews and its close proximity to the railway station. We were not disappointed with either. If you do arrive by train and need to find this hotel, look for the "Jesus Statue" which looms large above the buildings once you exit the railway station. Head towards it and down Via Vincenza and you will eventually walk to the hotel in under 10 minutes. The hotel staff were excellent, hard-working and most welcoming. The room size is outstanding, with a large bathroom and stunning canopy bed. One thing that made us smile was the scooter in reception, which featured in the Gregory Peck movie "Roman Holiday". A lovely touch. We had a disappointing dinner at the restaurant across the street from the hotel. If you walk a little further into town (perfectly safe) you will get a better dining experience. We stumbled across the "Il Quadrifoglio" at Via Del Boschetto where we enjoyed the most amazing mussels, pasta, tiramisu and wine for under 50 euros. This is a great hotel which oozes character.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Genny26
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our experience at the Best Western Hotel Canada. We choose it ourself, and it was very easy, as Best Western is international. When we arrived, we were warmly greeted by the staff hotel (some even spoke French!). Our room was much nicer that what we've expected, plus very soundproofed. Breakfasts were complete and good food quality. The best point is the location. It is 5 min walk from Termini Station, 2 min walk from Castro Pretorio subway Station, and about 10 min walk from Trimani Wine Bar (excellent store to buy wines and to eat and taste wines). I higly recommand this Hotel and I would definetly return on another vacation trip to Roma. You'll be enchanted by the whole experience at this Hotel and you will really appreciate the proximity of restaurants, subway station, termini station, wine bar, and touristics areas you can get by walk.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Canada”
Reviews.Author: PatSnyder
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 got a huge quadruple room. 3 beds were in one room and the 4th in a modest ante-room. It was great! Right on the street, but quiet. The beds were really comfortable. The breakfasts are huge and wonderful...a great way to start the day. The hotel is on the far side of the train station, but you can easily walk to some places like the Piazza de Repubblica. Plus there is a Metro stop right around the corner and you can easily catch a bus at the train station. We loved the place and would definitely stay there again if/when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly good!”
Reviews.Author: rosstucker
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel located in an area of less-than-great little hotels near the railway station in Rome. But everything about this place was excellent: the room, the breakfast, the staff, and so on. And there are good restaurants in the area (see the Michelin guide) and some pretty dreadful ones. Despite the tourist crowding in Rome, this hotel remains extremely calm -- with helpful staff who work very hard. our week in Rome was made a greater pleasure by having stayed here. Ross Tucker, Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Lancashire-Tourist
Reviews.Content: What a suberb hotel. Very clean and aesthetically pleasing and I would recommend it to tourists and business travellers alike. It is in a good location close to the termini and easy to find on foot because there is a church with a huge statue of Jesus on the roof at the end of the street. The staff were helpful and courteous and the ladies who worked in the breakfast room and the bar man in the evening were friendly. The bar man spoke very good English and was happy to chat between serving customers. My only issue is that the beds were hard, but this didn't spoil the holiday. We travelled with our 11 year old son who also enjoyed the stay and although we all stayed in the same room there was a wall between my son's bed and ours giving us a bit of privacy when getting changed. There were some nice restaurants near the hotel, but we felt that quite a few of the restaurants in Rome have a lack of transparency with their pricing, e.g service charge AND cover charges which were different on the next visit. One place we stopped for a light lunch appeared very reasonable but charged around 30 Euros for three small slices of cold pizza and three cokes and when we questioned the bill she said they made additional charges for the napkins and straws! However most places were very friendly and the final bill usually worked out very similar to those in the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: otterpop
Reviews.Content: We got to Rome's main train station and walked the five blocks to our hotel to check in only to find that the first night of our 3-night reservation was not available. Not wanting to have to pack up another night, we decided to check out hotels in the area that might be able to accommodate the four of us (my wife, my two teenage daughters and me) in a quad room. I walked down the street and around the corner into the Hotel Canada. It looked substantially nicer than the hotel we had been booked. They had a quad room for 3 nights at an even better price (170 Euros) than we were going to pay at the other place. Hotel Canada is part of the Best Western family. The staff is very professional and friendly. Their English is very good. The hotel was very clean and the room and bath were very large. The a/c worked great in our room and in the common areas, which was greatly appreciated because of the hot weather. The breakfast room was light and airy and the selection at the buffet table was varied and ample. There was a sitting room and bar area that had little snack foods and the bar was very well stocked and low priced. The bar tender was very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is great. It is close to the main train station and just a block from the underground stop and bus stop. We'd stay at Hotel Canada again, for sure! In fact, my daughter stayed there a week later with a friend when she went back to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with an ideal location, comfort and service”
Reviews.Author: Benesis1
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hotel Canada for 3 days in July and we found it to be absolutely wonderful. The location was great; a 5 minute walk to bus and train station and it also is walking distance to many attractions. The room was impeccable! Gorgeous decor -- frescos on the ceilings, linens were crisp and hotel room spotless. Breakfast was also very good. We stayed in a family suite which consisted of a queen bed and 2 single beds for the kids (teenagers). They don't advertise a quad room on their site so I would suggest to call them directly to book. I would stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: smoconnor
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Canada is a Best Western but in a lovely old building with high ceilings. It is within walking distance of the train station and the Metro. I was especially impressed with their soundproof doors and windows - you couldn't hear outside at all. Inside soundproofing needs some work. It was airconditoned and there was a full Western style breakfast buffet as part of the cost. It is not a big hotel but they are attentive to women traveller's needs, which I appreciated. The beds were comfy if a little hard. The taxi drivers all knew it as well, which I thought was a good sign in a city full of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Hotel Canada is Great!”
Reviews.Author: musicbizperson
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Hotel Canada on Via Vincenza in Rome was a wonderful treat this past week ( July 29, 30 , 31 ). During this incredible heat wave it was great to enjoy the air conditioning the hotel provides. The service was friendly, and very good. We found the Bar service also very reasonable. The breakfast buffet was delightful and offered a wide array of food to suite all tastes. The individual air conditioning controls in all rooms would satisfy all clients. The hotel is centrally located and only around 7 Euros by taxi from the Wedding Cake Memorial area or the Vatican. Very easy to walk to some of the main tourist sites or the Termini station with access to many tour buses ( we took the Green line due to their 24 hour ticket , which we were able to use over 2 days). A great experience enjoyed by all 7 members of our group

Reviews.Title: “good but not brilliant”
Reviews.Author: simplymark
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 nights and it is a clean comfortable hotel. we paid for an upgrade and had sitting room / bedroom and bathroom - none of them bit but ok. the air con is very good and having the controls in the room is useful - we switched it off in our room at night and because we were in an inner courtyard room it stayed cool all night. the breakfast is ok - we cannot be as gushing as the other reviews. we have been in four hotels this year and as breakfasts go it came 4th - the other hotels were very good but canada was only ok. the bar is excellent and with coffee at 1 euro and sandwiches 2 euros it beats the local shops [including the supermarkets] hands down. the television here will give you a full set of channels, including bbc. the metro is a very good way of getting around and just around the corner. 75 minute journeys cost 1 euro. the ticket machines are in 5 languages. once you have your 1 euro ticket you have to put it into the machines at the gate. fast way of getting around. as for food the best thing is to go to the other side of the river [traveste] we had brilliant meals for 2 [main, salads, desert, wine, water] for less than 30 euros. find some where that looks good, sit down and enjoy. colosseum - you can queue for over an hour to get in. if you pay an extra 10 euro's you can jump the queue and have a guided tour - this also includes the palatino. cannot stress this enough if you go to st peter's you must a) have covered shoulders b) must not wear shorts - ladies no short skirts c) men they can also stop you if your ankles are not covered - wear socks!! we saw loads of people being turned away.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and the breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler1965
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two teenaged sons stayed in the BW Hotel Canada for three nights at the end of June and loved this hotel. The murals on the ceilings are beautiful, the bathroom was very large, the hotel is very clean and the breakfasts are DIVINE! The only semi-negative thing I can say is not so much about this hotel in particular but all hotels we stayed at in Europe and that is the shower fixture and the tub. It is very difficult to get a shower without soaking the floor and the tubs are very narrow -- so narrow it was even difficult to stand horizontally in this tub. However, this was the only hotel we stayed in that had hot food for breakfast. Each morning was scrambled eggs with different kinds of cheese, bacon, DELICIOUS pastries, quiche and fresh fruit in addition to the standard cold cereal, hard boiled eggs toast, rolls, cheese, meats, coffe & tea. Also, it was very close to the metro which made getting around Rome quite easy. This hotel has a great deal of character and charm and really is quite nice. If I return to Rome, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: kat63
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 nights in july it was perfect to return to after a hot day seeing the sights of rome: cool,comfortable and very clean , in a quiet area but not far away from all the sights!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, look no further”
Reviews.Author: Coldwind
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 3rd trip to Rome. We booked 5 days at BW Hotel Canada and 5 at a 4-star boutique hotel. The BW Hotel Canada blew the boutique hotel away, and at half the price! Our room was very comfortable, spacious, quiet, and clean. The air-conditioning worked quietly and efficiently, with controls in the room, instead of at the front desk. The bathroom had all amenities. There were 2 pillows on the bed, one down-filled and one a bit flatter, depending on your preference. There is a spacious lounge area, comprised of 3 rooms and a bar with very reasonable prices. A large variety of free appetizers were offered every night starting around 4-5. Breakfast was outstanding (the best we've had anywhere in Europe); extensive selections of bakery items, scrambled eggs, frittata, bacon, cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, etc. Phone charges were reasonable. There is an internet shop about 4 blocks down the street towards Termini, and a Metro station right around the corner. For dinner, we really liked Ristorante La Famiglia, close by on Via Gaeta. Satellite TV is all Italian, no CNN or BBC. The area is fine, a little grungy, but that's how Rome is. This hotel deserves 4 stars, a great find. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Brian365
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in this Hotel before moving on to Florence. We loved the character of this Hotel. It was well situated being close to the Rail Termini and a metro stop was just around the corner. Hotel staff were very polite and gave us advise when we requested information regarding our stay. Breakfast restaurant room was very nice and always well stocked with an excellent choice of food. The small bar in the Lounge area provided a good bar service and free snacks were always available with drinks. We had upgraded to a superior room when booking and upon enterning the room we were amazed how big the room was with tall ceilings and a huge bathroom. Plenty of cupboard space for clothes and a convenient concealed wall safe. Tea/ coffe making facilites for the room were provided but you need to request this at reception. We found the area around this Hotel very safe and eat Dinner close to the hotel on each night of our stay. Good restaurants we can recommend are Leoni-D'Abbruzi, Ristorante Praetoria and Mama Angela's all within 5 minutes of the Hotel. Rome was very crowded and hot as expected but plenty of places to cool of with a beer. We used the hop on/hop off red sightseeing bus which took you to all the historic sights and the metro service was good.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is too American!”
Reviews.Author: davehiller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from June 19-21, 2006. We were not impressed at all with this hotel. It was a clean hotel with a perfunctory staff, very interesting decor, and basic amenities, BUT they lacked the personal touch that smaller, family-owned hotels were able to provide. We stayed at other hotels in Venice, Florence, and Positano that had about 10-15 rooms and they were able to provide personal service that this larger hotel could not.
