Other hotels knew our names, enjoyed talking with us in the lobby about our day, provided a cocktail hour, and were able to accommodate us and our traveling schedule. Even the plentiful breakfast buffet and cappucino and coffee just didn't have the authentic flavors of the other hotels. This would be a hotel to go to if you wanted an American hotel in Italy, instead of an authentic hotel run by an Italian family.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: NikkiC040
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Canada for 3 nights from 10th-13th June for my husbands 40th birthday. Fantastic hotel, very clean, excellent breakfast and lovely bar. It must be the cheapest place in Rome to have a drink in!!! It's in a good position especially if you take the terravision bus from Ciampino airport as it is only a 5 minute walk from the drop off place to the hotel. You can walk to the main attractions which takes about 25-30 minutes or you can hop on the bus or metro which all have stops nearby. We thoroughly enjoyed Rome and would definitely use this hotel if we come again, which of course we will!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeff-Chelmsford-uk
Reviews.Content: can highly recommend the Hotel Canada in Rome. Lovely, large bedroom. Superb selection for breakfast. Very quiet area. Metro just round the corner, also bus. 10 minutes walk from central station. reasonably priced restaurants nearby. Would suggest the open-top bus tour from central bus terminal as first thing to do on arrival in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mygolfrocks
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel, deserves to be rated higher. Lovely room, large bathroom including luxurious towels!!! Breakfast will set you up for the day. For a break during the day head back to the hotel bar which is cool and relaxing - the cheapest in Rome we reckon. If we return to Rome we would definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holviews
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our choice of hotel. I contacted them in advance and had prompt friendly e-mails in return. The decor was charming and there were lovely fresh flower arrangements in the public areas. Our room was beautiful and spotlessly clean; it contained everything we could need except for tea/coffee making facilities which are only available on a first come, first served basis. Reception service was very efficient; the maid was friendly, efficient and honest (we inadvertertly left our room safe open); the breakfast staff were very cheerful and friendly; the breakfast was superb, with a huge choice and some variation every day. Our only disappointment was with the barman. The bar was a very pleasant area and the barman was efficient but quite frankly dis-interested (perhaps we did not spend enough time or money there??) It is interesting to read reviews from others who were obviously there at the same time and have quite different opinions. Overall, we will definitely visit Rome again and would most likely stay at Hotel Canada. As we flew into Rome, we met an english person who lives and works in Rome. She gave us lots of warnings about crime in the city which made us very conscious of the dangers but in reality we did not see or experience any.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Friendly staff, large clean room, right next to the Metro, good breakfast, beatiful bar / lobby with an excellent happy hour each night. To find a hotel this nice in Rome for under 200 EUR was a fantastic surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Inviting, Comfortable Hotel with Competent, Accommodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (2, 50+ parents and 2, 20+ daughters) stayed at Best Western Hotel Canada from March 25-March 29, and again April 1, 2006. We highly recommend this lovely hotel and were treated very kindly by its professional and courteous staff. When I booked our reservations on the internet, I asked for the AARP/European Seniors discount, and was informed in an email to mention this upon our arrival to get the rate. Upon checking in, I did ask for the AARP discount rate, much to the confusion of the receptionist. He knew nothing about this particular discount, so it was denied to me. Of course I was somewhat miffed, but proceeded with my two accompanying family members and all our luggage and the very agile and friendly bellman Marino into the smallish European elevator to our accommodations on the 5th floor. We were very tired and very bedraggled after the previous night's flight to CDG and that afternoon's travel. When Marino opened the door to our room, I was delighted to see a lovely generous sized bedroom with two comfortable singles and a queen size bed in an alcove. There was a pleasant seating area and table, a desk and thoughtfully placed shelves for nightstands. The bathroom was immaculate and well-appointed and also of a generous size. Best of all, my younger daughter was there to greet us, having arrived in Rome on an earlier flight and being given admittance to the room by the helpful staff (I had called from CDG to request this). After the family reunion, we left to explore the immediate neighborhood and get some dinner (and gelati!). I thanked the desk clerk for our lovely, comfortable room and he told me that he had further checked and we were entitled to a room discount and the rate was better than I expected! Wow! Things were definitely looking up! Other reviewers have commented on the number and variety of restaurants in the neighborhood of Hotel Canada. Have no fear! You will easily find plenty of reasonable and enjoyable, friendly evening dining places in the immediate area of the hotel. My particular favorite was Leoni d'Abbruzi just down the street--I described my meal there to a friend as "hauntingly delicious" and her son said, "It was so good it scared her!"--yup. That's true. If you go, make sure you order the homemade gelato for dessert....better than San Crispino IMO. But back to Hotel Canada. There is a little bar with a variety of complimentary snacks in the late afternoon, and beer, wine and even Coke prices are very reasonable for that area of Rome. Each evening we collected a bucket of ice from the friendly, courteous barman and used it to ice the copious amounts of water we drank to rehydrate from our days of hiking around the city and its sites. We appreciated this touch of home so much and we know better than to take it for granted. Breakfasts are delicious, generous and surprising items show up on the buffet tables, like frittatas and scrumptious coffee cakes and one glorious morning, even the king of cheeses! We looked eagerly for parmigiano reggiano on following mornings, but alas, no. The morning breakfast lady was somewhat comical--she wasn't too pleased with me when she profferred cafe americano like my earlier arriving husband only to have me chirp "Cappuccino, per favore!" when asked my beverage preference. She didn't offer refills on the cappuccino, but I can't say that I blame her. While schlepping our baggage from the cavernous and confusing Termini to the hotel wasn't a lot of fun, it's certainly doable. The only sketchy part of the area around Termini isn't really all that bad, and quickly left behind once you cross via Marsala and trundle up one of the smaller streets that intersect it. Still, if I could figure out how to bargain for a taxi without paying 20 euros to go--what? maybe a little less than a mile?--to the hotel, that would have been my preference. The same hotel desk man who checked us in offered to get us a cab to the airport for 45 euros, but I had already purchased our Leonardo Express tickets. A called taxi from the hotel to Termini on a Sunday morning with luggage, he patiently explained, would be ridiculously expensive, so we just dragged our junk back ourselves. Coming from other hotels on the streets around the area, we had plenty of pedestrian luggage-dragging company. Hotel Canada will definitely be our choice on any future travels to Rome. If you are staying there for a few days and purchase metro travel passes, there is a convenient and close Metro Linea B stop just up the street. Book this hotel with confidence!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: Weerhuisje
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days at this hotel based on its location and the good reviews we had read on TripAdvisor. It was a good decision to stay there. Near by Termini (about 500 metres) The room was very convenient. The bathroom was excellent. The breakfast was excellent. The first morning it was very busy and they had not enough time to fill up everything. In the neigbourhood there are plenty good restaurants. A next time we surely stay again in hotel Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Great, But...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just Spent 3 nights at the Hotel canada and had wonderful service and a beautiful room. The breakfasts were superb and evedryone was friendly. We would recomend a stay. There is a good restaurant around the corner on the first block called ristorante Praetoria. we had dinner there and what looked to be chaotic service -was actually very clued up. It is simple food cooked well and they even threw in a free starter and a digestif. Price for two with a pitcher of wine and a beer -36 euros!!!! HOWEVER, when we asked the reception to book our return taxi to the airport, they booked a private driver known to them, and not an authorised City cab. He had no running meter and tried to charge us 50 euros for a 35 euro trip! Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Warkworthian
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Rome from 5 - 10 Apr 2006. We chose the Best Western Hotel Canada in Via Vicenza, because of Trip Advisor reviews which were generally very favourable. We were not disappointed. Staff were helpful and the room and bathroom were spacious and clean. Breakfasts were excellent. "Mama Angela's" restaurant just round the corner and "I Leone D'Abruzzo" just down the street were excellent for evening meals. Would recommend a taxi after dark if venturing further afield. The Metro signs at Termini station are confusing. Lines(Linea)A & B cross at Termini. For the Vatican (Ottaviana-S Pietro)access Line A via the Line B Platform and then down another level. To avoid queues for the Vatican Museums book a guided tour in advance via the Vatican website/fax. More expensive but worth it. The week leading up to Palm Sunday is obviously when every school party in Italy & France visits Rome - and they all talk at once!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Good Value for Rome”
Reviews.Author: chibearbob
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Rome and we stayed at the Hotel Canada. We paid 176 euro's for a triple room. This is a three star hotel and I thought it was a fair price. Not cheap, but fair. We stayed in room 226. It was listed as having a queen bed but it was really two single beds together which makes a king-size bed. The other bed was a single bed. The room was good sized. The windows were very sound proof so the street traffic did not bother us at all. The bathroom was large. Everything was very clean. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Termini. We did not use a cab and had no problem dragging our suitcases. The neighborhood is very safe. In fact, the whole area around the Termini is fine. Closer to the station it seems not as nice, but I think it is just busier. Plus, there are so many people coming and going I wouldn't worry about walking in the area during the day or early evening. Now, at 2 in the AM may be another issue. There are several pizzerias, osterias & trattorias in the area serving meals before 8 PM. There are also some good ristaurante's in the area also serving full meals later. The hotel has an elevator but it is small. Only for 4 people at a time or two people with their luggage. I'd stay at the Hotel Canada again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huelva
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised at the standard of this hotel. Rooms had character and were clean. Well situated as walking distance from the Termini and around the courner from the Metro. Some good restaurants around but avoid the more commercial looking ones. Would definitely stay there again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all right boxes”
Reviews.Author: Maxandsue
Reviews.Content: Hotel was better than expected even after favourable reviews. We arrived via Terravision bus from Airport (which was found easily and only took about 35 minutes) drop off point was only 5 minute walk to hotel. Hotel lived up to reviews, spacious, clean rooms with excellent breakfast (our room 104 had a large garden balcony). Bar was pleasant with good prices (lovely cup of tea) and nibbles laid on. All staff were pleasant and helpful. All major sites can be reached via foot (if you don't mind a nice walk around 30-40 mins), although we did try out the Metro which was just around the corner from the hotel, its very cheap and easy to use but very busy so be aware of pickpockets. We had an excellent few days helped by the sun and 17 degree temps at the end of January. Would recommend this hotel and would stay here again if visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Suprise”
Reviews.Author: acdw2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to two nights, eventually found the Hotel which is quite nicely situated by the Termini, which suited us. On Checking in the Hotel was like the picture advertised, we were welcomed by a porter who took our luggage to our room. The room 422 was beyond our expectations and for 120 Euros a night was excellent value for money. The only downfall i have of this hotel was, went to have a bath and the water was brown..... not so nice but did turn out ok. The Outside noise from the maids in the morning often wake us up more than once, which was irritating after a late night. Other than the i highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “DID NOT LIVE UP TO THE HYPE!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of the reviews I read on this site and because I am a gold club member. The hotel is not bad. The breakfast was great. However, it is on the wrong side of the train station. This side is dark at night and people hang out until the wee hours. If you take the train back to your hotel after dark - this can be a little unsettling. I also thought the price (124 euros) was a little much. I did not find the staff to be helpful. The reviews I read were the opposite. If you take taxis all the time, this location is not a factor. However, from a hotel on the 'other side' -the walk is well lit and populated - even late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel lives up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Rambler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Canada for 3 nights just after Christmas 2005. We had seen several good reviews on this site and were not disappointed. The hotel is fairly small and a couple of Metro stops out from the main tourist areas but don't let this put you off.The metro station is just yards from the hotel lobby and - once you've mastered the ticket the machines- easy to use and cheap (1 euro per trip). The rooms are spacious,well decorated and clean with plenty of original features. Coffee making facilities were provided on request and the general level of service was well above what you might expect in a hotel of this class. Breakfast was good and served in a pleasant morning room. Unusually, this hotel has a very nice lounge bar area (also very cheap) with complimentary canapes. The lounge is well used in the evenings. Only complaints (well ,not much really) - the shower seems to face the wrong way over the bath (bit of a squeeze)and the ancient elevator is a bit of a challenge (although you might call it character). The hotel has no restaurant but the surrounding streets contain plenty of reasonably priced trattorias - the concierge is happy to make recommendations.You'll have to go into the Spanish Steps area or Via Veneto if you fancy something upmarket (the Hard Rock is easy to get to on the Metro if you need that burger fix.) Last tip - get the concierge to arrange any taxis for you and agree the price first with the driver(the tales about tourist rip-offs in this city ARE true and taxis are not as user friendly or as plentiful as in most other major cities).

Reviews.Title: “Lived upto the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Bob5858
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews for this hotel I had high expectations and was not disappointed. We arrived very early in the morning on the Terravision bus from Ciampino airport. The hotel is a few minutes walk from where the bus drops passengers off at Termini station (it is conveniently located up a side street just across the road from the bus dropping off point). I must admit I wondered whether I had chosen the best location as we walked up this side street at night (although it was well lit). However, we never experienced any problems at all with the area in our seven days there. We were warmly greeted on arrival and shown to a comfortable spacious room with large bathroom. The room was triple glazed to keep out any road noise as our room was fronted by a main road. The glazing worked very effectively and we had no problem sleeping. The quality of breakfast was very good and the restaurant staff were always very helpful and pleasant. The bar area of the hotel was great for relaxation in the evening with very reasonable prices and some nice snacks laid on. Whilst we were there the hotel has some novello wine tasting evenings during which one could sample italian cheeses, meats, olives and bread washed down by some fine wines - at no cost whatsoever! The location does mean that you have to walk a little to get to some of the central sights but the effort is nothing for any reasonably mobile person. If pushed the underground network is accessible outside the hotel on the main road or alternatively at Termini station a few minutes away. We only used it once to get to St Peter's basilica and the Vatican Museum. The bus station is also at Termini. I would recommend this hotel for its quiet, relaxed style and would definately stay there again if in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Classic”
Reviews.Author: chantl01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel based on its location and the good reviews we'd read on TripAdvisor. Definitely a good decision. Well located, close to both the metro and train/bus to airports. Found an amazing bookstore for automobile fanatics just down the street (on Via Marsala). The hotel itself was beautifully decorated and maintained, we loved the decor in the room. The bedroom was spacious for a double in europe and the bathroom was particularly well-appointed and functional. We loved the breakfast, there was so much selection. Ask for a cafe latte or a cappuccino - wonderful! My only minor complaints would be that although we were in a non-smoking room, when some of our neighbours would smoke, you could smell a bit of the cigarette smoke in our room. As well, the high-speed internet is only available in the lobby/lounge area and at one point it wasn't available and it took my husband suggesting the hotel staff reset their server to get the signal back again. Both minor issues given the quality and convenience of this hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “GEM OF A HOTEL IN A CAPITAL CITY”
Reviews.Author: Dumbeldore
Reviews.Content: As the title suggests this was a gem of a hotel particularly bearing in mind it was a capital city. We had a deluxe room which was fantastic, very spacious comfortable with a large bathroom Lounge is very nice. Breakfast good for a continental hotel. Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: dmhunt
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our 2 kids in a triple with a cot. Plenty of room - surprisingly large rooms for a European hotel. Good size bath with shower/tub. Front desk staff was so-so - breakfast was fine for a continental meal - excellent location - about 5 minutes walk from Termini and less to metro station. Numerous resturants close by so it was easy to eat with the kids and get back to the hotel. Would definitely stay again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: follower
Reviews.Content: I queationed the accuracy of the reviews of this hotel as they were so uncritical. I was wrong -it is a really excellent choice and good value for money. Very clean with good size rooms and helpful,friendly service. Good,safe location but you will need to crack the bus routes to get most flexible travel around Rome. Deserves more than a 3 star rating. The breakfast will keep you going until the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: DonnaCH
Reviews.Content: The bedroom and bathroom were both well furnished, and clean. The hotel staff was always helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet provided something for everyone. Even though the hotel does not have a restaurant, there are several nice ones on the neighboring streets. In addition, the hotel was close to a grocery store, the main railway station, and the subway stop (Castro Pretorio) so getting around Rome was not at all difficult. I would recommend this hotel if you are trying to travel within a budget and yet would like to have nice accommodations, breakfast, etc. A twin room was 158 euro including breakfast for 2 and all taxes. Don't forget that AARP or senior discounts are available on a limited number of rooms even abroad. Ask when making reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose the Best Western Hotel Canada after reading reviews on this site and glad I did. It was about a five minute walk from the train station. Go out of the right side of the train station as you depart the trains rather than the front of the train station. Cross the street and continue down that block. Make a left onto any cross street to get to the next block. This will be Via Vincenza. Turn right and the hotel will be down the street on the left (just about at the end of Via Vincenza). The Metro is around the corner from the Hotel. We had one of the biggests rooms in the hotel, which did have air conditioning. The room was very quiet. There is a quaint elevator which does hold two people and their luggage. The breakfast had quite a large selection which included several hot dishes. It turned out, it was the only hotel we stayed at in Italy which offered hot dishes for breakfast. We had drinks at their bar, where the prices were surprisingly very low. Down the street from the hotel, about one block, was I Leoni D'Abruzzo, a great restaurant. Rather than eat outside, we went downstairs to eat inside. The food was very good and the menu extensive. We went back the next night and tried other things on their menu, which, again was very good. I definitely would recommend this hotel. The location, breakfast, rooms, and bar were great. On a side note, I would like to mention a bus tour we took. It was the "Citysightseeing Roma" open tour bus. We picked it up in front of Basilica S. Maria Maggiore. I do NOT recommend this tour bus. You do not get to see anything but Piazza Venezia and the Vatican Piazza. We got off at stop four for the Forum but had a hard time finding it. We had to wait over an hour for another bus to come by to get back on. In the meantime, we saw at least eight-ten other tour buses go by, which were all the same tour bus company--I believe it was the Red 110 bus company. "Citysightseeing" just tells you this is the stop for the Forum, but doesn't tell you where it is. Or this is the stop for the Coloseum and Forum, but they do not even pass the coloseum. Red 110 bus goes past it.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: McLean4
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Canada based on the reviews on this site, and we could not have been more pleased with the choice. We enjoyed all aspects of our stay. Clean, rather spacious rooms. Good bed/bedding. Nice bathrooms. Excellent breakfast. Good location and transportation options. And the staff were outstanding and went out of their way to help and make our family feel welcome. I work in the travel industry and our children (age 8 and 12) who have stayed at some of the finest hotels and resorts -- and they loved the charm of this hotel. The family that runs this property has done a great job restoring and maintaining the hotel and staffing it with team of people who make sure their guests have a special and memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hols3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Canada for 6 nights in August in a quadruple room. To say this hotel rates at three star does not do it justice it should definately have a four star rating. Everyone from the staff on the desk to the ladies in the breakfast room could not have been any nicer or more helpful. The tours recommended by the hotel were excellent and the little guide book given by the hotel on our arrival was much better than our expensive one we had taken with us. The surrounding restaurants were very good and very reasonably priced. The room we were given was spotless and extra pillows and tea and coffee making facilities were delivered to our room almost as soon as we requested them on arrival. Thanks to the Canada for making our stay in Rome so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MKKim
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of July. The room was large and cool - particularly welcome in the hot weather. The breakfast was delicious and the staff friendly. Mama Angelo's restaurant round the corner was fantastic and very reasonable. The second time we visited we were treated like old friends and were given free champagne. On our last night we went back again and were treated like family - more free champagne and liqueurs. The maitre D is particularly entertaining - just spend some time watching him reel in the customers! The sights were as expected - spectacular - particularly the Colloseum and the Vatican - although the crush to get into the Sistine Chapel was a bit disappointing as you were herded through far too fast. If you get a chance to visit St Paul's Basillica just outside the city walls, it is well worth it - even more spectacular the St Peter's. We will definitely go back to Rome and when we do we will book again into the Best Western Canada hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a stay at the Hotel Canada, personally I don't think it can be beaten on location, price, atmosphere, value for money. The hotel itself is 5 minutes walk from Termini Station (where the Teravision bus from the airport drops off/picks up), this is also the main bus/metro station - the intersection of the 2 metro lines. However it is even nearer the Castro Pretorio station which is on the B line - Colosseum, Roman Forum, Palatine Hill. There are numerous restaurants in the vacinity, asking for recommendations at the reception desk is advised as we were given discount vouchers for 2 restaurants, both of which we visited and both of which were very good. We had a deluxe room (4 poster bed!)in the hotel, but friends stayed in a standard room which we equally a spacious and well equiped - even toothbrush and toothpaste in the bathroom. All of the staff were very friendly and spoke english and nothing was too much bother. The hotel also has a bar (open from about 4.30pm) - which had the cheapest drinks we found in Rome, plus canapes/nuts/crisps were on offer all night. Breakfast was good - typically continential - bread, cheese, pastries - plus bacon and eggs. A couple of tips - 1) buy your ticket for the Colosseum up on Palatine Hill - saves joining a very long queue at the colosseum ticket office, instead you walk straight to the entrance. 2) arrive at the Vatican as early as possible - we arrived 40 minutes before it opened and found the queues ok, once it opened it only took 8 minutes to get inside 3) Visit Santa Maria Maggiore - a fantastic Basillica between Termini Station and the Colosseum - it contains a 'mini' Sistine Chapel which is my opinion was more spectacular than the original 4) Don't forget to take a shawl/wrap/cardigan to cover you shoulders when visiting Basilicas, also no shorts. In short, we've already decided to go back next year with the kids as they have rooms which can sleep 4 - a queen and 2 twin beds!

Reviews.Title: “Added to the pleasure of Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel during the first week of June 2005. The room itself was very lovely. Nicely appointed, with high ceilings and a double door that led out to a small balcony. It was great to be able to let fresh air into the room (not like most hotel rooms!). The room/bathroom were both very clean and the hotel provided slippers/toothbrushes/toothpaste etc. not usually found in this type of establishment. I would definitely rate this hotel higher than a 3 1/2 star hotel-it's more a 4 star. The staff were very friendly and accomodating and answered all of our questions re: touring around Rome. The hotel has a nice bar in the lobby which at night was a treat after a long day walking (and they provided little snacks for free!). We spent three nights here and would definitely go back. The location near the train station was also very convenient and walkable (provided you're not disabled or carrying a lot of luggage). We had one bag each and a carry on and this was easily managed. And the metro is just around the corner. I very highly recommend this hotel. The only thing the hotel should work on is the phone system. Apparently you can't make a collect call from the room home unless you use your credit card? This should be simplified somehow. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights and we could not be more pleased the staff was extremely friendly and the rooms were very clean. The breakfast was well presented and had a good variety of dishes. Diffiently a good choice

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A short trip for Terminii on the Underground (and the implied ease of connection to the airport), coupled with a very tasteful interior and pleasant staff make this choice well worth trying. We travelled as three adults (two touring and one on business) and found the convenience to transportation and the center of Rome hard to beat. The rooms were well-kept and comfortable. Breakfast was ample and we'd stay here again...for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good: Hotel; Location; Value; Staff”
Reviews.Author: cannylad1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a 3 day city break in June 2005. The location is great if you arrive at Ciampino and make use of the 'Terravision' bus service (€16 return) from the airport to Termini Railway Station from which the hotel is a 5 minute walk. It's also well situated for using the Metro to get around the city. The hotel itself was very clean and comfortable. Our room included a small sitting room which was pleasant after a long day of sightseeing. The bathroom was also very clean with a plentiful supply of hot water and complimentary 'smellies' etc. There was no mini-bar in the room, but the extremely friendly and accommodating staff are happy to supply ice should you require it. Other than the excellent buffet breakfast, the hotel only caters for snacks, but there are plenty of varied eateries nearby (the trattoria 'Leoni d'Abruzzo', a few minutes walk from the hotel was superb!).

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: BizFunNow
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 3 day stay at this comfortable hotel in February 2005. The staff was very professional. The breakfast food and room were wonderful. Our hotel room was nice with a large, clean washroom. The hotel's location is great. We walked to train station (5-10min) and Metro Blue line stop (2 min). There is a direct line between the airport and the train station. There is a small food place next to the train station that has the best pizzas we ever tasted. The hotel staff put out umbrellas for guests to use when it rained. We thought that was very thoughtful. The cost was about 180-215 Euro per night for a family of four in one room.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but not great for those with a small baby”
Reviews.Author: Monkstown_traveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 days at the start of of January 2004. Our son was 4 months old at the time and hence we thought (rightly) that we would end up spending more time in our hotel room than we have in the past - when we really just used our hotel as a place to sleep. The staff in the hotel are very friendly from the reception through to the ladies in the breakfast room. We went for a deluxe room as we wanted somewhere for the travel cot - which the hotel supplied - which was away from our bed so we watch TV etc. after he went sleep. The cost was EUR155 per night which we felt was only OK for the overall package (location, facilities in the room / hotel etc.). The two elements that meant it wasn't great for us were the 1) location and 2) lack of room service. We had to take a taxi to most of the historical stuff and shopping - essentially it's close to transport links but not really near anything. Also as we had a young baby we couldn't go out in the evening to restaurants however room service only offered sandwiches. In fairness to the hotel they had no problem with us getting 'take-away' meals form local restaurants however eating from take away delivery boxes wasn't what we'd anticipated or hoped for. If we go again with a small baby we'd probably try to find a discount bargain in some 4 star hotel even if it meant teh location being a liitle worse.
